text: 330ml bottle. Cloudy mahogany pour, full beige head, some lacing. Raisins and spice, yeasty bready nose. Nice full bodied brew, malt, chocolate, light funk, delicious.
Hazy brown appearance with short white head. Caramel, light spicey and som fruity aroma. Taste of malt, spices, brown sugar and discrete dried fruit.

Lekker donker biertje,zoet en niet bitter, heeft aan het einde een beetje een stout smaak.

Color marron, predominio total de laas maltas, fruta madura, un dulzor que se hace incluso pesado, cansino. No es mi estilo

Pours with a large and fluffy light brown head. Color is clear dark amber. Fruity and filling aroma has coffee and cappucino, roasted nuts, salty malt, light salty fish note, faint licorice aroma and a plethora of other faint aromas. The aroma is rather complex. Palate is very nice, carbonation is a bit weak, but suitable for the style. Quite rich taste is like a "watered down" stout. There¬ís a pronounced raisin note. Warming alcohol feels in the throat. Malty sweetness spreads to the mouth. The taste is tasty, but less complex than the aroma. Very filling and satisfying beer though and therefore very good value.

On tap at the Cafe Gollem Raamsteeg in Amsterdam. Brown pour with huge beige head. Aroma is almost overwhelming with dark fruits. Taste is sweet and complex and, oh, so good. Full mouthfeel. Wonderful and delicious!

En botella. Pr√°cticamente sin espuma. Al ojo, muy l√≠quida, de color marr√≥n con destellos rojizos. Muy fresca a la nariz, aunque los tonos dulzones que presenta se esfuman r√°pidamente. De sabor dulz√≥n pero para nada empalagoso.

Prachtig duister robijnrode kleur en mooie cr√®meige schuimkraag. Zoete zachte caramelaroma met hinten van fruit. Zacht met een mooie uitgebreide volle smaak die zich heerlijk in de afdronk ontwikkeld. Ietsje waterig. Een mooie balans tussen iets meer zoet en bitter. Een warm mooi smaakpalet. Doet nauwelijks onder voor de blauwe Keijzer. Aanrader!!

Some caramel, candi sugar, slightly roasted but mostly sweet and deliciously so ( for a change... ): creamy, suggestions of sourness or wine. Alcohol well hidden though still present, mouthfeel very creamy, like butterscotch, carbonation really soft. It is a very sweet beer but I really enjoyed it although one is probably enough.

Donker bier, zeer rijk aroma, een absolute aanrader voor ieder die voor de afwisseling een zoeter bier wil proberen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Colore ambrato, schiuma compatta e persistente. A naso malto, pane e frutti rossi. All¬íassaggio ciliegia, vaniglia e marcate note vinose. Finale leggermente alcolico, corpo sostanzioso, birra accattivante molto equilibrata e facile da bere nonostante la gradazione.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Donkerbruin tot robijnrood helder bier met stevig beige schuimkraag. Aroma van pruimen en perzik. Smaak is fruitig en caramelachtig. Nasmaak is licht bitter.

From old tasting notes. Cloudy deep copper brown color. Large rocky beige head. Complex, fruity toasted malt nose with an underlying vinous nature. Tangy, rich malty foretaste is fruity and complex. Finishes dry and mildly tangy. Lightly carbonated. Intense without being obtrusive. Strong but not cloying. Very good.

Pours in deep copper colour with medium size off-white head. Aroma of raisins, bread, wine. Medium sweet, low bitterness, no sourness. Medium body, oily feel, refreshing aftertaste with alcohol warmth.

Botella 0,33L Color rojizo oscuro, espuma - de cafe, fina muy alta, muy presentable y resistente.Aroma caramelo, frutas,cereza,vino. Sabor suave dulzor, frutas, caramelo,muy fresco,alcohol no se nota. Postgusto queda suave dulzor y aparece un toque fino de amargor.

Pours hazy brown/amber with a short-lasting, off-whtie head. The aroma contains dried fruits, grapefruit, wine, butterscotch, malt, some wood and spices. It tastes light bitter and medium sweet with a hint of sour. The finish is long, sweetish and warming due to the alcohol. Full body, oily/sticky texture, medium carbonation. Complex in aroma and just managing to not become too cloying.

La Classic es una cerveza de carbonataci√≥n m√°s bien alta lo que le confiere una amplia corona de esponjosa espuma color vainilla. Su color es hipn√≥tico, entre marr√≥n y rojizo.

En nariz tiene mucha complejidad. Bueno, todo en ella es complejo. Huele a fruta muy madura. Melocot√≥n e higo. Adem√°s hay otras notas dulzonas como el caramelo.

En boca confirma su car√°cter frutal, como he dicho fruta muy dulce y madura, incluso pasas, y ojo a su final que depara una agradable sorpresa ya que sin darte casi cuenta pasas de los dulces afrutados a un agradable y persistente amargor que redondea una de las mejores cervezas que he probado nunca.

Bottle from Verheyen, Poppel (BE). Pours a very dark amber with a dark brown hue. Foam is tan/beige in colour, dissipating quickly into a long-lasting film that remained the entire time. Aroma: Sweet, raisins, dried fruit, banana, figs, faint aroma of the sourness of wine coming through, with a slightly metallic smell encapsulating it all. One of the few times where I didn¬ít mind the metallic though. Taste; Very sweet at first, then dark malts, raisins, caramel and a slight bitter. Aftertaste of the same, accompanied by a slight hint of red wine. Overall, this one is a bit too sweet for my liking, but the qualities underlying this sweetness still make this brew shine. A very fine Belgian Dark. The up-front sweetness quickly gives way for a very sophisticated taste.
CiemnobrƒÖzowe. ≈örednia piana. W aromacie wi≈õnia i karmel. Bardzo s≈Çodkie. Cukier.

Gekocht op 28/01/2017 bij bierhandel Verhelst in Dendermonde. Gouden Carolus Classic Collectors Edition 2016 - De Vossenjacht is een helder rood biertje dat een normale hoeveelheid schuim met een licht-amber kleurtje produceert, het ziet er romig-moussig uit en blijft goed aan het glas kleven. Het schuim zakt na een tijdje wel in elkaar. Je kan tamelijk wat fijne CO2 belletjes zien opborrelen. Het aroma van de Gouden Carolus Classic Collectors Edition 2016 - De Vossenjacht is zoetig met wat stroop en karamel, fruitig met lichtjes krieken op jenever, geroosterde en karamelmout en een wijnachtige toets. De smaak is zoet met rozijnen, de krieken op jenever en ook moutig, gebrand en karamel, ook wat lichtjes jeneverbes kruidig. In de mond geeft Gouden Carolus Classic Collectors Edition 2016 - De Vossenjacht een volle smaak met een olieachtige tot romige textuur en is hij normaal prikkelend. Zeker en vast een harmonieus biertje. De nasmaak vloeit uit is zoet met wat karamel en toch wat bitterig. Ook de jeneverbes zit in de nasmaak verweven. Een zeer lekker drankje dat niet verveelt.

Dark brown with small white-off head, spotted lacing. Sweet malty aroma, ripe fruit, Belgian yeast. Taste is malty, ripe fruits, candy sugar and caramel, Belgian yeast. Not boozy, tasty and easily drinkable. Sweet, smooth and medium bodied, softly carbonated. A good Belgian.
Robe brune mousse √©crue √©paisse. Nez fruits rouges, raisins. Bouche raisins, sucr√©e. Tr√®s bonne.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with medium sized tan head. Aroma is yeast, dried fruits, banana and mild Belgian hops. Taste has sweet dried fruits, yeast and some banana. Bit too sweet for me but overall really nice beer.

Creamy beige head stayed on a very dark brown still body. 
Malt, brown sugar & dark berry aroma. 
Very creamy & smooth on the palate with a slight tingle on the back. 
Dark berries, malt, banana, raisins, cloves, demerara sugar & very slightly woody/sour aft.
Brown colured with beige not persistent hat. Toasted caramel and raisins flavour with sweet taste that covers well the alcoholic component. Slight bitter end. Very drinkable. Surprised by
Huge caramel toffee notes. Sweet malty taste, smooth drinking beer with alcohol well hidden.

From a bottle into a snifter. Vintage 2015. Pours slightly clear brown with reddit hue, beige head that dissipates quickly. Nose is molasses, yeast, raisins, caramel. Some wine like nose character, white grapes. Medium body, sweet, high soft carbonation, slightly dry finish long burnt sugar. Great flavors easy to drink and interesting.

Donker robijnrood , donkere bijna licht bruine schuimkraag, troebel, wat koolzuur langs het glas. 
Aroma: Donker fruit, l geroosterde mout, zoete mouten, brood, karamel, Belgische gist/fruitige esters.
Smaak: Start is flink zoet en heel licht metalig, karamel en candijsuiker, moutig, brood/deeg, donker fruit, rozijnen, iets chocolade, fruitige esters, iets wijnachtig met een licht zuurtje en een hele lichte bitter. Wat alcohol en wat kruidigheid geven een prettige warmte.
Volle body, aktief koolzuur maar toch zacht en romig, afdronk is licht bitter en kruidig. 
Lekker en mooi in balans.

I had to buy a Christmas sampler pack with a glass to get this beer. Sigh, stupid LCBO, we didn¬ít even get Cuv√©e Van De Keizer Blauw this year. Aaanyway... this is a very solid dark beer with lots of malt and dried fruit, with a underlying sweetness that is a touch cloying. Very full bodied, nice yeasty undertones with just a touch of booze. Well worth the Carolus mixer pack.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Copper brown colour. Very fruity. Plums, raisins, bread, subtle caramel, banana, hints of figs. Almost some floral notes. Not much bitterness. Sweetness.

Bottle. BB Date Oct 2011; Drank Nov 2009. Dark ruby red in colour. Vinous; port-like. Very Malty; sweet malts, caramel, toffee, candy brown sugar, chocolate. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums. Spicy and yeasty. Rich, smooth. Very sweet malty throughout. Spicy & fruity finish. A really lovely beer! (2009-11)

Cerveza color caf√© oscuro turbio. Aroma a levadura belga, toques dulces y algo de frutas secas. Al paladar ligera carbonatacion cuerpo medio, con notas dulces (az√∫car morena), algo de chocolate, frutos oscuros secos. Excelente cerveza. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Opaque mahogany liquid. Fine tall ivory head. Well-lacing. Complex aroma basing on esters, phenols & dark malts that give bitter chocolate and just a hint of coffee and smoke. Later an earthy note shows. Full on body, well-rounded. The flavour starts with smooth solventy phenols followed by dark chocolate, bread, caramel, dried fruit. A touch of hoppy bitterness on ending is a good finish. I wish there were a tiny bit more hops. No surprises here, just a beer of perfect quality.

Dark brown going into black, thin slightly off-white head, decent retention and some lacing. Aroma shows belgian yeast and brown sugar with notes of dark chocolate and a slight warming feel. Overall nice but not too vivid. While the aroma seemed to be a little ¬ídrowned¬í in sugar the taste unfolds a much brighter range of flavours. Sweet malts (caramel) and a sweet sugary feel giving way to a very nice range of flavours: dark chocolate, dark/dried fruits, anise, slight liqueur/warming, a hint of earthyness. Overall obviously sweet but nicely attenuated by a pleasant fruity/liqueur finish. Medium to dense body with average carbonation (not too high for the style), creamy and silky at the same time. A flavourful and most of all wonderfully balanced strong dark ale. Excellent.
Bouteille 33 cl - couleur brune rubis, mousse beige, odeur de banane, de chocolat, go√ªt sur le malt, le caramel, torrifi√©, une bonne brune

2017/01/23 - Pours a dark ruby-brown colour with a soapy, khaki coloured head that slowly reduces and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is Belgian yeast, lots of dark fruits (raisins, plumbs, cherries, figs), port-like notes, brown sugar, tobacco, toffee and a hint of smoke. Taste is brown sugar, port, figs, raisins, plumbs and Belgian yeast with smokey and earthy notes. Mouthfeel is full and silky with sharp carbonation and long, moderately sweet and mildly warming finish that I found lightly medicinal. Really nice.

Tried as part of a winter mixer pack. Drank from glass supplied in the pack. Smells sweet with a slight bitterness. Pours a dark golden brown with head that dissipates immediately. Taste is of a Belgian ale, with more malts, and not quite as sweet. Good carbonation. No aftertaste. Overall I was very happy with this beer, and I hope to buy again next year. MB. The Beer "Bear"on

Bottle. Clear dark ruby body, medium beige head with good retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of sour cherry jam, leather, plum, a touch of spices and yeast. Taste of yeast, plums, sour cherries, vanilla and woodsy notes. Not even a hint of booze. Fantastic brew.

Sweet aroma of plum and spices. Pours a dark brown with a small tanned head. Taste of chocolate, licorice, raisin - very sweet and moreish with a bold, sweet and chocolatey finish with a slight hint of smoke. Very drinkable.
Bottle. Dark brown with cream top. Light sweet aroma of malts and barn. Sweet caramel taste with malts, dark fruits, liquorice, alcohol, brown sugar and a hint of barn. Fizzy bittersweet aftertaste.

Pours such a deep red as to be almost black, with a tan head. Aroma is malty with hints of caramel. Taste is fairly sweet but not excessive with a bit of saltiness. Notes of malt, plums and caramel, and beneath that hints of chocolate, tobacco and wine and an earthy hoppiness. Alcohol is a bit too noticeable. Full bodied with lots of carbonation. Very good!
black, clear, frothy, tan foam, chocolate, nuts, earthy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, full body, thick feel, creamy, flat, long finish,
Bottle from a good Belgian friend named Olivier. Many thanks! Aroma of dried plums, caramel, chocolate, lebkuchen. Taste mirrors the aroma. Boozy lebkuchen in a bottle. Very good!

I guess this is what Tuborg Classic tries to be but fails. Dark reddish amber with a short lasting head and lively carbonation. Aroma and taste is mostly malt and yeast with a slightly bitter aftertaste

Aroma profundo a caramelo, malta, licor; como si viniera de un ambiente cerrado, realmente potente. From a 3L bottle. Merry christmas. Great belgian yeast aroma with deep plum and stuff. Round and ¬íbrown¬í flavours. Fresh mouthfeel. Lovely caramel and malty aftertaste.
A classic it is, haven¬ít drunk it for a long time. Everything is very good, but it just misses the wow of today.
Bottle in the Belgian Bar, Altrincham. Ruby with a cream head. Red fruits aroma. The taste is full and fruity. Spicy with red fruits, christmas cake and port. Very nice.

Bottle bought in Brugge as a Christmas present. Deep dark reddish-brown with a thin head. Has a sweet and soapy aroma, with a smooth tasting sweetness in its taste. It doesn¬ít quite feel its strength through a pleasant milkiness.

Oscura y fuerte. Sus matices de levadura belga son muy intensos. Banana, fruta madura, etc. -acompa√±an perfectamente cada trago. Al subir la temperatura salen especias y toffe redondeando el conjunto.

Nez tr√®s gourmand, sur le caramel, la r√©glisse, la marmelade, le sirop d¬í√©rable, le pain d¬í√©pice, la frangipane, le chocolat et le caf√©... Superbes malts... Du fruit, avec de la banane s√©ch√©e, de la poire, de la pomme rouge, de la datte et de la figue, du pruneau, du cassis, de la fraise, de la groseille. En cherchant bien il y en a d¬íautres... Un poil d¬íagrume avec des pointes de citron vert. L¬íalcool est bien pr√©sent mais exalte les ar√¥mes. Splendide ! Bouche ronde, souple, tr√®s √©quilibr√© entre l¬íalcool et les saveurs sucr√©es. Backlog, Bottle shared by Pat, Pours reddish brown with a very creamy beige head, nice lacing webs on the glass. Aroma is plum, vanilla, wood, dates, spice, pepper, and mocha coffee chocolate. Body is medium with an ultra warming finish in the chest. Lots of complex belgian notes in this offering.
Shared 33cl bottle. Pours a very dark amber with a persistent beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, raisins. Taste is dark fruit, raisins, plum, caramel, malty. Sweet finish.

A bottle from l¬íApero off-licence, drunk at home. Aroma: very, rich, toffee, chocolate. Appearance: clear, very dark brown, minimal head. Palate: thick and full-bodied, soft carbonation. Long, very complex finish. Taste: heavily sweet, but not overwhelming. a pleasure to drink.

330ml bottle from LCBO. 8.5%alc./vol. Pours a murky brown colour with one finger of head that reduces into a film. Aromas of plums, raisins, dark fruits, toffee, licorice and some oak. Taste matches the aroma, Toffee flavour is pronounced with notes of caramel. Sweet malty finish. Reminds me of Rochefort 10. Full bodied with moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with thick light brown head. Aroma is candy, caramel, smoke, cocoa, licorice. Taste is very sweet with cocoa, coffee, candy, alcohol, licorice.
Bottle from Real Ale Store, Newark. Deep ruby colour with a thick tan head. Aroma has caramel light spice and stewed fruit sweetness. Taste caramel sweet light bitter, and a touch of yeast.

the aroma is fruity and caramel with hints of raisin, sweet wine, candy, bisquit, toffee and dried fruits... the taste is caramel, fruity and spicy with notes of port, raisin, dried fruits, toffee, licorice and spicy grasses... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Soyeux, ce liquide m¬íappara√Æt profond√©ment sexy. Il me serait facile de d√©guster cette bi√®re r√©guli√®rement.
Zeer verfrissend en fruitige smaak. Alhoewel het 9% is proef je de alcohol niet zo overdreven. Heeft award voor beste bier 2012 gewonnen.
Bottle. Mahogany-tan color, thin foam. Aroma: powerful esters and alcohols, dried fruits, candied jam, port wine. Taste: strong, malty, dried fruits and raisins, alcohols, but very soft, warming.

Jolie robe brun-rouge avec une l√©g√®re mousse ivoire .

Aroma: very malty with few belgian spices; Appearance: rich dark brown/cola colored with off white head that dissipates fairly slowly; Taste: follows nose, with too much malt for my taste, which is disappointing; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, malty finish. Overall: not what I was hoping for. Would not buy again.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2016 Dunkle,schwer, sehr s√º√ü und daher auch elixierartig. In der Nase was anger√∂stetes und viel Gew√ºrz/Kr√§uteraroma. Definitiv ein Winter/Kaminbier. 0,25l/? vom Hahn im CAFE DE KLIKSPAAN in Groningen.
Spiced cough-syrup sweet aroma. Murky brown-red color with a sudsy white head. Cherry and spiced sweet flavors.

33cl bottle at Sportbar Time Out, Waarschoot (24 VIII 2016). Listed on the beer map as "Carolus Donker". This is the "classic" Malines brown ale, which has already yielded worldwide recognition and hence global beer awards. The appearance is a lovely smooth black ale with reddish gloom. On top there is a quite long lasting, yellow pale beige coloured collar. The brew already has a kind off sticky body - which looks appealing. The nose contains huge amounts of malts, a lingering bitterness, dish water and a coffee backbone. These coffee flavoures actually are downtuned towards a cup of watery, weak coffee. Also, the nose is flavoured with keen yeast features, brown sugar, and some cellar, dust, dirt and even turf notes - making this a truly Belgian styled brown ale. Apart from the interesting coffee touch, I would not value this ale as an appealing world-class brew. I¬ím glad the taste is the trump card for this Gouden Carolus Classic. The mouthfeel is rather medium than heavy sweet, with a firm dextrose hint. One can even discover standard sugar cubes, making the sweetness rather artificial. The body itself does not account for a super strong backbone. The malts have a crisp grains feeling, on the tongue there is a certain degree of oxydation: I know this brew can age very well, yet I would drink this bottle fresh without metallic annoyances. The mouthfeel also has a fruityness, alas with a too abrupt finish, but it is allright. Think of dry fruit, blue berries even, unripe strawberries. Almost too subtle, there are sour dashes present. The warming alcohol feature is perfectly balanced, built around the taste sensation. All in all, this wellknown brew is not top notch. But the looks and taste aren¬ít bad, for sure, with well balanced coffee and fruity aspects.

L:
-pours a clear brown with ruby tinges and a big,foamy,sand-coloured head
-low to medium carbonation visible
S:
-caramel,toffee,strawberries,chocolat carbonation
-light to medium body
-no alcohol detectable
O:
Tastes more like an English Strong Ale rather than a typical Belgian Dark.
I really like this.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of sweet roasted malt along with some solvent and very little yeast. Full body with low carbonation and heavy (maybe a little too much) sweetness and rather alcoholic. Taste of roasted malt, molasses and sugar melon. Very characteristic beer.
0,75l bottle. Pours dark brown with beige head. Thick almost creamy mouthfeel. Plums, sugar, raisin. Heavy sweetness, medium bitterness. One of the best.

Botella 33 cl en el Lupulo Junio 2009 (r1448). Lote 0730147 hasta 23..05..2010. Colecci√≥n. Belga original con sabores maltosos y 8.5 vol que se notan desde el principio. Sensaci√≥n de licor. Bastante buena.

Ruskea, hieman punertava ja sameahko olut pienehk√∂ll√§, mutta pitk√§√§n kest√§v√§ll√§ vaahdolla. Tuoksu houkuttelevan makean belgihiivainen, hieman aniksinen, kyps√§n hedelm√§inen ja karamellinen. Maku jatkaa samalla linjalla ollen pehme√§n karamellinen ja makean maltainen, kyps√§n hedelm√§inen ja loppupuoleltaan hieman suolaisen ja pippurisen humaloitu sek√§ aniksinen. Keskit√§ytel√§inen/t√§ytel√§inen suutuntuma, makean tahmainen. Aika helposti juotava makea tumma belgi, mutta ihan mielenkiintoinen ja laadukas kokonaisuus.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma is malty and sweet with dried and overripe fruits and slightly fruity. Also slightly roasted. Taste is complex, malty and sweet with caramel, dried fruits with figs and dates, and hints of roasted malts. Finish is surprisingly dry despite the sweetness.
Robijnrood bier, met een fruitige neus. In het smaakpalet kom je rozenbottel, aardbei, en specerijen tegen. Ook is de hop aanwezig. Mooi bier.
Bottle from Plzen. Pours opaque black. Nose of fig rolls, christmas cake, cinnamon. Taste is full bodied and well rounded. Complex, really interesting flavour.

33cl BBE 19/05/2019 a fresh one. Aroma of faro sugars and barley wine. Thick malty nose. Pours nearly black with slightly beige head and beautiful lacing. Medium sweet and malty. Not ashy, not burnt but pleasantly roasted. Thick and heavy bodied beer. Creamy, smooth but with a tad bit sugary and slick finish. Perfect medium carbonation for a BSA. A very solid beer that can handle massive aging.

330 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. The pour is a dark ruby tinted brown color with a thick tan colored head and a lot of soapy lace. The aroma is full of sweet chocolate, caramel, and dark fruits. This is pretty good. Lots of sweet dark fruit. I¬ím a fan of that mild imbalance. The flavor is just as malty as you¬íd expect. A touch woody with a lovely dark fruit and caramel complexity. It¬ís surprisingly good. The malts are sweet and caramelized. The fruit carries it out to the finish. The mouth feel is thicker and nice with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly sweet, woody, and fruity malt. It¬ís really a surprise, I¬ím not going to lie.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is caramel malt, dark fruit, booze, really nice. Appearance is dark brown, light tan head, mostly clear. Taste is dark trout, caramel, candy, butterscotch, rich, woody, booze. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dark fruit and yeast aftertaste. Overall, solidly good.

33cl bottle. Pours dark brown like a coke with medium head. Head fades quickly but left a bit Belgian lace. Aroma is not that intense then i expected but it was quite nice. Especially dry fruits, raisin and toffee. I loved the texture and palate, It was smooth as silk. No alcohol feeling at all. Quite sweet taste and long finish. Loved that beer. Well example for its kind
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Drucken p√• tap p√• Beerwall i Brugge. M√∂rk n√∂tbrun med smutsvit skumkrona. S√∂t doft av pumpa, torkad frukt och rostad karramemalt. Smak av detsamma. V√§lbalanserad kropp.
UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Provsmakning beerwall, brygge. Mahognyf√§rgad. Kn√§ckig doft med torkad frukt. S√∂taktig smak av sirap och torkad frukt. Liknande i smak

11.2 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with a thine tan head. Taste is of roasted malt, caramel, molasses, dark fruit and toffee. Dark fruit, molasses and malt aroma. Has a full body with a warming finish. The finish reminds me of sake. Quite excellent.

1976 33cL bottle shared by Dennis on 6/10/16.Still carbonated and though the head retention¬ís not immense, the fact it still pours a dark beige head at all is very impressive. Golden-mahogany body shows good clarity.Cloves and brown sugar slowly emerge from their dusty, musty slumber. Light vanilla and even a touch of honey. Pretty incredible how well this has resisted the less desirable oxidative notes. No cardboard or soy.Light bubble gum, clove, brown sugar and some old toffee and cellar all give a tired but still pretty impeccable flavor. Soft, malty texture and moderately engaging carbonation. Not my favorite brewery (not a big fan of the yeast and sweetness) but you have to respect how well the stuff ages.

Pours a dark brown with a reddish hue, some light lacing. This looks like a classic Belgian Strong Ale. Nose has some dried fruit - date, currant, maybe. Malt, sweet dried fruit, caramel. A really pleasant body, smooth, full, but not tipping its hand on the high ABV. Really nice, easy-drinking Belgian strong.

On tap. Pours a hazy deep red-brown with a thin, beige head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, dark fruit, port wine and light cinnamon. Sweet flavour of dark fruit, caramel malt, brown sugar, port wine
and cinnamon with a dry finish. Full body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.

Pours hazy copper with a fluffy tan head. Nose is sweet and inviting with lots of sugar, fruit, and distinct Belgian esters. Flavor is a similar profile to the nose but with a surprisingly long but dry finish. Alcohol presence is low for the style. Very good.
Draft. Aroma of caramel with nuts. Pours a deep brown with off white head. Taste is light to medium sweet.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 33cl bottle. Dark reddish brown with a thin beige head. Smells like fermented apples, apple pie, raisins, prunes. The taste follows the same notes, adding a layer of caramel on top of everything. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation and a sticky sweet aftertaste.
Vintage 2008 (8 years old) is much more mellow, sweet and velvety.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (vom NL- H√§ndler bezogen). Hellbraun mit sehr stabilem Schaum. In der Nase nicht viel. Malzig-w√ºrzig im Geschmack. Der Alkohol kommt sehr, sehr sp√§t...

Nagy, t√∂m√∂r hab, sz√©p s√∂t√©t v√∂r√∂sesbe hajl√≥ barna sz√≠n. Illata finom f≈±szeres, kis karamelles be√ºt√©ssel. Hat√°rozott karamelles, √©getett cukros jelleg, √©desk√©s. Enyhe f≈±szeres mell√©k√≠z. Ut√≥√≠z√©ben az √©getett cukor a domin√°ns. Testes s√∂r.
Dark clear ruby to black color, medium tan head. Medium malty aroma. Caramel sweet, spicy, yeasty taste. Full body, thick texture, average carbonation.

Bottle - dark reddish brown with just small lacing on sides - no real head. Little carbonation, ok mouthfeel. Sweet caramel aroma. A beer to sip - good lasting taste, port wine consistency but again a strong Belgium with, for me, a too alcoholic after taste - just not my style.

33cl bottle. Pours clear dark reddish brown colour with a huge good lasting beige head. Aroma of dark maltt, red fruits, caramel and some nuts. Taste of dark mild roasted malt, caramel, nuts, some chocolate and red fruits.

Carolus Classic is definitely a good choice to anyone who likes strong beers with emphasis on wine-like flavors. One of the beers that you remember amongst others. APPROVED BY TAVERNY¬íS BLACK METAL CREW !

Kastanjebruin bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: karamel, donker fruit. Smaak: zoet, overrijp fruit, peren, luikse stroop, wat chocolade en sinaasappel. Volmondig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoet.

cellared 330 ml bottle from Asheville (NC) served in a Belgian snifter. June 2013 bottling date. 

Appearance: just OK, with a rather weak head over a dark, hazy brown body. Spotty lacing. 

Aroma and Flavor: Superb aroma and excellent flavor. Loads of toffee with  dark ripe and dried fruit notes. The flavor does have a touch more alcohol than optimal but I can¬ít fault the deeply satisfying aroma. 

Feel: medium carbonation in a medium-light body. 8.5% ABV is mostly hidden. 

O: Excellent!

0.33l bottle from st louis, bb 05.04.18
pours a hazy dark chestnut with a large steady beige head and a nice lacing. aroma of caramel, dark fruits, prunes, nuts, cola. sweet and slightly sour flavour, mostly burnt rock candy and raisins, but also prunes, honey, spices. long sweet finish, giving way to slight bitterness. alcohol is very well hidden, I could probably drink a lot of it. very good.
Caramel taste with sweetness overshadowing any bitterness. Good mouth feel and great lingering finish.

The aroma starts with a fruity port wine with dark fruit quality. Body black with a hint of brown. The head has a hint of tan and is thick to start but fades to thin covering in a little while. Taste is a silky port wine. Sweet and seem to absorb it self into your taste buds effortlessly. Smooth and fades to a sweet dry finish. Incredible brew.

Pours very dark from the bottle with a thin tan head that turns wispy before fading away. The aroma is characterized by a strong malt presence, something in the direction of resin and, more unfortunately, rubbing alcohol. With exposure to air the more malodorous aspects lessen a a steady caramel aroma asserts itself. First taste is prickly, sweet, and the palate full and robust. Burnt caramel malt and bread dominate, with a chocolate undertone, and a light candy sweetness. The 8.5 ABV is well disguised, both on the initial quaff and the long caramel sweet finish. The range of taste is not particularly broad. A faint cherry fruitiness, once or twice hinted at, fails for example to make it out from under the burnt caramel overtone. Still this beer is, despite its flaws, a pleasure to drink and any qualms might be described as suffering at a high level. Interesting and quite good.

Bottle 33 cl. Nez complexe dans la gamme chocolat/caramel/candi/miel. Bouche intense avec le m√™me type d¬íimpression. Le sucre domine assez fort mais la bi√®re est bien ronde et superbe. A boire (C¬íest √† boire qu¬íil nous ...) üòÇ

Pours dark, reddish brown, clear, with off-white creamy head.
Visually medium carbonation.
Aroma: intense malt aroma, with notes of roadted, caramel, toffee, supported with fruity esters od dark fruits, cherris, prunes etc, port wine, wood, tannins...
Very similar are flavors...taste is sweet, smooth, wineous. Body is medium to full, carbonation is medium, texture is silky soft,

Pours dark amber colour with a medium white head. 
Aromas of caramel malt and prunes on the front and coffee with some smoke and wood in the background. 
Once in the mouth, it is silky smooth with a medium body and a medium carbonation. 
Taste starts sweet and that sweetness stays with you until there is this barely noticable bitterness and sourness cleaning your mouth and asking for more!
On the palate you can really taste all the things that you smelled. Kinda sweet and smokey, woody aftertaste with a medium-long lasting reminder of this experience.

Vermelha escura, quase opaca, l√≠mpida. Espuma bege abundante de longa dura√ß√£o. Aroma adocicado de ameixas e madeira. Na boca, adocicado com notas de caramelo, alca√ßuz, baunilha, chocolate, caf√© e uvas, al√©m de uma leve acidez. Retrogosto adocicado, um pouco alco√≥lico, com final de alca√ßuz.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 33cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. Poured a dark red brown with a one finger light brown head. Lively carbonation. Aromas: first thing that hit my nose was the wine, then dark fruits, grapes, bread dough, cherries, roasted malts. Taste: Fantastic! Very vinous, almost like drinking a glass of wine, tannine, malty whole wheat raisin bread, caramel, dark fruits, spices, walnuts, currants. Later on when getting more to room temparature the taste keeps on developing. I¬ím getting dark chocolate with vanilla now. Awesome! A full body with a very nice creamy tannine light bittersweet finish. Overall a fantastic brew that could be a complete meal by itself. It¬ís a brew you have to enjoy by sipping it slowly, enjoying it in front of a fireplace on a cold winter evening. I believe it is also excellent for cellaring for a couple of years. Awesome!

330ml bottle, poured into Kasteel goblet. A: Very dark amber, just about opaque, one finger tanned head, moderate retention, decent amount of lacing. S: Prune, not an overly pronounced aroma. T: Prune, molasses, burnt candy sugar, no hint of booze. M: Light creamy texture, not too much carbonation. O: Everything that is to be expected from a BSDA, without doing anything to stand out from the crowd, hid the booze really well.

75cl bottle. Beer looks great. Smells sweet caramel, also little bit vanilla. Taste is very sweet, minimal taste of alcohol and bitterness, there is nothing that comes out too strong. Creamy. Awesome sweet and balanced taste. Easy to drink and works great with heavy food like beef. Overall very good beer

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 At cellar cleanout tasting at deanso¬ís. Vintage 2011. Big fudge, caramel, light licorice, dades, vanilla. Very soft and smooth, really nice. 
2016/02/11: Bottle at home, from supermarket. Dark amber/clear brown with off white head. Sweet caramel malt, sugarplums, gumball coating, banana candy, in the background off all the sweetness there¬ís dades and banana and some mild spices, toast. Big sweet, very light roasted bitterness. Smooth texture and rich/full bodied. Apparently a respected brew, and the palate seems fine, but for my personal taste this is way too sweet. Not my cup of calorie, uhh, tea. (2.9)

Big frothy off-white head with good retention. Foggy brown dark amber colour. Aroma is caramel, ripe fruit (prune), spicy (cinnamon, clove). Taste is dark ripe fruit (prune, raisin), spicy, yeasty, bitter sweet with spicy finish and lasting spicy after-taste.

Beautiful dark beer. Smells awesome. A little bit of caramel and chocolate. Sweet taste. Very soft on bitterness. Very little alcohol taste. Goes very well with heavy food. Not as good as quadrupel trappists, but it is an awesome in between heavier and softer styles.

Bottle at home. Nicely dark brown colour, cloudy, offwhite creamy head with good retention. Artistic and tasty roasted malty caramel, molasses, sugar cane, dried fruits, spices like clove, ginger, liquorice, cough syrupy. Great balance. Firm body, medium carbonation. Very decent double.
.33l bpttle poured a clear brown beer. sweet and malty taste. Medium body and hints of caramel and chocolat

BOTTLE 33 CL. Clear dark brown with ruby highlights, beige head. Loads of dark crystal malts, dried fruit. A hint of alcohol. The taste is also heavy on dark caramel malts, Not much spice or alcohol - just a lot of sugars. Moderate grassy bitterness. Sweet sticky, but smooth mouth-feel. Very nice, just maybe a bit too hard on malts.

cloudy deep dark brown color
aroma of light alcohol and hop
taste real nice. rich caramel and malty flavor, ends with fruity sweetness

Dark brown colour with an average head, Aroma is very complex smoky, woody, coffee and vanilla, carbonation is medium and so does the body, burnt sugar flavor is dominant which is folowed by dark fruits like prunes, low in bitterness and finishes quick and dry.
This beer has a rich body and complex taste, but it lacks anything ¬íspecial¬í in my opinion.

Bi√®re achet√©e √† la SAQ. Bi√®re jaune paille totalement opaque avec une mousse cr√©meuse. Nez de levures belges, de pain, de vin, de pomme. En bouche, les notes de vin et de pommes sont en √©vidence. Triple diff√©rente des autres, saveurs int√©ressantes, justes, vraiment un excellent produit. Cheers!

bottle in Leuven
unfortunately served too cold, have to try it again for a good tasting and rate

On tap (ABV 8%, limited edition, circa Classic) @ Expo 2015, Milano. L¬íintensit√† olfattiva √® elevata e la persistenza olfattiva √® considerevole. Il cappello di schiuma beige a bollicine fini e carbonazione esuberante persiste abbondante con pizzo sul vetro al finale. Il liquido possiede frizzantezza data da bollicine fini con carbonazione ricca e persistente. Il colore √® marrone. Il corpo √® strutturato non pesante. L¬íamaro √® carico con l¬íaggiunta di un piccolo accenno di umami. L¬íintensit√† gustativa √® molto elevata e la persistenza gustativa √® lunga. Il gusto √® voluttuoso. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate per una "ottima birra". Il finale √® felpato, amarognolo, lungo, complesso e dissetante. Il retrogusto √® persistente. L¬íaroma in bocca riporta sentori di caramello e resina.
Flaske. farven er m√∏rk ravfarvet/r√∏dlig brun med en fl√∏defarvet skumkrone. Aromaen er s√∏d frugt, malt og g√¶r og smagen er portvin og rosiner.

From bottle pours dark with medium tan head which lingers throughout, resembles a stout. Aroma is lovely, alcohol is present and sticky stewed fruit with bready yeast, some cocoa and roste malt. Taste is rather sweet but balanced nicely with an under current of bitterness, slightly sour and astringent. Long lasting taste, oily texture and full bodied. I rather enjoyed this and might get a bottle to put back for a few years

Belge bien dans la tradition: lourdaude en √©pices, en sucre et alcool avec de la levure. Nez classique, quoique discret: odeurs de chocolat au caramel avec de coriandre et de la r√©glisse. En bouche, je go√ªte un maltage fort caram√©lis√© assez sirupeux. Cette sensation grasse au palais s¬íestompe assez vite au profit de saveurs torr√©fie√©s et cacaot√©es assez ontueuses se finissant avec une amertume discr√®te bien √©quilibr√©e sur de s notes min√©rales de bon aloi. Alcool enivrant

Graduaci√≥n:8,5¬∫
Temperatura de servicio: En torno a los 12¬∫C
Tipo de vaso recomendado: Copa de c√°liz.
Aspecto: De color ambarino muy oscuro, situ√°ndose en la gama de tonos que se encuentran a medio camino entre los marrones y los rojizos, similar a un brandy. Presenta un aspecto muy atractivo con una capa de espuma blanca y esponjosa, con buena amplitud, pero que sin embargo no tarda mucho en desaparecer.
Aroma: Compleja, desprende aromas afrutados, entre los que destacan frutos dulces como las ciruelas, higos, e incluso un punto de pl√°tano, junto con otros algo m√°s √°cidos como cerezas y cura√ßao. Tambi√©n destacan notas de malta y caramelo, con un punto de miel, nuez moscada, levadura, y muy levemente aparecen los l√∫pulos por debajo de toda esta capa de aromas frutales y dulzones.
Sabor y textura: Se trata de una cerveza de cuerpo medio, y carbonataci√≥n no muy elevada, aunque se aprecia cierto cosquilleo y picor en la lengua, apoyado por las especias. De sabor potente, donde aparece la malta por encima de los dem√°s, y los sabores dulces a pasas y frutos oscuros, se experimentan sensaciones que nos recuerdan a los aromas detectados anteriormente, acerc√°ndonos al gusto de un vino oporto. El alcohol se encuentra bien disimulado, y aparece un punto de amargor m√°s intenso de lo esperado, finalizando en un regusto seco y amargo. Muy reconfortante y agradable.
Donker bier. Mooie beige schuimkraag. Een rijke doch subtiele, toegankelijke smaak. Niet te zoet, niet te bitter, niet te droog... kortom: een perfecte balans.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 God og behagelig belgisk strong ale. Flot m√∏rk farve. Tilpas med s√∏dme i smagen.

Bottle 0.33l at Ultimate tasting in Pozarevac Serbia.24.10.2015.Special thanks to JefVerstraete for this bottle.Vintage bottle from 1973.crazyyyy.Taste with Cika Boban, Vlada ciao, Alberto bro and Matt bro.Pour it dsrk brown color with small head.Still small carbonation therr.Aroma honey, raisins.Taste of honey, oxidated, dark fruits in thr middle, typical taste after again of Belgian ales.Ok interesting for everybody.

33cl bottle at home. Pours darkbrown/reddish colour with a beige head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, toffee. Taste is fairly sweet with notes of apple, brown sugar, coffee, caramel with a sweet aftertaste. Texture is a bit creamy with average carbonation
Red,clear nice yellowish foam. Malt brown sugar in the aroma. Sweet, caramel, apple, with a sweet aftertaste

Mooi donker bier met cr√®mekleurige schuimkraag. Heerlijk aroma van koffie, chocolade, toffee, walnoten. Fluweelzachte smaak met lekkere warme - licht moutige - afdronk. De hemel op aarde. Bovenaards lekker !!!!

Aroma: dark malts, caramel, toffee, dried fruits and little dose of spices. Taste: roasted malts, toffee, caramel, dried fruits and light alcoholic notes. Medium head, good lacing and high carbonation.

Dark brown, almoust black with a two finger high, beige head. A lot of lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Brown sugar, vanilla, caramel malt, molasses, dark berries, dried fruit, spice and toffee. 
Taste: Caramel, toffee, roasted malt, dark fruit, molasses and brown sugar. 
Body: Full body. Medium carbonation. Soft, rich mouthfeel. 

A great strong ale! Love the sweet but not oversweet soft taste and the beatiful nose. Only 2.39 Euro at Beergium a bargain !
Overall: Sweet toffee, nuts, fudge.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2015-10-24.
P√• flaska importerad fr√•n Belgien. M√∂rk brun f√§rg men en h√∂g skumkrona. Doftar svagt, kanske b√§raktigt? S√∂t smak med en aning av vanilj.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with big, tan head. Aroma: strawberry, cassis, molasses, medium alcohol. Taste: high sweetness, but nice. Low bitterness. Taste is boozy and has notes of cassis, cherry and brown sugar. Texture is oily and a little sticky, carbonation is fizzy. Very nice beer.
Amber brown with a small beige head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, berries, dried fruit and spice. Taste is sweet and light bitter.
Great strong ale with intensive aroma of malt, spices, fruits. Well balanced bittersweet taste

Copenhagen 11/10 2015. 75 cl bottle from Meny. According to the label this is a part of a triology based on the three colours of the Belgian flag. This is supposed to be the black stripe. Pours clear dark brown with big off-white head. Settles as 1,5 cm thick layer of foam with thick lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma intensely sweet with notes of yeast and alcohol. Medium carbonation with oily palate. Taste is sweet and spicy and slightly roasted. Aftertaste is slightly sour bitter. It has a heart warming quality that you only get when the beer has a healthy alcohol content. As my girlfriend noted "this is good with a solid chunk of chocolate". I will look forward to the red and the yellow stripe.
Clear brown with an average frothy head. Aroma is dark fruit, raisin, toffee. Medium to high sweetness, with a light sour and low bitter finish. Average carbonation, full bodied, oily mouthfeel.
Bottle At Home, 3rd October 15. Pours dark, good throthy head. Aroma is dark fruit, fig, spice good. Taste is quite sweet, dark fruit, lovely.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Vova. Brown-black color. Smell of honey, bread, prunes, oxidized, alcohol. Very sweet, raisins, honey, prunes, chocolate, cough syrup and alcohol flavors. Medium-bodied, sticky on palate.
From elcervecero. In Duvel glass. Playing Goodbye Deponia. Not bad, but I find it a bit more sweet than desiderable
0.33l bottle. Dark ruby body, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, plums and figs. Taste of caramel, brown sugar, chocolate, reisins and some booze. Very nice.

Bottle sample at Vova¬ís Hoppy Beerthday tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin, Tel Aviv. Thanks Vova. Deep brownish-red with beige head. Aroma of raisin, prune and dried fruits. Very sweet flavor, syrupy, kind of old wine, notes of raisin, boozy. Sticky, full-bodied.

Bottle at Eulogy. Very dark brown/black pour with a solid showing of foamy lace. Delicate dark brown fruit. Rehydrated prunes and raisins. Molasses candies. Peat. Burnt caramels. Vanilla smoke. Root beer. Pleasant aroma. Thick flavors though the body reads a bit watery. Nice dark sugary beer that still finishes mostly dry.
Bardzo ≈Çadny, brunatny kolor, wysoka piana. Mocno s≈Çodowe, alkohol ≈Çadnie wyeksponowany. Jednak nie moja bajka. Zbyt s≈Çodkie jak na m√≥j gust.

33cl bottle, served in Trappist glass. Pours brown with medium off-white head. Aroma is sweet malts, fruits, licorice and toasty notes. The flavour is like eating cake, but that doesn¬ít mean it is too sweet. Apparently there¬ís no bitterness, but that¬ís not a problem to still find this brew balanced. Medium body, good carbonation. Something everyone can enjoy drinking.

Sample at beer bloggers conference, Brussels 2015
deep ruby brown, moderate creamy head. hot cross buns and figs on nose, spicey and fruity, full bodied, more of same in taste.
One of those beers that you can just sit and nurse because it is just so good to drink. Heavier and with more malt than expected (should have looked a little harder at the label)

Robe brune rubby et fabuleuse mousse beige clair, abondante fine, collante et laissant un joli col persistant.
Nez : biscuit, caramel, malts, sucre candy et quelque chose comme les cerises, les fruits au sirop, confits et alcoolis√©s.
Bouche : belle rondeur et douceur et les √©l√©ments du nez sont pr√©sents.
Alcool moyen.

Pas extra ordianaire mais g√©n√©reuse et √©quilibr√©e.

750ml c&c bottle from Wine Academy. Poured a murky chocolate brown, smaller foamy tight beige head. Aroma/flavor of sweet dates, fig, prunes, plum, brown sugar, yeast and a touch of bubble gum. Big full body with strong carbonation and a lingering aftertaste. Good stuff.
Slight amber pour. Big off white head, bordering closer to white. Pleny of lacing. Sweet malt and burnt sugar aroma. Hot taste with malt and sugar mixed in. Not getting any of the vitamins though?

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Pours dark reddish color with medium foamy head. Aroma of sweet fruits, malts and yeast. Sweet caramels, dark fruits, sugar on taste, spicy pepper aftertaste. Well balanced, sweet and easy to drink.
Bottle. A really nice beer! The taste has creamy sweetness, some smoke, and caramel. Looks nice too!

Il colore √® bruno, con una decisa sfumatura di corteccia, ma con riflessi rubino; la schiuma √® moderata ma persistente, color nocciola. Il naso si fa subito apprezzare per ricchezza e completezza aromatica: spezie, caramello, malto, toffee; un aroma di cioccolatini al cura√ßao, di marzapane e di lievito. A very solid Belgian beer. The yeast spicyness is really nice. The dark fruit and candied sugar sweetness is superior.

bomber to snifter and we all thought this was a very old bottle. poured a brown color with off white head. nice warm roasty sweet malts with some dark fruits. mild and warming. the flavor was pretty much the same. warm yet subtle flavors soft dark fruits and some mild woodiness.
Wat een lekker donker bier! Echt een aanrader. Meteen een lekkere volle smaak met een heerlijke, lichte bittere nasmaak. Lichte caramel tint. Mooie donkere kleur met een mooie schuimkraag.

Tap. Aroma: caramel, roasty. Appearance: brown coloured beer, white head.
Taste: medium sweetness. Palate: full body, long finish.
 Suggested accompaniment: carbonnade flamande. Still one of my favourite beers.

Bottle in Aba-jour, Ghent. Not sure how this has stayed off my radar, but this was a delightful discovery. Suggested as an accompaniment to my beef stew. Colour is opaque almost black with a creamy off white/beige head. Nose is prunes, raisins, dark fruit, plum, chocolate, slight lactic, roasted malt, salty, caramel, bit of ice cream, vanilla. Taste is sweet, salty, chocolate, caramel salted caramel, roasted malt, dark fruity, prune, raisin. Rich flavourful sweet and robust strong ale.

Bottle. Pours a dark rich brown/red with a nice thin, but lasting tan head. Smell is a pot of raisins, being soaked in a fine bourbon with some red wines. In the mouth and wow - it¬ís very FULL - there¬ís a slight oiliness at first and the beer feels rather thick, but there¬ís plums, red fruits, raisin, breads, roasted nuts, a slight coffee. There¬ís banana to be pulled out, some vanilla, butterscotch. It¬ís sweet, then warm, then a slight bitterness. You never really get a handle on the beer, it keeps giving you something else to play with, to pull out of the flavour combos. 

LOVE IT!

Tap. Dark mahogany pour, thin to medium tan head. Not a lot of lacing or residue but that may be the glass. Aroma, malt, caramel, sweet, dark fruit, raisins, spices. Taste is similarly complex but also has a bit of nuttiness in it and a touch of saltiness. Alcohol content provides some warmth. Excellent.
pours een dark light brown sturdy foam which sets nicely nice aroma dark malt some caramel taste sugary caramel somewhat sweet thick full bodied beer

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized frothy head that leaves some lacing. The aroma contains strong dark fruitiness with raisin and plum, sweet dark maltiness and some spiciness, also a touch of licorice. Taste is medium sweet and very rich in flavours; initially sweet dark, dried fruitiness and caramel, later breadier and nuttier nuances that linger on into a malty finish. Very estery, very yeasty all in all, warming alcohol in the periphery. The palate is delightfully smooth, full bodied and low in carbonation. Rich strong Belgian that more than deserves to be called a classic. A good one for slow relaxation.

For 28 year old, the body is amazing! Good beer!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 21-10-2017. Bardzo wysoka, ladna piana, niestety dosc szybko sie redukujaca do obraczki, ladnie zostajaca na szkle. Ciemny braz z miedzianymi i rubinowymi przeblyskami. Aromaty moze niezbyt bogate albo bardzo ladnie ulozone, zbalansowane, glownie karmel czy toffi, duzo ciemnych owocow (bardziej w strone wisni niz sliwek mam wrazenie), chleb, nieco czekolady, banan, zbozowo-slodowe nuty. Smak pasujacy do aromatu, bardzo fajny, w slodka (karmelowa - moze nawet ciut przyduzo tego karmelu) strone z lekka kwaskowatoscia owocowa, na finiszu znow lekki karmel i troszke lekkiej, chmielowej goryczki. Aksamiltne, delikatne w ustach. srednie wysycenie, alkohol dobrze ukryty. Wysmienite piwo.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

330 ml bottle with about a years age, dark brown color without much head. Aroma shows me dark bread, sugar, roasted barley, and yeast.

Color dark brown almost a burgundy. A Beige Cream, thin and low duration. Ties are left on the edge of the cup along the tasting.
Its aroma is fruity with a grip predominance of nuts, berries, raisins, with a perennial reminder of almost a nice wine.
The taste is sublime and mark the presence of toasted malts and sweetened and licorosa with a caramelized toffee, plums, raisins, truffle, roasted coffee and dark chocolate tones. Very well bodied and fully complex in its construction with a strong presence of alcohol by heat strength, but that at no time hurts the whole.
Medium carbonation and subtly bitter end with a counterpoint of light sweetness.
A classic that should be present in your cellar!

330ml bottle from Beers Of Europe website (¬£2.89):
An enjoyable beer that proved easy enough to drink but in truth didn¬ít really strike me as a memorable offering or one that I¬íd be all that likely to go back to in the future. There was nothing wrong with the beer as such, it just seemed to be missing that special something that would have found be rating it higher. Classic art from the Flanders¬í fields. Delicious body, fizzy carbonation. Important Belgian beer, among all of important Belgian beers. 750ml cork bottle served in a snifter at around 12 degrees:

Pours an opaque brown robe showing a timid reddish hue and a certain cloudiness. The hazel head seems creamy and finely structured. It develops great lacing and a good retention.

The nose is sweet and complex with strong notes of plums, candied fruit and softer hints of cantaloupe or muskmelon and alcohol.

On the tongue, this fine brew explodes into a wild and sweet mixture of milk chocolate, caramel, sugar cane, instant coffee and banana. It feels extra delicate and breaks down on the palate but still keeps its incredible density until it dissolves into a semi-dry finish.

Awesome Belgian brew which represents insanely well what a Dubbel should be.
Pours dark copper with slight head. Malty sweet treacle nose. Medium mouthfeel good carbonation. Sweet malty taste finished by good bitterness. Good beer

330ml bottle from Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma of roasted toffee and caramel. Sweet finish. Plenty of body. Delicious.

The color is very dark, almost black. Nice beige header. Taste is roasted caramel, malt dark and heavy. It has a long finish (semi sweet/bitter), dark fruit body (rich in flavours) so you almost don¬ít taste the alcohol. A very satisfying beer.

Flasche (75 cl), erstanden 2012 und 2 Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Tiefes Rotbraun, tr√ºb. - In der Nase weinig-s√º√üe Schwere √ºber dunklem Malz; Armagnac, Rumtopf. - Im Antrunk √ºberreife (kandierte?) oberg√§rige Frucht (Rosinen, Pflaume, Birne), eingebettet in dunkles Malz mit sch√∂nen R√∂stnoten, abgerundet durch einen spritzig-s√§uerlichen Touch. Im Hintergrund etwas holzige Hopfenherbe. Immer noch gut rezent, trotz s√º√üer Schwere beinahe schlankes Mundgef√ºhl. Im Abgang verbindet sich eine milde aber deutliche, leicht krautige Hopfenherbe perfekt mit der reichen, fruchtigen S√º√üe. - Gro√üartige Kombination von Rohrzucker, s√º√üer Frucht, R√∂stmalz und spritziger S√§ure. Nach 2 Jahren Lagerung nicht mehr so s√º√ü wie anfangs, sondern tiefgr√ºndig dunkelmalzig-fruchtig.

La bi√®re Gouden Carolus Classic est une bi√®re brune issue d'une fermentation haute. Cette bi√®re b√©n√©ficie d'une refermentation en bouteille qui va lui permettre d'achever son √©volution et d'affiner ses qualit√©s gustatives.. Elle pr√©sente √† sa sortie de la bouteille, une belle robe acajou tirant sur le rubis. Cette robe est couverte d'une mousse abondante mais √©ph√©m√®re.
La Gouden Carolus Classic laisse apparaitre dans le nez des ar√¥mes malt√©s et tr√®s fruit√©s qui √©voque le caramel, les prunes et les raisins. Une touche anis√©e est √©galement perceptible.
On d√©couvre ensuite sur le palais des saveurs elles aussi malt√©es et fruit√©es avec un aspect un peu liquoreux. Des notes torr√©fi√©es accompagnent des saveurs de fruits noirs et de fruits secs. On retrouve notamment des notes de prunes, de pruneaux, de raisins et de raisins secs. Associ√©es √† l'alcool, ces saveurs de fruits noirs rappellent certaines liqueurs de fruits. Le houblon se fait discret ici et la fin de bouche et relativement douce et malt√©e.
Puts dark, almost black with a slight head. Mild alcoholic aroma, nothing particularly strong. Great sweet flavour, can hardly taste the strength.
Aroma is malts, caramel/toffee and medium ssweetness. The flavor is caramel, fruit/berries, malts and a medium sweet finish.

Big and full and satisfying.

text:
33cl Bottle, 
Appearance: . Pours a deep, reddish brown colour with a 2 gingers sized , beige head. with ok retention, 
Aroma: Dried dark fruit, leather, chocolate, wood, a hint of yeast and some alcohol. - Quite nice and complex for it¬ís style.
Taste: Sweet, dried dark fruits, chocolate and caramel. A hint of vanilla and some wood.
Nice sliky texture and medium body, but this bottle had a bit too much fizzy carbonation. (Which might be sorted out by storing this longer the best before date suggest it¬ís Quite fresh.

Classic in every sense of the word, this beer has been in existence since the fifties, but underwent a certain change in the late nineties. Allegedly a derivative of the ¬íMechelsen bruynen¬í emperor Charles V enjoyed back in the sixteenth century, this is the flagship of Flanders¬í oldest brewery. The current version displays a pale beige, sticky, lacing, thinnish but stable head and a clear wine-red colour with little to no visible fizz. Strongly perfumed aroma of cookie dough, port wine, butterscotch, chocolate liqueur, orange peel, coriander seed, cooked corn, baked banana, liquorice, cardamom, star aniseed, apple cake, gingerbread, old cognac, raisins, hints of sour yoghurt, meat and fresh paint, as well as a (luckily) very, very weak hint of nail polish remover. Taste reveals a truckload of candied fruits, sweet in a sugary and spicy kind of way, resinous and smooth mouthfeel with soft carbonation, ubiquitous toffee-like and caramelly malts, a bit oily, candi syrup sweetness cloying a bit, insufficiently balanced with leafy, drying hop bitterness and warming, port-like alcohol. The candi sugary sweetness lingers too much, making it hard for me to pour down and sticking to tongue and throat, yet the aroma is fantastic. I remember this in its old guise, without the weary corn, refermented in the bottle and with the old label; it was equally sweet, but yeastier and more ¬ínatural¬í back then, but in its current form, this is still an important Belgian, one of those old-time favorites and a must taste. I do not like overtly sweet beers but in this case, the complex aroma makes it easy to forgive; it would benefit from less sugar, though. Let¬ís see how the three remaining bottles age in the cellar: if they become anything like that special ¬í58 version I tasted of this, I¬ím sure I have invested in a certain amount of happiness five or more years from now...
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta, dulce, caramelo, muy ligeramente a uvas pasas.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2015 Bottle, deep red-brown with a lasting off-white head and aromas of toffee, strawberries and old oak barrels. Palate is dry-sweet and fruity, with caramel and bourbon notes. Faint hints of pear, banana and vanilla. Roasty-sweet and bitter, lovely balance in the body, roast sweetness on the finish

September 24, 2014. Pours deep red with a dense off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, dark sugars, caramel, light spicy notes. Taste is medium sweet dark sugars, plum, figs, light bitter. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation.
Golden Carolus dark brown ok head. Dark fruits yeast taste and aroma good dark malts fruity bitter finish. Medium body. 336814. Sailor inn Budapest.

0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is malty, caramel, chocolate and dark fruits. Taste is sweet with some alcohol notes. Full body and average carbonation. Overall it¬ís nice and complex beer.

Bottle, poured into a chalice. Appearance- a dark, murky brown, a half-finger solid light brown head which clings to the glass. Looks really good. Aroma- very bready and malty, marzipan, cherry hints, a little bit of port and red wine. Taste- full in the mouth and quite smooth and silky. Rich fruitcake dominates, almonds, cherry, brown sugar, treacle, a clinging, bitter finish. Very, very tasty.

Light & sweet with Xmas fruit cake taste with typical effervescence. A good Belgium beer but not the best I've tasted.

330ml bottle poured in its own glass.
A: Pours a dark amber nutty clear color. Forms a small yellow head. Not many lacings left
S: Smell is very sweet like a Belgian beer should be. Candy sugar, sweet grains. Very fruity easters, dark fruits mainly. Alcohol 
T: Follows the nose, a sweet Belgian style beer. Sweet candy upfront, sweet malts. Very bready. Mild earthy bitterness
M: Heavy creamy molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet candy upfront and mild earthy bitter aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. A little bit overwhelming alcohol in the nose but still a great beer
[ BA Review @ 7/12/2012 ]

Colore ambrato molto scuro, mogano, praticamente impenetrabile a bicchiere pieno. Schiuma fine, abbastanza abbondante e persistente, dal color marroncino chiarissimo. L¬íaroma non e¬í particolarmente intenso. E¬í un aroma abbastanza fresco, floreale, leggermente luppolato e maltato, con una punta di liquoroso. In bocca si avverte soprattutto il maltato, un po¬í di liquoroso, con una leggera punta di frutti di bosco aviduli. Si avverte un tocco di legnoso, come se la birra fosse stata conservata in botte per pochi mesi. Corpo strutturato. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa. Birra di classe, con pochi saposi, ma comunque interessanti. Alla fine della bevuta, i suoi 8,5 gradi si sentono tutti.

Couleur noire aux reflets ambr√©s, mousse qui disparait. Nez malt√© et fruits noirs, sucre candy. Gout malt√©, sucre candy, leger fruits noirs, note r√©glisse et fruits noirs, petite amertume. Corps leger en bouche, mais aromes forts.
Une brune √† bon caract√®re mais, √† mon go√ªt, qui tire trop sur le caf√© et caramel sur la longueur. Bue courant 08/2014.

Bottle; pours dark amber with a khaki head; sweet aroma of caramel, dark fruits, yeast, and hints of spice; sweet taste of dark fruits, caramel, honey, and yeast; has a wet finish; very little bitterness in this one; very good Belgian
Bottle. Dark brown red pour with a nice beige head. Raisin, chocolate, oak, leather. Medium to full body. A lot of dried fruits. Nice

Bottle at home. over 2 years old. Pours a deep, reddish brown colour with a medium, beige head. Nice sweet aroma of dried fruit, leather, heather, chocolate, wood and some alcohol. The flavour is also sweet with lots of chocolate, fudge, vanilla and wood. Has a sliky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A wonderful, balanced and sweet belgian strong ale.

From tap at "To Dento sto Bar", Thessaloniki. Dark brown-red color with beige head. Aroma is "wineous", dark fruity, raisins, alcohol. Taste is sweet, light malty caramel, wineous and raisins again, spicy. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation.

In bottle (Delerium/Brussels); really enjoyed this one .. poured dark with aroma of toffee and some cocoa. Very smooth, same toffee and cocoa notes as the aroma. Quite nice . I will definitely buy this one again
Bottle. A clear red-brown colour with a medium high, beige head. An aroma of sugar, spice, raisin and alcohol. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter.

Transfer from BA review on 4-13-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance ¬ñ The beer pours a dark brown color with a one finger cream colored head that fades relatively quickly. Upon fading, over about a one minute time period, a lighter level of lace is left on the sides of the glass.

 Smell ¬ñ The aroma is a mix of a lightly roasted and bready malt as well as aromas of sweet sugary and darker fruit smell. The heaviest of the malt is a roasted barley malt but there are notes of chocolate and coffee mixed within as well. The sugary smells are mainly of a caramel nature and are mixed with fruit aromas of a raisin, prune and fig. Rounding out all these are aromas of some alcohol as well as some spicy smells and a bit of an earthy hop smell.

 Taste ¬ñ The taste begins sweet with flavors of a caramel and a whole lot of dark fruits. The dark fruits are mainly of a prune flavor but have some hints of a raisin and fig flavors mixed within. There are flavors of a roasted malt breadiness upfront as well, which ends up fading ever so slightly as the flavor advances. As the breadines fades, a coffee and chocolate taste begins taking its place. While the flavor advances further, so too comes some of the spice flavors that were detected in the nose (nutmeg and cinnamon). A rather decent potent rum flavor as well as a bit of a woody and earthy flavor then come to the tongue more at the end where it melds well with the prune and darker chocolate and coffee flavors to leave an odd warming flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel- The beer is on the medium side in terms of its thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is on the average side. A little lighter of a body may actually have suited the odd mix of fruity flavor and darker flavors better due to the complementation of the fruit and drinkability and lessening of the chocolate and coffee flavors.

 Overall ¬ñ The chocolate and coffee flavors were a little odd in this brew and took away from the nice blend of fruit, malt and rum tastes. Not bad, but not the best Belgian strong dark out there

Pours two fingers of light tan head on a dark brown colored body.
The aroma is caramel, spices and brown sugar.
The taste is mild sweetness at first, more brown sugar sweetness middle to end, some figs to finish.
The texture is soft but thicker with low carbonation.
Quite enjoyable.

"Had a bign to myself :) pleasant all around as expected. Perhaps a bit darker. Was expecting more golden than brown for some reason. Dark fruits and an herbal yeasty kick greet the nose and palate. Finishes sweet, slightly dry, and slightly alcoholic. Solid BSA."
Nice aroma of boiled sweets, toffee. Rich, velvety palate and very smooth tasting. L¬íalcohol is invisible here, which is perhaps my only gripe.
Fantastic beer. Good dark color, not very promising on the nose, but with a great bouquet and a full flavored finish that leaves you wanting more.

Flavor is sweet, vinous, malt, dark fruits, plums, yeast. Finish is fruity with some bitterness and hints of alcohol. It is very well balanced. Overall: very nice brew. Purchased from Liquor Shed in Casper, $10.99 for the 2013 750ml bottle.

A nice pop when I pulled the cork but no gushing, thankfully, it pours a clear? deep mahogany with a 2 finger hof and of course, nice lacing.

Lots of caramel malt, mixed with some toffee and fruity notes in the smell. Pitted fruits, me thinks. No, I¬ím thinking of a Bartlett. Anywho, it¬ís a very nice aroma going on.

I do appreciate the pear flavour I¬ím getting straight off. Toffee follows and something semi sweet..I¬íll read the label...molasses? Okay. Nothing realy on the bitter side going on but this is not an overly sweet brew either. 

Sipping further in, I get a mild heat from the alcohol but it¬ís not a huge distraction.

Close to if not full bodied, medium carbonation, makes for a great mouthfeel, eh?

This is classically delicious and a real joy to sip on. Well worth the price I paid for it.

Bottle, caged and corked. Big and beefy-looking brew, dark stained wood with a giant, stoic head. The aroma is quite subtle but classically diverse. Same for the drink ... with a beautiful, historic balance of rich, milky caramel malt, a little sour twist, and an earthen undertow. Classic. (#5579, 7/15/2014)
Sweet yet highly drinkable with hints of molasses and apple. Unfortunately it appears my glass has a hole because the beer drained quickly. Awesome and can¬ít wait until the next one.
Clear dark brown body with tan head. Aroma of dark dried fruit, alcohol, malt. Taste is sweet, malty. Thick texture. Nice beer.
Average beige head, disappearing quickly. Dark brown hazy. Aroma is yeasty, sultanas, spicy, alcohol. Sweet, lightly bitter, balanced. Syrupy. Belgian version of a bock.

Bottle. Light hazy deep brown liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of licorice, caramel, toffee, raw sugar, alcohol and dried fruit. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of dried fruit, raw sugar and toffee. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice.
Petit go√ªt grill√©, pas tr√®s ch√®re. Ambr√©e tr√®s sombre. On ne sent pas le 8,5, et l?ar√¥me est subtil.

Clear, but so dark brown it is almost opaque, with some reddish hues. Small off-white head and some lacing. Medium bodied. Smooth and slightly sweet, with flavours of fruit cake, brown sugar and sherry. Not much spice for, maybe some nutmeg and cinnamon. Needs more of an edge to be a great Belgian ale.

Bottle, dark brown color with virtually non-existing foam head. Taste starts coppery, goes to an average Dubbel. Not that excited, little boozy even.

Pours Coca-Cola with low off-white head. Aroma of yeast, rye bread, pepper, toffee. Taste is sweetish, light peppery, with dried fruit and spice notes. Body is medium and creamy with soft carbonation.

Aromas of mud, belgo yeast, molasses, caramel

Pours medium brown wirh a creamy tan head. Aromas of rye bread, caramel, roasted malts, roasted nuts, raisins, slight plum. Taste is caramel, raisins, plum, honey, rye bread. Mouthfeel is quite smooth with medium carbonation.

Bottle at Dabbe, Pisa. Chestnut body with a large beige head. Light lacing. Aroma of pear, wood, treacle and toffee apple. Flavour of golden syrup, wood and red apple. Medium body with a powdery texture. Soft fizz. A wonderful, complex beer that drinks as easily as a Lager.

75 cl/750 ml, flaske, 8,5 % ABV, 50 √•rs gave fra Hanna - tak! 19. juni 2014.

Dejlig frugtrig duft af engelsk plumcake. T√∏rrede frugter s√•som svesker, abrikos, rosiner.

Gouden Carolus has unlimited storage (it even improves with age) and will charm you with its warm coppery colour and rich bouquet.
dark amber with a light head. complex flavor. raisins, toffee and slightly nutty. a bit of alcohol warming. not my favorite belgian strong ale, but still decent.

Pours a dark brown body with a thin head. Complex aroma full of motor oil. A rich and nice taste.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines, cheers Ash! Pours hazy dark amber. Aromas of dark stone fruit, toffee, yeast. Light boozy note. Taste is all of this and more sweetness. Sticky, oily finish, but good.

Aroma: yeast, light alcohol, malts. Appearance: slightly hazy gold, massive white creamy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets intensify, caramel, honey, bitters come up, dominate, long dry finish. Overall: very nice Abbey Tripel, great palate. Pint at De Garre, Bruges.

Taste is sweet, some alcohol, soft caramel, milk, malty. This is actually pretty nice - balanced - even though I can¬ít think of much to describe the flavour.

Medium to heavy sweet. Heat feeling. Medium refreshing bitter. Breeze feeling. Enjoyable experience. Full body, silky texture, good carbonation. Sweet warming finish with a light bitter note. Overall, fruity/spicy aroma, great taste with good depth. Great beer !

In fles van 33cl. Donker van kleur met een matige schuimkop. Mooi zacht biertje. Een topper. Mooie afstemming van hop en gist met een vleugje caramel.
33cl fles. Donkere kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : koolzuur, drop, zoetig, licht caramel.

Much darker than I expected; only against a strong light can you notice that the beer is deep red. The head is nice and beige. Aromas are delicate, almost faint; slight roastiness and sweet breadiness dominated by sweet, dark fruits, quite vinous. The caramel is noticed upon the sip, with sweetness being predominant. Sweet finish just balanced by the hops. The body is dead on. A nice impression but nothing remarkable.

Pours a dark, amber brown, with long lasting whitish head. Aroma is sweet, with hints of dark fruits. Taste of a nice dubbel, with notes of Belgian sugars. Well balanced and drinkable. Thumbs way up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle on Ko Phangan. Don¬ít believe I¬íve ever seen this in the States, definitely not on the West Coast. Beautiful dark plum pour, little bit of lace, and a white head around the rim. Dark fruit malts, candied sugar, and a hint of roast on the nose. On the flavor is quite similar, dark and fruity in the plum realm, hints of buried coffee, and bits of candied sugar. A touch of burnt smoke on the finish making a beautifully rounded Belgian Ale!

Dark with a light head that lasts a while. The aroma is a nice mix of dark fruit and candied sugar, along with there wonderful yeast. The flavor is a little on the sweet side but that¬ís to be expected. All in all, a fantastic beer.
On tap at Biercab. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Yeast, dark fruits, caramel aroma. Sweet, malty and caramel taste, also some yeast. Medium to full body.

Aroma: malty, sweetness, raisin 

Appearance: lacing, persistent head, very dark ruby color

Taste: malt, raisin, plum

Palate: thick, malty

Overall: very enjoyable.

Aroma is raison, fig, plum, belgian sugar and wild yeast. Taste is a very nice dark fruit sweetness paired with the belgian sugars. Taste has a slight liquor snap but a pleasant one. Body is a dark amber with a head that is a thin lace that retain s well.

330 ml bottle into chalice, bottled on 12/12/2012. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy deep ruby brown color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge raisin, prune, fig, apricot, pear, apple, caramel, molasses, candi sugar, toast, clove, brown bread, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with great complexity and balance of malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, prune, apricot, fig, pear, apple, caramel, molasses, toast, brown bread, candi sugar, clove, light pepper, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of raisin, prune, apricot, fig, pear, apple, caramel, molasses, toast, clove, brown bread, light pepper, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity and robustness of dark malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a moderately creamy, smooth, and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome Belgian strong dark ale! All around great complexity, balance, and robustness of dark malt and fruity/earthy yeast ester flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.
