Pours dark, aroma taste is sweety and very strange, smells sweet and chocolaty, not a typical ale

Rally dark red-brown colr with a creamy firm head. Medium carbonation. Caramel, cinnamon and chocolate aroma. When you take your first sip and taste the chocoalte and caramel you expect a very heavy taste. But the taste doesn¬ít turn heavy, but turn very soon in a very smooth finish. The alcohol is there in the aftertaste. Good beer.
Carolus is a great beer, without any special aroma, except maybe alcohol followed by nice sweet finnish. Color is dark brown with fast disappearing light brown foam. Easy to drink.
But en fut le 1 mars chez Ho.st. Bi√®re bien balanc√©e en saveur et odeurs. Saveur de candy qui laisse la place au subtilit√© des malts et des houblons.

(Drinking date: 28 February 2014) Very dark brown/black colour. Thin layer of beige head. A bit of a strange aroma, I think it smells like my keys haha, a bit like metal. Also a bit of a sweet aroma, also chocolate. But not a powerfull aroma, a bit dull aroma. The taste is also a bit sweet, and like chocolate. Not really bitter. The taste is special, it tastes good, but it¬ís not powerfull, it¬ís not a powerfull taste. It has the taste of Westvleteren 12, but then less powerfull. This beer has a complex taste of choclate and other things. It gets more and more delicious the more this beer warms up a bit. The mouthfeel is perfect. It¬ís a bit thick, and the carbonation is not too much. So overall, this beer is not really powerfull, but however it is well balanced, and has a special taste. So that¬ís why this beer gets the score of 3.9!
Bottle. Dark brown with beige spongy head, caramel aroma, chocolate-caramel taste, low carbonation, long finish. Very nice beer.

Dark brown ambered colour with a small soft fading tan head. Noses predominantly of malt, caramel, brown sugar and pine/spruce. A little fizz on the palate leaving a slick texture with sweet notes. The finish is lasting and slick. Very sugarcane like.
Botella de 33cl. Color marr√≥n oscuro. De sabor dulce con notas a pasas y levadura. ligera presencia de amargor
Pours dark brown. Smells and tastes of dark fruit. Aftertaste is almost wine like.
Pours dark ruby red. Head is off white. Bread, yeast, sweet malts. Body I¬íd Medium. Nice bubbles which lifts dark fruit flavours. Alcohol there in finish. Okay.

Nice dark beige head with candy and cinnamon aromas. Body is dark brownish copper. Taste has sweet hops and very light liquor. Excellent balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Voted World¬ís Best Dark in 2012 but I¬íve not been keen on the Tripel so opened this with a degree of intrepidation. Pours nice and dark with a sweetish aroma, taste is incredible like chocolate covered chewy caramel with some currants and dark fruits alongside a teasing bitterness. A beautiful beer, although I can see it¬ís sweetness getting a little too much in a second glass.

Decided to bust this one out since it has been in my fridge for a couple years and the store owner who gave it to me said it was probably a 2005. Here goes nothing. Pops with a decent noise, but not fierce by any means. Poured unclear dark brown/amber with thin and quick dissolving head. Smell is plums, dark fruits, touch leather and some known oxidation notes. Taste is, well, over the hill for sure. Dark fruits are still there, but it is quickly dominated by soy, cardboard, syrup soaked leather (weird right). Well, now comes the time to rate the beer and I hate to bc this is merely a shell of its former self. However, my measly rate will not ding the 1164 ratings that preceded me. Bottom line. Good experience bc it was free but shitty shitty end result.

Pours a very rich, dark caramel color with a frothy head. Aroma of toasted nuts and dark fruit, caramel and toffee. Foamy palate. Flavors of carmelized nuts, toffee, natural acidic sugars and caramel. Some metallic quality rears its ugly head occasionally but this could be from improper bottle storage. Very smooth for its strength.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours brown dark reddish with brown white big frothy head. Notes of belgium yeast, raisins, dark fruits, plums, some nice spices. Pretty nice smooth well rounded beer with alcohol well hidden. Maybe slightly too sweet tho.
Dark brown with huge white head. Plums, yeast, spices. Heavy sweetness and medium bitterness. Very strong and complex with lots of warming properties.

Bottle. Dark black quad looking pour. Nice frothy head, that hovers just above the surface. Aroma is raisins, spices, brown sugar, and sweet malts. Taste, wow, sweet, somewhat syrupy mouthfeel, lots of spices, some wine like undertones, finishes semi dry. Very nice Belgian ale!
Drank with Thierry 29-1-2013. Good dark beer. Not great though. Good taste but Lacks the awesomeness.
Buena cerveza oscura para aquellos que desean empezar en el mundo de las cervezas oscuras

1973 bottle...Thanks Jef! Pours a clear amber color with a hint of carbonation. The smell is big caramel, rich fruit, cherries, mederia notes. The taste is on par with the nose... some oxidation. Medium body without much carbonation which is to be expected. A nice treat!

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 33cl served in a Gouden Carolus glass. Pours a dark brown almost treacly colour with an impressive white head. Aroma is typical Belgian Abbey beer turned up to 11. Hugely rich taste bursting with juicy fruits along with dried front and very malt dominated. Not actually inferior in any way to the Van Der Kaizer Blauw. Wonderful.
Great Belgian beer. Yeasty and spicey, but with a dry and bitter edge. Very tasty.

beautiful mahogany color, smallish beige head. Dades, spices, raisins, something vegetal, and a bit of candy. Taste is sweet, with herbal bitter. Medium bodied, average carbonation, slick texture and quite boozy. Nice beer, but there¬ís better.
Dark brown with brown, but unstable head. Complex Smell of lots of malt with drk chocolate aroma. Sweet and long lasting taste. Good one.

Bottle, nice head, very nice deep red colour.
Taste is really original to me, malt, bitter and toffee finish, but there is this red fruit like taste, indeed some similarity to wine. 
A very interesting beeer, I got this one through a christmas package with 4 different beers from this brewery. I will certainly look out to buy more of this particular brew.

Drunk from 33cl bottle. Dark, sweet, spicy brown ale.

Pours in dark color with low tan head. Aroma is sweet dark, licorice, plums. Apparent alcohol. Taste is sweet with medium bitterness. Body is full with medium carbonation.
Bottle Cape Town Festival of Beer 2013. Pours brown with medium carbonation and head. Aroma of ripe fruit, plum, raisins, caramel and malt. Taste is sweet. Overall good, sweet wine flavour.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 Pours a deep copper/brown with a big beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, nuts, brown sugar, spicy yeast, raisins, toffee, ripe dark fruits. Flavour is sweet, bit sugary. Body is above medium. Very refined and classic Belgian Strong Ale, a prime example of the style.

Bottle 330ml. Cloudy dark brown appearance with a mild aroma. It had a medium bitter taste that got stronger while I drank it. It left a pleasant fizzy sensation in my palate. I drank it while eating a steak and thought it was a great combination. I will definitely drink it again and recomend it to anyone that loves good beer.

Pours deep drown reddish with beige, creamy top, medium lasing.
Aroma - typical dubbel alike - dominant chocolate cake yeasty (a bit reminds Westwletteren XII), darker malt sweet plus some dark sugar-berries like. 750 ml bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a murky brown with a a beige head of foam that dissipates pretty quickly. The aroma is pretty boozy and hot, but some subtle dark fruit complexities and nutty notes sneak through with a little digging. The taste is sweet and a little dry. The finish is long and reminds me of walnut hulls. Thicker, near syrupy mouthfeel. Just a little carbonation. I get a pretty good heat on the back of the throat and down into the stomach.

Bottle. Pours deep copper with beige head. Flavour is black pepper and a whole lot of dark fruits -- plum/prune/raisin, you know the spiel, seen it a thousand times. Pours a two finger khaki head that fades quickly leaving a no lace. Dark opaque brown color, ton of yeast left in bottle. Good carbonation and medium bodied. Dark fruit nose and flavor is dark fruit and spice. Better flavor as it warms. Higher ABV is hidden. 330ml bottle part of 4-pak $18.99 Julio¬ís Liquors Marlboro, MA.

Autumnal brown beer with a yellowing to its edge. Medium to fine head that lowers a bit quick for a full bodied strong ale, but does leave a persistent lacing. Aroma is of liquorice and dark malts, with an evident toffee sweetness. Only the slightest trace of leafy, dry hops. Very sweet at first in the mouth but quickly balanced by a dry and medium-bitter mid palate. Big whack of malts and candy sugar and something almost brandy-like. Then a coffee note coming through. It finishes on the sweet malts and leafy bitterness - very well balanced. Final impression is of candied orange peel. Mouth feel is the real winner here: great thick silken body with a lasting fine carbonation. Solid, accomplished beer.

Really quite a good dark Belgian Strong Ale. Sherry and preserved cherry notes with a nice light bitter finish to stop it from being cloying. Quite similar to my much-loved Ommegang Three Philosophers. One I will definitely revisit.

75 cl Bottle.
Dark red/amber colour, with a creamy light brown head. Figs, raisins, definitely sweet. Well balanced. Really nice finish. Great.

Bottle at La Casa De La Cerveza, Madrid, October 2013. Ugly murky brown with a dark white head. Condensed fruitiness and sugar aroma, so, so sweet and stuffy! Full body, long, sweet finish. No signs of hops and more of a cooked fruit than beer.

Bottle. Poured a dark ruby red color, small off-white head. Aromas are dried fruits, some sweet spice notes. Notes of barrel character come out in this (vanilla, extra booze), along with some notes of light fruits. Flavor is pretty complex. This is good.
Dark murky brown. Aroma is dark fruits, mild lolly banana. Taste is yeasty, dark fruits and bready malt. Overall, pretty decent Belgian strong, but not crazily good.

11.2 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a murky dark brown color. The head is a two finger mocha shade, settling down to one finger relatively quick. Nonetheless, general retention is good, as is the soft, creamy texture. Thin streaks of lacing are left on the glass.

S: There are plenty of plums on the aroma, as well plenty of milk chocolate. Caramel and brown sugar also abound in conjunction with a well balanced note of bready yeast, pears, and apples. Really, it¬ís not far off from a great quad - or Keizer Blauw for that matter.

T: Opening flavors are very strong in brown sugar sweetness. It¬ís caramely in a good way. Dark fruit flavors (plums, raisins, and the like) build up in the midtaste before the dry finish...that¬ís also laden with dark fruits. While it¬ís fairly sugary, it¬ís balanced just enough so to become non-cloying. Complexity is only lacking next to the aforementioned Keizer Blauw: this still has very good depth, even within the style.

M: The back end is moderately dry. I like that, by the way - it helps quash some (if not all) of the sweetness. Not a hint of alcohol is felt or tasted on the palate, but there is a slight warming sensation down the esophagus.

O: Excellent. Not sure why I held onto this single for so long, because I¬ím really digging this. Very flavorful and sweet, yet approachable and balanced enough. Fantastic dessert beer, and I wish I had more than a single of this.

Dark brown with a nice lobby foam head. Strong and full body of sweet caramel and nuts. 

In the aftertaste I did noticed a slight of metal. I hate this, and normally Ill never buy a beer again when I taste this somewhere. But it was very far away and didnt bother me that much. Becides the overall taste (and price) of this beer makes it well!!
UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Wonderful fruity aroma... cloudy dark brown, muddy. Carbonation comes with a soft bust. Very very nice indeed.

pours a dark amber colour with a thick white head. aroma of fruits, yeast, caramel, and some spice notes. the taste of dark fruits cherry, sweetness of the caramel and malts. bit to high carbonation. average beer

Bottle. Pours clear ruby amber with abundant, airy but stable light tan head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel and fruit with a subtle touch of coffee. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt with notes of fruit, roasty and hoppy touches, and hints of milk chocolate in the finish. Warming alcohol presence. Low carbonation. Nice.
Dark brown with thick frothy offwhite head. Aroma: sweet malt, caramel, dark fruit. Taste is sweet, with dark fruit, malt, brown sugar. Good.

Draft at Churchkey. Pours medium brown with thin, creamy off-white head. Some retention and spare lacing. Aroma is cookie and cereal malts, brown sugar, plums, black cherries, light yeast, and light floral hops. Flavor is sweet malts and some dark fruits, light floral hops, and fresh dough. Dry feel with a light sweet finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
Pours a dar brown with smallish head. Dark fruits and caramel. Just a tad bit tart. Smooth and creamy. This is a very nice beer.
33cl bottle at Skek. Dark amber/brown with an off-white head. Full body with medium carbonation. Sweet, slighty sour. Red fruits, banana, caramel, spices. Overall a complex full flavoured beer.

Poors a dark mahogany with a lingering froth on top. Moderate carbonation, well bodied beer with a bitter coffee initial taste that develops into something sweeter and lingers for some time after

Shared a 33cl from Delheize (Luxembourg). It pours a brown colour with a nice brownish head. Aroma is yeast, coffee and alcohol. Medium carbonation and full body. A nice balanced, but at the same time complex flavour. Starts medium bitter and switch to a more sweet end. Very good!

Pours a slightly hazy brown with a reddish tinge and a thin tan head. Aroma is a mix of alcohol and esters, dark dried fruits, some what spicy, and perfume. Flavour is sweet, dark dried fruits(definitely plum and cherry), moderate spice, a balance of phenols, esters and soft alcohol. This is a well balanced, smooth, and complex beer making a dangerous ale.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a trappist glass. Pours medium brown with medium copper highlights and small beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, medium body, medium/low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is dark candy sugar and some dark fruit (mostly fig).

Thick and sweet but more subtle than say kasteelbier... Complex aroma, caramel, port, liquorice, sugar and some dark malts, finish is dark and also Has some riep fruits... Big hazy white head on a black brownish body
Dark cherry nose. Elegant flavors of sweet roasted malt, cherry, tart finish. Another impressive Belgian strong masterpiece.

mahogany colour, one inch brownish head; aroma of figs, grape, some candy sugar and bread (?); taste of roasted sugar, candy sugar, figs again, and some minimal spicy alcohol - a bit too sweet and slightly watery, but otherwise cool belgian strong ale

Bottle from a shop somewhere in Belgium. Allot of dried fruits in both the smell and taste. Nice sweet malty taste. Easy to drink considering the ABV, actually the ABV is quite well hidden. Very nice beer. This was bought in 2011 so it has been sitting in my cellar for a while.
.75 bottle. Dark brown. Very nice dark malty, slight raisiny, nose. Estery, spicy. Body soft and full. Slightly sweet dark malts, dark raisins, plums. A very nicely balanced belgian dark.-- bb/wp8
Draft at Brasserie Het Anker. Pours dark red brown with creamy light brown head. Aroma of honey, roasted malt and milk chocolate. Medium body, sweet and malty sweet taste.
Smaak is vol stroop, kandij, gebrand suiker en kruiden, met lange, beetje peperige nasmaak. Aroma is veel van smaak, jonge wijn en hints van fruit. Beige kraag op bijna zwart.

330ml bottle from Beer Hawk - Pours a heavy copper brown with a thick long lasting tan-brown head with nice lacing. Has a floral nose with a sweet hint of alcohol and grape undertones. Very deep taste, raisin and grape tones that blend into a pleasant sweetness. The not too thin. yet not too thick mouth feel with a gentle carbonation that enhances the flavours. The finish is alcohol but with lingering wine and vanilla flavours. A good one overLL.

Bottle @ home picked up at Wilbur¬ís Fort Collins. Pours a bit hazy orangish brown appearance with a dark brown head. Grape bubblegum, caramel, candy sugar, somewhat toasty, plum, raisin aroma. A bit tangy, burnt caramelized sugary, dark fruity, raisin, plum, somewhat herbal, a bit chewy yeasty flavor that finishes pretty well balanced. Not a bad fucken beer.
Aroma sweet. Bronze with a nice off-white head. Round sweet and spicy. Quite thick. Interesting beer
Aroma of red berries, raisin and caramel. Wonderful, complex taste of cherry, lemon, honney, peppermint candy cane, raisin, and dark caramel. Sweet aftertaste.
Caramel, chocolate, coffee, herbs. Coffee black beer. Very sweet and heavy. Good nightcloser.

Bought a bottle at Bert¬ís Bierhuis. Has a dark brown color with a light brown and large white head, highly carbonated. Aroma of sweet caramel and lightly roasted. Spicy touch of coriander and a lot of fruit with a nice balance between sweet and bitter, and is a little sour. The finish is long a fruity. Overall, it¬ís what you like, but this beer is nearly as good as the triple Carolus. A really nice strong ale.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Dark brown to black collour, medium foamy mokka colloured head, coffee caramel malty sour smell with fruity hints, medium carbonation and bitterness with a gentle coffee touch but jet quite refreshing, a bit sticky and creamy mouth feeling, gentle sweet fruity banana and caramel/toffee like taste
airy smell, lots of carbontaion. Farmhouse in nose, like dupont. smooth late, pale color.

Dark amber pour. 
Off white head.
Bready malt, toffee & raisin aroma 
Dark fruits, caramel & more toffee on the tongue. 
Slow warm finish.
Pours a dark brown with caramel highlights and a white head that quickly fades to a cap. Nose is caramel, prunes, bread and yeast. Taste is prunes, malt sweetness, cloves and bread. Not bad.

330mL Bottle 8.5%. Have had this once before, but revisited as I lost tasting notes from my beer market trips in Toronto. Dark copper pour with a bubbly tan head, decent retention.heavy on carbonation Aroma is quite fruity. Full bodied. Creamy, buttery mouthfeel. Taste is ripened peaches, currant, raisin, spiciness. Extremely smooth finish and a lingering taste of sweet malt. Superb.

Bottle at St Veronus. Cloudy brown with a thin beige head. Aroma of chocolate and light spice. Taste: sweet milk chocolate, light spice - a little bit like "root beer". Nice, but didn¬ít blow me away.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Thuis uit 0,33l fles, donker van kleur helder, met cr√®me schuim. In de geur alcohol, zoetig en drop toffee tonen. Inmaak hoofdzakelijk zoete tonen met gebrande mout tonen. Wel in balans, maar had meer body mogen hebben.
Bottle at home, done from memory, rating is just for my own. I will edit if I drink it again, good beer, very drinkable
Poured a dark reddish brown with minimal head. Aroma of roast malt and berry fruit. Medium to full body, flavour of red berries and some nuttyness and a bitter/sweet end.
Clear deep red color, strong head, gentle caramel aroma with hints of fruits, smooth perfectly rounded sweet taste with ideal hint of bitterness. Very refreshing and highly recommendable.

Bottled at Pothuiske. Tnx Pierre for the hint! It is dark cloudy ruby with slightly off- white average fluffy head. Sweet fruity nose. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, toffee. Flavour is plums, raisins and soft hops. Sweet slightly caramellized finish with a bit of sting of the alcohol. Veyr nice, complex brew.
Bottle->Trappist.  Dark brown with thick frothy offwhite head.  Aroma: sweet malt, caramel, dark fruit.  Taste is sweet, with dark fruit, malt, brown sugar.  Good.
Pours an amber brown beer with a good white head. Smells like nuts. Taste is medium sweet.
Mooi bier met goede kraag. Normale reuk. Smaakt fris zoet met een licht brandende nasmaak.
Bottle at Pressklubben. Brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, plums, dark fruits. Flavour is similar to the aroma.
Aroma: Sweet, bit of red fruit, hint of roast  Appearance: Da rk brown, red glow, beige head, frothy, disappearing, medium lace  Taste: Sweet, red fruit, bit of roast

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 33cl bottle: 29/5/2013 (a: 8, ap: 4, t:7, p: 4, tot: 15)
33cl bottle: 17/9/2013 (a: 8, ap: 5, t:9, p: 4, tot: 17)
Rich balanced aroma of malt, caramel, chocolat, sweets, roast, herbs, liquorice and maybe a bit port.
Dark brown with a red shine, a little bit sparkling on the side of the glass, tan dense head. Lasting head and lacing head.
Tasted is rich as well. Burned, roasted, malts, caramel, warming, dark fruits, plums.
Full taste, a slight fizzyness and some bitter and alcohol at the end. Full bodied, sticky.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2014 @Mechelen, @Brouwerij het Anker, bruin met mininaal fijne kaki kraag aroma: hout, zoet, citrus, rood fruit (kersen/bessen), banaan, alcoholisch, port, caramel smaken: medium zoet, licht zuur, rood fruit (bes/kers), banaan, normaal gemout, peper, port/madeira, alcohol, caramel, rozijnen, gedroogd fruit volle body, romig, laag qua co2, afdronk: lang prettig kruidig en zoetig prima!

750 ml. corked and caged bottle. Aromas are sweet and fruity. Dried fruit, caramel and brown sugar. Color is red brown with a fizzy tan head that quickly disappears. Flavors of caramel, dark fruit, candied sugar. Sweet finish with no alcohol burn present. Very balanced and complex.

Pours clear dark red with a long lasting and light lacing frothy big beige head. Aroma is complex, spicy and very estery with anise, raisin, plum, roasted malt, caramel, bubblegum, pear, strawberry, red apple, apricot, banana and candy. Taste is medium sweet with a tiny acidic note. Body is medium, texture is light creamy and oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes sweet.

Cor rubi escura com espuma bege. Espuma com nos forma√ß√£o e persist√™ncia. No aroma, malte torrado, caramelo e passas. M√©dio dul√ßor. No sabor, caramelo, passas, ameixa preta no final. M√©dio dul√ßor, bem equilibrado, deixando no final um amargor muito agrad√°vel. Um cl√°ssico. Excelente.

Pours very dark red with a lot of lacing. 
Sweet malt aroma, roasty. Cherry or plum notes.
Strong raisin flavors with peppery notes. Quite sweet. A lovely Cherry background! Some roastiness. Dry and medium bitter end.
Medium-full bodied, slight alcohol warming. 
A complex and flavorful beer! I would consume this in large amounts, but it is not a session beer! 
330ml bottle, poured.

aspetto decisamente invitante..bel colore scuro/rossastro con schiuma pannosa..aroma molto speziato: liquirizia,frutta matura,alcool,poche note luppolate..gusto decisamente insufficiente per i miei gusti..la liquirizia (come la versione christmas) √® troppo troppo forte risultando sbilanciata sia nel gusto troppo dolce e speziato che nel retrogusto che √® effettivamente dolce con leggere punte amarognole..dopo 3 sorsi volevo cambiare birra..

330ml bottle from 1st choice, actually I bought 10 bottles at $7each anyway poured bottle into a chimay glass a lovely brown colour with a head that lasts and good lacing, aromas of fruitcake,the taste was very port like with fruitcake flavours, very smooth and too easy to drink for the abv can easily sink a few of these a very nice beer
Apparence chocolat noir, fine mousse brun clair. Bien malt√©e, go√ªts caramel et r√¥ti plus qu¬íappr√©ciables, petit retour sucr√© et fruit√©, agr√©able amertume, belle longueur.

Appearance: dark amber, nearly opaque, with a short, creamy light tan head and no lacing, although there¬ís a bit of syrupy legs going.   Aroma: prunes, raisins, clovey phenols, dark, yeasty spice, with cherries, molasses, and ginger snaps.   Taste: 	cherries and plums in heavy, boozy syrup, with some chocolate, caramel, and molasses, over clove, raisins, pumpernickel, and leather.   Finish: sweet and slightly syrupy, with a slowly growing boozy warmth.  Notes: Big, sweet, fruity, spicy, and slick, but somehow having a drinkable, accessible palate.  Bottle claims it¬ís a dubbel, ratebeer says it¬ís a BSA.  Seems like it could be in the middle.  If it¬ís a dubbel, it¬ís on the slick, sweet, boozy side of the house.  Either way, it was out-flipping-standing and I¬ím glad to have had it.

Thick and sweet but more subtle than say kasteelbier... Complex aroma, caramel, port, liquorice, sugar and some dark malts, finish is dark and also Has some riep fruits... Big hazy white head on a black brownish body... Nice stingy carbonization...

A dark brown color with a red tint and a white head. The aroma contains some dark fruit, spices, chocolate and alcohol. The flavor is rather sweet with more chocolate, raisins, caramel, and spices. The alcohol is showing a little bit in the finish. Overall this is a really good beer.
Dark ruby red colour. Aroma has a lot of sweetness in it, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, malts, aftertaste is bittersweet. Nice alcohol warmth, very well balanced.

Bottle from Tomlinson¬ís, Inverness [270413]
Reddish caramel brown, forthy white head that dissipates to a thinnish head with good lacing
Aroma of fruity dark malts, raisin malts, soft alcohol, dark vinous complex fruits, good rich raisin
Taste of smooth dark fruity malts, dark vinous fruits, rich raisin, soft belgian yeast, mainly fruity malts, alcohol well hidden, pleasant flavour
Palate - Medium carb, soft mouthfeel, smooth finish as main flavour with a very slight spicy hop note
Overall - Very smooth dark beer with complex dark fruits. The belgian yeast seems less prominent here than others of its type. Well balanced and smooth and rather easy drinking for the abv. Almost a 4.

Dark rusty brown pour with a big frothy off white head. Aromas of yeast, malts, and dried fruit. Nice complex flavors going on with notes of brown sugar and dough. Really well-rounded beer. Every Gouden Carolus I¬íve had to date has been nothing short of remarkable. Truly a great line of beers.
Bottle. Raisin and toffee malt aroma.  Murky brown with small head.  Sweet light raisin/toffee malt flavor.  Light body.  Surprisingly smooth.

75 cl bottle from dranken Geers. Dark brown body with a red shine. Large off white head. Nice but complex aroma. Taste is rather sweet with "drop" and "ster-annijs" with amedium bitter finish. Nice brown beer. *****

Subtle banana, dark fruit, toffee aroma. Balanced yeast character that doesn¬ít overwhelm.  Carbonation is lower than I would expect, but that fine.  Alcohol is also present, but not at all hot.  Medium body.  Brownish amber with a slight haze.  Went very well with a spicy fajita!

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2013 Koperkleurig en een hele mooie kraag die ook lang blijft en aan het glas plakt. Aroma van mout, fruitig. Smaakt zoetig met wat caramel , ik haal er niet veel detail uit. In het begin een volle smaak maar het eindigt wat dun. Wat druiven in de nasmaak.

de couleur marron avec leger col qui dure pas . on sens des arome fruit sucre avec caramel brule avec gout epice. en bouche un pure delice tout d abord un gout epic√© comme le poivre suivi dun gout sucre et pour finir un note houblons mais leger qui donne une tres bonne biere (rate 71)
pris pub le trefle a trois-rivieres
Draught. Deep amber with a thin head. Aroma is sweet fruit. Flavour is warming berry alco, some eheat on a dry wheat finish.
The Carolus Golden classic gives a dark brown coffee color. Delicious drinkable and warming

On tap in Palais des Beres, Geneva with PSingh during the wedding booze acquisition shopping extravaganza. Deep brown colour, white head. Strong malty aroma, boozy, fruit cake, prunes. Taste similar, quite heavy and sweet, alcoholic kick, quite drinkable considering. Wll made and asty, perhaps a bit syrupy sweet for me.

33cl bottle at BXL East. Pours a murky dark brown without much head. Aroma is raisins, plums, black cherries and sweet candy/sugar. Taste is malty with dark fruits, raisns and huge amounts of brown sugar. Really nice. Smooth. There is a lightness to this beer for the ABV and the dark fruit/sugar overtones. Really nice.
Fles. Topbier. Mooi schuim, mooie kleur. Een van de weinige waar ik met een gerust hart een krat van koop.

Bottle. Pours a rather dark brown color with a moderate off-white head. Nose is rather malty and sweet; it smells like there is candy in there with some almost cereal notes. Taste is definitely sweet, but stays fairly light for the gravity.
750ml bottle. Pours a caramel brown color with a nice head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, toffee, nuts, and some spices. Taste is sweet malts, caramel, molasses, with a hint of clove.
Dark red color with beige greamy and persistent head. Ripe fruit, nuts and candi sugar aroma. At taste is light sweet and medium bodied with fruity aroma and sugar sweetness.

Tap. Pours tawny brown with thin, creamy off-white head; decent retention and sparr lacing. Aroma is cookie and cereal malts, brown sugar, plums, black cherries, light yeast, and light floral hops. Flavor is sweet malts dominate with supporting dark fruit esters, light floral hops, and fresh dough; dry, lightly sweet finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
Bottle 0.33l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is hazy brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, plums, yeast and sweetness.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Typical belgian in which I had a few higher hopes in. An ok one but quite dull in the end very average.

Pours dark brown with a light head that fades to nothing and no lacing. Nose is maple syrup, some candi. Aromas are toffee, dark fruit, yeast. Tastes are medium sweet with little bitterness. Alcohol is well hidden. Body is medium-full, somewhat creamy with medium carbonation.

Nice deep brown colour with low head and smooth body. Nose of copper. Taste of medium malt, bitter hops, warm, grass, strong alcohol and torf. Quite easy to drink, very soul-warming and nice, but just little bit too bitter in the finish.

Clear mahogany with bit ruby, big creamy dense head that stays long and leaves lacing. Good looks. Lots of nuances in medium strong aroma, spices, herbs, ripe fruits (apples), alcohol, sweet aroma. Medium body with bit thin but soft feel, sweet, low carbonation, long fruity finish, lots of ripe dark fruits in flavor also.. bit get the feeling of fruits getting ripe in a garden and producing alcohol in mix, natural feel, caramel here also. Tasty and nuanced, liked this one.
smells almost like licorice liquor.. very tasty with a slight spice... mostly malty..tastes strong...very unique

Luscious dark red/brown colour. Full nose of fruit, spices, toffee. Smooth as silk in the mouth. Incredible flavours and palate. Long lasting finish. Blew my socks off when I first had it at Christmastime. My absolute favorite beer.

75cl. Bottle. 
Pours ruby read brown with tiny head. 
Aroma cherry, caramel, yeast, resin, spice. 
Taste caramel sweet, small bitter, some spice. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Nice dark beer. Jum.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2014 75cl. Flaske √∏l med korkproppe. 8,5%. Den sorte √∏l i det belgishe flag. Meget h√∏jt lysebrunt skum. Sindsvag god

Bottle. Pours dark amber-brown with a med-short head. Sweet fruit and yeast aroma. Medium-plus sweet flavor. Light-medium body, soft carbonation, sticky texture and a yeasty dry finish. Not all that interesting.

Poured a translucent mahogany brown with coppery tints. Two-finger light beige foamy head that held OK and laced OK. Low carbonation. Aroma of sweet caramel/molasses and malt. Taste initally sweet, followed with alcohol on the back of the mouth and finally with very faint peppery after-taste. Medium body. Alcohol and lasting sweetness on the finish.

Couleur marron avec une mousse beige moyenne. L¬íarome est de levures fruit√©es (les fruits sec, rasins), malt sucr√©e (comme caramel) et un peu d¬íalcool. C¬íest presque vineuse. Le go√ªt est pareil, mais avec les notes de clou de girofle et un amertume l√©g√®r a la finale. Tr√®s bonne.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2014 Aroma resembles, maybe it¬ís just me but it¬ís like red wine? Some fruits are in the aroma too. Big beautiful head, that stays nicely for long time! Very soft body, fruity flavor with just the perfect malts. Quick aftertaste that leaves hints of fruit flavor to ones mouth. Very good beer!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 appearance: Amber / light brown transparent colored. Creme foam top.

smell: First i get is brown sugar. It¬ís very sugary. I get some herbal hints, can¬ít really put my finger around it. Caramel/toffee with some sweet malts. 

taste: I get brown sugar, caramel, figs, prune, raisins, apple and a bit of a nutty / yeasty / herbal aftertaste. It lingers nicely. 

mouthfeel: Nicely rounded. Fluid with just a slighty dry finish. Medium carbonation. 

overall: I must say, my first one didn¬ít really do it for me. So it probably depends on my mood. The second one was very enjoyable. It¬ís a very easy and sweet beer. You don¬ít get much of the alcohol due the sweetness. I like the yeasty, dark fruit and brown sugar and nutty aroma combo. If i had to criticize it, it would probably be that it¬ís maybe too sweet. Which is nice if you crave for sweetness, but therefor lacks a bit of a kick and surprise as a whole. But if you¬íre in the mood for something like this, it¬ís really great.
Direi decisamente un ottimo bere, birra fatta come si deve, che non stanca anzi si gode parecchio dopo l¬íennesimo bicchiere...
Dark brown, nice white foam. Medium carbonation. Complex aroma of caramel, dark chocolate, dark fruits and spices. Alcoholic finish. Nice beer but a bit too sweet for me.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass at home. abv 8.5%
Very impressive appearance! Deep brown colour, with a beige head, three fingers tall, thick and with excellent retention. Heavy lacing around the glass. Red grapes on the aroma, sugars, plums, just a bit of alcohol on the back and another bit of vanilla.
Sweet taste, this one tastes like a good, sweet, red wine. Again vanilla, sugars, dark fruits,  a bite of alcohol mostly on the finish. Very complex.
Perfect mouthfeel, if not for the style, surely for my taste. Full, thick body,  oily but at the same time somewhat sticky on the palate, and the perfect amount of carbonation.
What an amazing beer. I was so surprised by its appearance and once I took a sniff and then a sip, this beer got me. Also, extra points for being so widely available, without having to chase it around. I¬íll make sure to grab a couple just for cellaring.

Cloudy, hazy translucent deep wine red colour; Excellent two-finger head with lasting beige foam and very frothy; Excellent, sticky lacing and notable carbonation; Very fragrant aroma of dark fruit and banana which can be smelt half a feet away once poured; Aroma includes plum, raisin, banana, vanilla, malt, bread and light alcohol; Very nice taste of strong raisin, burnt caramel, toffee, banana, dark chocolate, cloves, spices, hidden alcohol and hops. Full body, with a slick oily palate and a profile close to sweet stout (Mackeson XXX comes to mind). Sweetness and hop bitterness intertwined very nicely to form a coarse red wine-ish palate, with astringent hoppiness as finish. Slightly dry after taste, very easy to mouth.

Comments: hard to imagine a BSA taste like a sweet stout and works out fine, but here it is. This is an excellent and original BSA with very strong characters in every aspect. Highly recommended of course!

Pours hazy brown with a clumpy head massive lacing. Aroma is caramel, alchohol, sweet liquor. Taste really sweet banana covering a sour boozy finish

From the 750 ml corked, caged bottle stamped 05/08/13-1070.  I am guessing it is the 2011 batch because the store¬ís price tag was dated  03.05...perhaps 2012.   The pour is a wonderful looking mahogany brown with an off-white head and moderate retention. The aroma is enticing with its Belgian sugars, brown sugar, dark malts, yeast, plum, and vaguest of alcohol bite. The body is bold.  The taste begins sweet and malty with well-integrated alcohol and a peppery, slightly lingering finish. Prime stuff.

11.2oz bottle. Hazy red / brown color. Very little bubbly khaki head. Decent lace. My bottle is very flat, as the head suggested. Bigger body, no syrupy or viscous feel. Mostly sweet taste, light alcohol. Dark fruits, raisins in the flavor. Light fruity, little herbal hop. Though not very interesting, not a bad flavor to this... My bottle is just flat. Deep chestnut copper with a rich foamy off white head which lasts. Bright  floral and fruits in the aroma, strawberry, raspberry, along with darker date and molasses notes. Flavour follows the nose, with a rich sugary backbone and those lighter fruits sitting on top. Lovely richness to the mouthfeel, tending towards the creamy and slick. Carbonation is there but not over the top. Warming in the finish. Drank with a steaming bowl of mussels on a winter Sunday and thoroughly enjoyed.

Bottle at home. Pours a dark copper colour with an off white head which rapidly dissipates. Deep, rich, tasty beer full of rich sugary fruit flavours. Very drinkable for its ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. Aroma of toast and tropical fruit. Head small. Colour cola brown/red. Hazy. Taste is mango, apple, liquorice, walnut, fruitcake with a pronounced yeasty sweetness. Body is full-bodied and syrupy. Finish lingering and malty. Incredibly good.

Brown ale, low head. Fruity aromas and some roasty and coffe-like notes. Intense and ligthly sweet flavour (cream) and equlibrated taste. Good bitter taste and dry and long finish. One of the best beers i ever tried. 

Filip

Dark copper with good bubbly head and great lacing.  Vineous aroma with some caramel and yeasty notes.  Sweet brown sugar with raisins and bready aftertaste.  Sticky mouthfeel.  Good.

Pours a copper brown color with slight tan head.  Smell is dark fruits with some yeast.  Taste is slightly sweet with malty alcohol and breast at the end.  Medium mouthfeel with food lacing.

Head: lots of beige foam. Colour: clear ruby brown. Aroma: hops, caramel, sweet licorice. Taste: sweet. Palate: sweet, full, medium bitter finish, medium CO2. Overall: nice.

This beer is very easy to drink despite its high alcohol content. It seems like a beer hat should be drank in front of the fireplace while wearing a warm Christmas sweater. Warms the body and warms the heart.

33 cl bottle bought from Brussels. Dark brown beer with white head. Sweet malty aroma with ripe fruits. Spicy and malty taste with ripe fruits also. Nicely bodied, can¬ít taste any alcohol. The christmas version was better.

330 ml bottle from czar - thanks, buddy! Pours a dark brown to black with a reddish tint and a resilient white head. Smell is anise and sweet. Flavor is anise, sweet, red candies, blackberries & blueberries, bubble gum, very, very sweet. Finish has very light bitterness which comes in to counter all that sugar. Strong body, soft mouthfeel, weak to medium carbonation. Great dark belgian brew.

75cl bottle. Dark beer, brown, murky, dense creamy brownish head. Sharp nose with liquor roasted malts and zabaione (egg-nog). Aroma of roasted malts and brandy. Finish is spicy with fuel notes. Dry. 
Full bodied, proper carbonation, boozy, palatable, with character.
For sure a massive one, possibly an emperor¬ís beer indeed. However was a quick tasting not in the proper setting, i need to review in detail this one. It was good.

33 cl bottle. Dark brown color with no head. The aroma is brown sugar, caramel and roasty malt. I don¬ít like very much the taste of this beer. Too sweet and sugary and a little sour at the end, with skunky and alcoholic notes from time to time. Light to medium body, thin texture and soft carbonation. The finish is soft but the taste remains a lot of time. Overall an inconsistent beer. Not bad, but not my cup of tea either.
Meh. This wasn¬ít really my thing. There¬ís a very dark, roasted caramel flavor with a surprisingly boozy finish. I like the lighter, more drinkable goldens.

Ale oscura, notas de chocolate, largo retogusto, alcohol bien escondido. No espuma, no crema, no aroma, en comparaci√≥n con su prima Ambria, aunque es cierto q no es la misma receta, ciertos valores de full body se extra√±an. Tal vez la cerveza no se a√±ejo lo suficiente?
Nice taste with perfect dark color, a very good strong ale, i can easy recomend it to somebody

15/12/2012 Grande esposizione della birra fiera di Roma - alla spina. 
Birra scura, profumo di frutta scura e sentori di toffee/liquiriza predominanti.
Bevibile ma a piccole dosi con abbinamenti azzeccati.
Insomma non una birra per qualsiasi occasione, alemno per me.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly cream body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, nice dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, some yeast, caramel/toffee, dark fruit (notably plums), and spice; Nicely balanced; Pretty good.

old rating bottle shared with benzai at the buitenlust... dark brown color with nice red glow.. smell: malts some sweet with woods and earthy.. Taste: malts with dark fruits.. Good feel in mouth nice alcohol...

Bottle from Asahiya. Prunes, overripe apples, dark sugar, glue, and fumes in the nose. Hazy dark brown with a creamy beige head. Raisins, light grape juice initial; mid palate adds some tanginess; aftertaste has mild fruit and more fumes. Medium body. Great aroma. Flavors are solid, if not really so complex.

The beer is chestnut brown with an inch of beige head that coats the glass with sticky lacing. The aroma offers brown bread, yeast, light sweetness. Delicious flavor. Incredibly smooth on the palate with alcohol masterfully hidden. Subtle notes of banana and fruity sweetness lingers in the aftertaste. Overall, a terrific brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy dark amber color. Beige head with a lacing. Slightly yeasty aroma of syrup. Flavors are chocolate, coffee and fresh yeast. Medium sourness. Smooth on palate. It¬ís a well balanced package.

It¬ís a dark dirty amber with light lacing, There¬ís a strong candy sugar aroma mixed with malt and a fragrant hop . It starts out with a very sweet malty taste then  a semi bitter hop takes over, almost like a Belgian I.P.A but sweeter. This is good but a little too sweet for me.

Look: Dark brown reddish hues, off white lacing. Smell: Huge spices, toasted bread, oats, caramel, fruits, Belgian yeast notes. Taste: Toasty, spices, caramel, yeasty, faint tart fruits, oatmeal creaminess, burnt sugar, lingering finish. Feel: Medium body, soft light carbonation. Overall: This for a BSDA is well balanced. This brew is delicious. Recommended.

33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark brown color. Thin to medium head. Soft carbonation and light to medium body. Low sweetness and low to medium bitterness. Aroma is fruity, malty and there¬ís also a light coffee in it which is always good.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Helder, kastanjebruin bier met rood-oranje gloed en medium beige schuimkraag. Aroma van rijp donker fruit, toffee, gist en alcohol. Zoet en lichtdroog. Zacht en cr√®me√Øg.
Very good beer. Great aroma, slightly chocolate taste and slightly sweet aftertaste.

75cl bottle from Cotteridge Wines.Dark red brown beer with smallish head.Christmas cake aromas of sultanas and raisins straight away in the nose.Tasted sweet and alcoholic,figs,plums and dates in there.Brandy taste too which also comes through in the nose.Home made toffee taste in there somewhere too.This goes great with oak smoked cheddar cheese and apple chutney and is certainly a step up in taste from the 33cl bottle.Nice finish,will have again.

This bears the unmistakable hallmark of high gravity, mature conditioning. So rich in vitamins that I¬ím going to recommend it as a dietary supplement.  And my glass is perfect, covered in elephants and just the right thickness.

Hissing sound,  tasty looking deep brown with full rocky head. Deep nose of figs and prunes.
Shame about the taste. Far to dominated by a ridicuoulsy concentrated sugary confect quality on the tongue. Will need to try this again.

Bottle (0,33l) from BelgiskBryg.dk
Aroma of caramel malts and a bit yeasty. Dark reddish-brown with small head (in a Westmalle-glas anyway). Taste is sweet, a bit remeniscent of strong mead and... Banana. Soft carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Quite nice. I¬íll still stick to the blue Cuv√©e van de Kaizer.
Poured a dark reddish brown Smells of roasted malts, yeast esters, nuts mouthfeel with a nice finish.
Tap at Happy Gnome. Murky reddish brown pour with a foamy sticky head. Plays Iike a Dubbel - caramel, dark fruit, maybe a hint of nut. Fuller palate. Excellent.
Pours a stunning deep ruby with small fine off white head. Sweet malty and fruity aroma. Taste is sweet, caramel, spices. Carbonation is prickly but very fine. Lovely dry sweet finish.

Ruby body with spare light brown head that diminishes. Aroma contains some hops, herbs and citrus. There¬ís also a faint smell of yeast, like dough. Some pepper and a light alcohol are also noticeable.Palate is full, creamy and sticky. Carbonation is average. Flavor lasts long and starts with moderate sweetnes and acidity which turns into light bitterness. Fruits at the start, light hops at the end. Very good.
Bottle at Cafe de la Gare, Den Haag. Dark brown pour with an everlasting tan head. Big yeasty malty aroma with a nice fruity bitter taste with a nice zesty palate. A truly gorgeous ale.
Pitelne belgicke tmave pivo, ocas zadny, chut plna, trochu sladsi. Lahvac z bruselu.

Aroma slightly nutty but a little bit alcoholic. Appearence is a deep, deep brown that is so close to black, but not quite; head disappears quickly. Taste is lacking depth, but has some complexity; I taste a bit of spice, some nice bitterness, esters, particularly banana, but a touch too much alcohol takes away from that. Palate is nutty and alcoholic, again, like the taste, lacking anything substantial. Not a bad beer though.

M√©zeskal√°csos, k√°v√©s, karamelles √≠zvil√°g√∫ er≈ës ale!!!
Nagy kedvenc!!!!;-)

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 Deep brown, thick off white head, looks like winter; sweet, yeasty, alcoholic aroma; sweet, dark fruits - raisins, cherries; full mouthfeel; it has a lactic edge to it but manages at the same time to be reminiscent of port, particularly in the lingering fruity finish; good stuff for a cold Saturday night in October.
Delicious strong ale, with a hint of fruit and brown sugar, just enough, in my opinion a must!

750 ml bottle.  Pours brown with a long lasting off-white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of yeast, brown sugar, dark fruit, caramel, spicy hops and alcohol.  Body is full and smooth.  Plums, raisins, brown sugar, bready malt, spicy hops and alcohol fill the mouth.  Finish is long, semi-dry.  Wonderful brew.

Assaggiata in bottiglia da 75 cl. Ottimo colore scuro ma schiuma poco persistente. Al naso i sentori di caramello si fanno sentire ma senza essere troppo dolciastri o aggressivi. Piacevolissima al palato, aromatica e piena , con un ottimo finale persistente. La gradazione alcolica √® abbastanza alta, per cui non √® forse l¬íideale da bere a pasto.
Beatiful brown bear. Very bitter. A long finish with a liquorice flavor. One of my favorite.

Aroma has caramel, fruit, and some spice.  Flavor starts smooth and sweet, with bread, butter, and caramel/toffee.  A little hop bitterness and some alcohol in a smooth finish.  Really smooth, really tasty, and really good.
750ml bottle. Dark amber/brown color with big beige head. Aroma is dark fruits and nuts. Flavor is fruity, caramel, sweet.

This Belgian strong ale has a nice aroma exhibiting a hint of nuts and caramel. It appears dark brown with a minimal frothy head. The robust flavor is full bodied with a long finish and a thick texture. This is the perfect beer for a clod day, it will truly warm you up from the inside, out!
Color fosc, amb la corona blanca .Dol√ßa amb un toc amarg al final, amb cos.Molt agradable

330ml bottle. Caramel and sour aromas.Pours dark brown with redish reflections, Nice tan head, some persistance and lacing. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet, caramel and liquorice, with strong tart flavours, balanced. Enjoyable, but not my preferred sour one.

Dark red/brown in color and a little bit of tan foam. Lots of carbonation. The taste is fruity and spicy and both very sweet and sour too. Almost too much of everything. Definitely stays on the tongue a while after drinking. Not one of my favourite Belgian ales.

Pours the colour of dark milk chocolate with a disappearing lacing of white head. Smells of thick caramel syrup, brown sugar and Belgian yeast. The mouthfeel is remarkable; thick, velvety and sweet. Tastes of peppery carbonation at the front of the palate, deliciously sweet caramel in the middle and the trademark banana/clove flavour from the Belgian yeast right at the back of the palate. One of my personal favourites

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2012 Pours a dark brown or red with a head that disappears quickly. Medium lacing. Smells sweet and oaky. Soft carbonation. Palate goes through sweetness and some oaky bitterness at the end. There¬ís a slight bit of fruity sourness as well.  The aroma really wafts through your nostrils as you drink. Lots of sugar here, and a decent presence of alcohol. Bottle at the rhino.

Buona. Aroma potente di cioccolatini all¬íarancio e di caramello. Al Palato risulta subito dolce e vellutata. Il tutto avvolto da un senso alcolico, caldo e suadente. Buona non c¬í√® che dire. Forse un p√≤ troppo dolce? Forse... La riprover√≤.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 pours dark brown, steady white foam. tastes bitter, sweet, very little chocolat, sweetbitter aftertaste. nice carbonation, maybe too much sugar


Rerate after drinking 2 year old on draft @ gollem . 
Way more complex , less sweet-forward , this actualy is a 4,5 to me ! original rating was 3,6 so ill put 4,1 . Nice , age this , it ages better than westy 12 . I know , cause i had a 7 y old just before this one . Damn !
From a 33 cl bottle at home.  Thanks to Deanso.  Pours a dark brown with an off white head.  Caramel and honey aroma.  Sweet toffee and caramel. Very nice.

Red-tinged hazy brown, beige head. Nose is malt, dried fruit, rum, sweetness, alcohol. Taste is sweet toasty malt, raisins, rum, slight licorice. Finish is slight hoppiness, toastiness and warming booze. Smooth palate, soft carbonation. Good balance, great beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
This is a classic that have everything you want in a strong belgian beer. Fruity (apricot) aroma and lots of light roasted dark malts and a tuch of caramell but not so that it becomes sweet. Full body palette with a nice sparkle and chocolate. Some residual sweetness and a fine bitterness. A really fine beer for the winter or autom.

Deep red-brown body.  Thin off-white head.  Streaky lacing.  Nose is full of dark fruits (raisins and figs) and caramel.  The nose hints at the ABV and provides a nice snapshot of the yeast profile.  Flavor is semi-sweet with caramel, figs, raisins, and a little booze.  Medium bodied.  Appropriate carbonation.  Clean finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear coca cola dark brown with thin off white head. Banana, raisin, sweet, dark rum aroma. Moderate carbonation and body. Well balanced resin-y hop bitterness, set against roasted malt. Slightly cloying, warming, distantly metallic, whisky-like finish. Definitely a sipper. This was one of the first Belgian dark ales I ever had and it¬ís just as good as I remember it.

Bottle shared with the missus @ DHVL. Pours a deep brown color with a big tan head. The nose is honey, spice, harvest fruits and caramel. The taste is substantial roasted malts, toffee, nutmeg, allspice. Lightly vinuous, hints of raspberry and blueberry. Banana-like esters. Full body, but highly drinkable. Rich. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Cloudy copper, small light brown head. Good malty aroma, sweet, bread, lots of dark malts, fruit, spice. Caramel taste with hops, yeast and chocolate. Aftertaste of hops and spices. A good one.
Gedronken in buitenlust in oirschot met benzai, kleur is rood/bruin. Ruikt naar oud, bomen, zoet, caramel en een tikkeltje smokey. Smaakt zoet.
Pours dark amber with medium frothy head. Aromas of raisins and port; carbonated mouthfeel with a nice finish.

Bottle from vinmonopolet Storo enjoyed at home
Dark brown, tanned head. Smells of roasted malts, yeast esters, nuts and some hints of diacetyl. Medium sweet, quite dry, nutty, also some dried fruits in the back with some roastiness. Light bitter finish. A quite dry beer, the nuts and dry fruits are the best part for me
Pours a reddish brown color with minimal head.  Aroma of dark fruit, caramel,and alcohol.  Dark fruit flavor with caramel.  Sweet, but reasonable.  A sipping beer for sure.  Really great beer!

A-- Poured a dark reddish brown. Tints of red all through the glass. Started with a big 2 finger light brown head that too its time to settle down. Left lacing all through the drop.

S-- Dark fruits and a touch of strawberry (nice). Has a jammy smell to this. Not overly sweet though. Does have a bit of an alcoholic nose to it but not as big as others.

T-- Dark fruit with some raisin as well. Alcohol taste is more apparent in the first taste. Has a bit of a cognac taste to this.

M-- Fruity, sweet cognac feel. Very nice. Carbonation is perfect and feels very nice in the mouth. Has a warming quality as well but that goes to the cognac feel.

D-- Alcohol is there but hidden well. Fruit flavors really stand out and actually think of drinking jam in a way. Very appealing gets much better as it warms up.
Rich taste of caramel and a sweet touch. The older it is, the sweeter it tastes. Easy to drink and a nice head!

Excellent on the nose with strong malt flavours, bread and caramel. Dark fruits are more prominent in the taste than the malt flavours. Was expecting a good beer with plenty of flavour and I got it, enjoyable stuff.

Dark Belgian beer (Ale?).
Brown in colour, clear. Sweeter in taste; long, mild and delightful finish.
Easily one of the best darks I¬íve tried.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 It left kunckle or so of a darker colour head and the beer it¬ísself was brownish and it has a strong aroma. It was smooth in the mouth with hints of wood & caramel and on the way down and left a strong alcohol aftertaste that held the flavour of the beer until the next sip.

330ml 8.5 alc. Appearance is cloudy amber. It has a very floral aroma with a little caramel. The flavour is almost like a dry red wine with hints of caramel but without the sweetness of either. Across the palate is light smooth carbonation. Overall a very well blended beer it is high on my list.
Caramel, bread, cereal, basement aromas, leaves, alcohol, butterscotch, cooked vegetables, woody

Bottle from Alko. Brown color, beige head. Sweet taste with plum, barnyard, toast and earthy aromas. Sweet finish with some chocolate. Very nice Belgian ale.

Brown with a subtle red colour, and a tan head. Sweet caramel nose. A rich sweet flavour. But well balanced with caramel notes and a fresh fruity finnish. At last a Gouden Carolus I enjoy.[Bottle at Dags Euro 2012 beerfest]
red, brown, clear, minimal head, tan foam, caramel, nuts, roasty, soy sauce, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation,
brown, clear, tan foam, caramel, roasty, toast, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

25 June 2012, bottle. Light brown and cloudy. Nose is really really sweet; caramel, maple syrup, caramel. Lovely. Med/thin body, light carbonation. Really sweet, sugary goodness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl. bottle @ de Poortwachter, Culemborg. Dark red brown with a tan head. Aroma of mollasses, roasted malts and dark fruits.
Lively carbonation. Maybe a tad too sweet for my taste but otherwise a great example of a Belgian beer.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Best before 2014-11-09. Batch 11098. Dark red colour, bordering on brown with a medium big creamy head. Aroma is massive and laden with belgian yeast, bananas and hints of alcohol. Some notes of dried fruits and caramel or syrup as well. Flavour is sweet with faint bitter hints. Massive notes of belgian yeast, syrup and fruits. Some lingering notes of spices and alcohol.
750ml bottle. Dark copper color. Very thin beige head. Coffee, fruits, caramel, mild roastiness, raisins in aroma. Caramel, sweet sugary, slightly fizzy, raisins in flavor. Very good beer.

Greets one with the Belgian brown aroma of spices, currants, brown sugar and toffee. A real Sugar Daddy of a beer. It¬ís dark brown and retains its lacy tan head very well. If you¬íve ever had coffee syrup to mix in milk, you will recognize the sweet aged molasses taste of this beer. It¬ís less hoppy than some of the other Carolus beers, or at least it has more malt. Its thick and foamy without being over heavy like a porter. When I say that Belgian strong beers are my favorite, I really mean Belgian brown ales.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Globo. Saboreada en jun¬¥12. Brota con color marr√≥n oscuro y corona beige claro, cremosa y persistente. Trazos de licor de avellanas, maltas tostadas, leve fragancia azucarada y levadura en nariz. Entra de dulce malteado tostado. Gentil sensaci√≥n azucarada en boca  y sabores de fruta madura y desecada¬ñd√°tiles y pasas-.Sin l√∫pulos. Permanece cremosa con c√°lida sensaci√≥n por el ABV. Cuerpo pleno ysuave carbonataci√≥n ¬° Guau!
330ml bottle. Snifter glass. Enjoyed on jun¬¥12. Pours dark Brown in color with light beige, creamy, lasting crown. Hints of nutmeg liquor, toasted malts, slightly sugary fragancy  & yeast to the nose. Sweet toasted malty upfront. Gentle sugary mouthfeel, ripe & dried fruit ¬ñ dates & raisins- flavors. No hops. Lingers creamy with kind warming ABV. Full body, soft carbonation. Wow!!

From 330 ml bottle, this pours a deep brown with red highlights. The head is a tight flulffy tan one that lasts. Carbonation is quite lively, carrying aromas of bread, fruit and spice. Taste is dominated by fruit mince, cloves and cinnamn backed by solid malt that¬ís reminiscent of oat biscuits. The palate is long with warming alcohol on the finish. Great on a cool evening.

Undated 750 ml  casked and corked bottle pours a very hazy dark reddish brown  with a fair khaki head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma is complex.  It includes lots of raisins, prunes and, caramel, plus molasses, toffee, tobacco, roasted malt, chocolate, and a little yeast spiciness. At first the taste was too sweet for me, but it got more interesting as it warmed up.  The first sip made me wonder if this was beer or a sweet wine.  Has a drier but malty finish.. Carbonation is light to moderate and bodiy is almost full.  Mouthfeel is creamy and slick but enjoyable.    Alcohol is noticeable only on the first whiff and when your are finished.   Overall a very enjoyable, special, and complex brew no matter what syle you call it.  Its taste, complexity, and buzz  remind me of my all-time favorite: Schneider-Aventinus Weizen Eisbock.

4.1

BlackHaddock (1710) - Shropshire, ENGLAND - MAY 17, 2012
A brown 33cl bottle, best before 12st Oct 2011, drank on a damp and cold Jan evening in 2009. Poured into a Corsendonk tulip shapped glass. Deep red, dark ruby when held to a light source with a good solid foaming head, tan in colour. Sweet liquorice hits my nose, candy without the floss, a realy interesting aroma. The sweet liquorice smell is in the taste too, very prominent. Red and Blackberry tones bring the sweetness into check and the beer is a fine blend of differing flavours which merge into a great tasting beer. The 8.5% ABV isn¬ít masked completely, but it is well hidden by the richness of the beers body adding a luscious, sumptuous, mellow feel to the experience. An elaborate and elegant, highly-flavoured beer that was a joy to drink and review. There are not many beers better than this out there!

330ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a large head. Aroma is raisin malt, caramel, some alcohol and spice. Taste is sweet to start. Raisin. Warming alcohol on the finish with some yeast and candy sugars.
330 ml bottle from 16th St. Pours a dark amber/brown with very light head. Aromas of roasted malts,  figs and nuts. Hot, rich, dark fruit flavors, with spicy and malty middle, and warm finish. Nice.
Nice one! Dark, almost purple color with fluffy white head. It¬ís sweet with dark fruits and heavy taste of alcohol. Light carbonation and thin mouthfeel. It really have great flavours and aromas.

Dark brown color with thick brownish foam head. Lacing to glass and sticking to lip. Sweet fruity and caramel aroma, caramel in taste but still bitter enough for my taste. Did well with tomato soup. (Utrecht 201203)
Aroma of dark fruits, slight acetone, and a brown sugar finish.   Pours red with a lovely film.  Taste is sweet and light with dark fruits, caramel and yummy.  Delicious.
Not overpowering, smells of malts, caramel and bread. This is very smooth and reminds me of the Aventis Weizen bock.

Pours hazy brown/red, with ok beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of bananas, malt, caramel, and fruits. Taste is of bananas, caramel, alchool, malt, fruits. A very good beer. Nice complexity. Rich.

330ml bottle.  Pours a very dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is raisin malt, caramel, some alcohol and spice.  Taste is sweet to start.  Raisin.  Warming alcohol on the finish with some yeast and candy sugars.

Pours medium brown, ample head, moderate to soft carbonation. Aroma is complex malt with sweet fruit notes. Taste is moderately complex with tones of figs and raisins and slight warm alcohol. This is a good Belgian ale of moderate complexity. One I would not hesitate to try again or cellar.
330ml Bottle - Dark brown with red tinges. Dried fruit, roasted malt and liquorice in the aroma. Liquorice, raisins, marzipan and malt all feature in the taste.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur ambr√©e fonc√© rouge√¢tre, mousse moyenne de tenue moyenne qui garde une collerette. Des ar√¥mes de fruits m√ªrs, pruneaux, caramel, r√©glisse, alcool tr√®s bien masqu√©. Longueur moyenne mais suberbe texture onctueuse. Trouv√©e √† Roby - Menin

Shared 750ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown, auburn tinge against the light. A large, white head. Aroma is spicy, aniseed, dark fruits. Taste is loads of dark, dried fruit, dark malts, candysugar, dried apricots, dried cherries. Palate is full, not much carbonation.
This beer rocks ! Creamy, carbonation is perfect, you can taste malt fruits, alcohol and caramel notes. Awesome beer !

pours kahlua brown, decent small foamy head, good retention, sticky lacing, some CO2 streams. Medium-thick caramel malts on the nose. Drinks with 7/10-level sweetness with a bit of alcohol in the start, transitions into malted caramel, traces of chamomile, brown sugar, honey, finishes light bitter. Medium complexity, medium depth, good carry, good transitions, good drinkability. Overall solid but 1x is enough.
Bottle. Deep brown with a voluminous cream head plus lacing. Smells both doughy and like dry biscuit. Very sweet. Moderate carbonation but lingering sweetness.

Pours a clear, dark brown body with an intense red tint and a frothy, light-brown head that reduces to patches quite quickly. Good lacing. Toasted aroma with dark caramel, sweet dark (dried) fruits, spices and alcohol in the form of port wine. Quite sweet stuff, and if I¬íve understood my Master of Tasting (i.e. ClubGonzo) correctly, the sweet sugary caramel thing is dark candi sugar. Any objections? Anyway, a very pleasant aroma indeed! The sweetness is obvious in the taste as well: moderate to heavy sweet initial taste while this finish is moderate to light bitter. Flavours of alcoholic dried dark fruits with dark caramel. Goody! Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice beer that is very sweet without being cloying. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Storo, Oslo]

Aroma Excelente.... Casi Perfecto... Toques a madera, chocolate y vainilla. Aroma vinoso y acaramelado. Finales de cuero en virtud de la levadura.
A la vista es una cerveza color caoba con tintes rojizos, cuerpo medio. La corona de esupuma es ligera y de poca retenci√≥n.
Al probar este maravilloso caldo, la primer impresion que deja en la boca es dulce, acaramelado e intenso.
Al trago el dulzor cambia por la intensidad del alcohol, sin embargo los toques de cafe y finales de vainilla se hacen sentir. 
En general una cerveza que raya en la perfecci√≥n, ya que a pesra de ser dulce no empalaga en ning√∫n momento, siendo una excelente representante del estilo "Belgian Strong Ale".

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Color rubino scuro con un cappello di schiuma color panna di media altezza. Aroma con note di toffee, uvetta, altra frutta passita e noci; in bocca √® vinosa e dolce con sapori di zucchero scuro, caramello e ciliegie. Piuttosto corposa e bilanciata con un¬íeffervescenza gentile; nel finale, lungo e persistente, emergono alcune note acidule, difetto che pu√≤ essere riparato con un annetto di cantina.
Invecchiando si ammorbidisce e acquista complessit√†, mentre il retrogusto diventa pi√π secco.

Dense, dark color, a gentle soothing flavor with a hint of fruitiness in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.

Dark brown with a small head. Aroma and taste of toffee, tutti-frutti, plum, raisin and malt. A good beer.

Lite lagom doft. Smaken och k√§nslan √§r  ganska gr√§ddig. Kola och tutti frutti utan att n√•gon av delarna tar √∂ver. Trevlig liten lakrits ton med en gnutta t√•ng och tobak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet aroma with a smooth, fruit filled taste at the end.  Very good beer, glad I found it.
Malt, wine aroma. Rich complex malt that lingers. Really good. Glass is too thin though

A: Malty nose with intense hints of raisins and plums, lottle spices (cloves) and fusel alcohol notes
V: Bron with ruby highlights, head is thick and tan
F: Strong malty falvor with notes of plums, raisins and a bit of berries (rasp + cherry)
M: Warmth effect with meduim body and medium-high carb.
O: Intense maltiness with a bit of burnt flavor classic of Dubbel. Great beer.

Bottle 750 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma: Sweet, malt, banana, fruit and caramel. Taste: Sweet, malt, caramel and dark fruit. Alcohol tickles the tongue and warms. A bit watery. Overall: A really good and complex belgian strong ale.

Clear dark caramel brown colour, off-white head. Sweet malty aroma, quite fruity, lots of caramel, raisins, dried plums, tart touches. Sweet malty flavour, very rounded. Fine carbonation, small bubbles. Finish caramel, fruits and dried fruits. Nice.
(From 33cL bottle @ home)

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2012 Bottle, 33 cl. Unclear copper-brown beer with a decebt, mostly lasting foamy beige head, good retention. Fairly complex malty aroma with notes of caramel, coffee, brown sugar and dried dark fruits. Flavor is very sweet, too sweet for my palate, with a long finish, whe the alcohol makes it presence clear. Only light bitter. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation.  Might work as a beer for meditation....

AROMA: raisin, floral, grapes, wine
APPEARANCE: red, brown, clear, frothy
TASTE: medium sweetness, lightly bitter
PALATE: medium body, smooth, average carbonation, long finish
OVERALL: great beer with floral aromas and nice sweet finish.

rotten eggs, cheese, spruce, citrus, herbs, raisin, smoke, brown, sparkling, brown foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, umami, full body, creamy, oily feel, flat, long finish, bitter,

Light aroma, pours from a 33cl bottle - hazy brown with smallish head in a rochefort glass, no sediment.   Reminds me more of a quadrupel at first taste, not as syrupy though, but sweet all the same.  Slight alcoholic finish that belies its strong character.  Delightful.
Pretty sweet in flavor with notes of fruit and flowers. Dark brown in color with a high creamy head.

Some head, dark brown. Nose with a little sugar and an Orange note. Some candis and deep caramel. Semifull body and length. Sweet with brown sugar, sugar and again some orange notes.  Decent, but to simple.

02.03.2012. 0.33l Bottle. vinmonopolet.no. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Sweet malt aroma. Very sweet at first, but there is also some very good bitterness that comes in at the end. Very long lasting rich flavoured aftertaste. Rich body with lots af malt sweetness. Medium bitterness at first that gets stronger in the aftertaste. Since I like strong sweet beers this is really something for me! Very good.
Best of the Gouden Carous beers so far. Nothing original, but well done Belgian ale. A nice, smooth body.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. I¬íll update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

2012.02.23 - 750ml bottle in Chimay glass.  Pours medium dark copper, slightly red.  Any head disappears quickly leaving trace film and ring.  Aroma is a bit tart at first but mostly fruity notes like plum and raisin as noted by other reviews.  Taste matches aroma pretty well and has those fruity notes and a bit of malty sweetness.  A bit of alcohol and carbonation burn on initial impact but fades to smooth very fast.  Pretty tasty stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2012 
75 cl bottle. BBE 07.07.2012.
Seems to have gone a bit more sour with age, more dried, ripe fruits also. Stronger salty licorice on the flavor as well with the anise. Still a bit sugary and sticky palate which leaves a thick sticky layer on the tongue. So, some changes have happened, quite nice changes at that. Very good.
75 cl bottle. BBE 23.05.2014.
Originally rated on 20090228.
Pours dark ruby red color with medium head. Aroma of dark ripe fruits like plum and raisins, caramel malts, mild anise, some distant liquorice notes, yeast and some spice notes. Flavor of ripe fruits, yeast, sugar candy, caramel, anise and distant spices. Medium carbonation, mildly sour palate with a long sugary sweet finish. Very well balanced brew and excellent for aging.
5436

Murky reddish brown pour with large light tan head. Aroma of caramel, yeast and dark fruit. Taste is sweet, not overly though with caramel, plum, yeast and a slight hop finish. Nice carbonation and mouthfeel. Very good beer.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2012 Dark redbrown color with nice white head. For a beer with ("only") 8,5% alcohol it has got a very full body. It has a medium bitterness and i especially like the big (but not overwhelming) sweetness...

really nice caramel like aroma, clear amber color with a dense cream looking collar. The taste is sublime complex and sweet (caramel and herbs) with a long lasting after taste. Overall this is one of my favorite beer to drink in the cold winter.

0.33L bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours a clear deep reedish brown body, under two fingers of dense egg-shell colored head. Lovely belgo-yeasty aroma. Dried yellow fruits, flowers, bubble-gum and faint perfume. Also some refined caramel/toffee tones and hint of marzipan. Taste is substantially sweet. Far from sticky and cloying, rounded with a deep nutty and caramelly sweetness. Notes of raisins, burnt sugar and mild spices. Medium to full body. Slick in the mouth. Pleasant alcohol heath in a complex finish.  Very good, indeed.
Pours Dark with a 1 finger head kind of sour taste graet beer with nice smooth notes and a lot of flavor over all this is a goog beer

Dark ruby red with a small off white head and good lacing. Lovely floral bouquet, red wine, dark fruit, caramel, malt and a hint of spice on the nose. Medium carbonation with strong sweet and bitter citrus notes. There¬ís a little heat from the alcohol and spice. Quite malty with toffee apple qualities. It¬ís a delicious little sipper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

El aroma es de intensidad media, con notas predominante de malta y caramelo. Cerveza con apareiencia impecable, colo ambar obscuro, con cabeza de gran tama√±o, que presenta excelente retencion.

El sabor es dulce, pero se percive un poco de amargor, lo cual es bueno para que la cerveza no sea demasiado dulce. Igual que en el aroma predominan notas de malta y caramelo. Una gran cerveza.

[ ASPETTO ] 			
colore ambra molto scuro, tendente al marrone con riflessi porpora, velata

color beige,  buona presenza, compatta e resistente.

buona intensit√†, con lieviti in primo piano che si mescolano con note di caramello, frutta secca (fico, prugna) e sullo sfondo qualche nota alcolica che fornisce una sensazione quasi vinosa			
[ GUSTO ]			
inzia con un dolce pronunciato che cede poco a poco spazio a sapori di frutta matura, quasi candita; rimangono evidenti i lieviti ed un leggero tocco acidulo conduce al finale dove entrano in scena soavemente gli 8.5 gradi che dinamicizzano un poco il palato con note piccantine. il dolce rimane comunque persistente e si prolunga nel retrogusto dove a fatica si ritrova qualche nota amara.
