corpo medio, morbida in bocca, caronatazione nella media, alcohol avvertito sopratutto nel finale  e retrogusto			
COMMENTO FINALE			
dopo la versione natalizia, questa classica risulta maggiormente proiettata verso note dolci (strano ma vero); colpa 
forse di un un fruttato meno intenso e complesso, una alcolicit√† pi√π soave, che se da una parte la rende pi√π scorrevole e morbida al palato, dall¬íaltra priva di un giusto bilanciamento le note dolci, mancando quel tocco amaro-speziato ritrovato nella christmas . A mio giudizio personale, un pelino sotto la natalizia, rimanendo come preferita la Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor.
Une brune pas mauvaise, mais rien d¬íexceptionnel. Un go√ªt trop marqu√© et pas forc√©ment en bien.

Pours an opaque brown with a medium tan head...lively.  aroma is sweet with raisin and candy sugar...yeasty fruitiness.  Flavor follows suit...very sweet...some balance at the end with earthy hoppiness.  Mouthfeel is medium and silky and the finish is dry with an earthy hop note kicking in.
Aroma of dried dark fruits and some roasted malts. Taste the same with some chocolate and spices. Very nice mouthfeel on this one! I liked it a lot.

33 cl bottle, ruby red colour, stable beige head which sticks to the glass. Aromas of Apple, sugar dark fruits. Taste is sweet and light sour in the beginning, some cherries. Then sweet malts, dark fruits and chocolate. Light bitter. Aftertaste is long. Medium body.
Very Nice beer, full of flavour.

Bottle. Pours brown with a creamy beige head.  Aroma of spices, brown sugar, fruitiness , apples and yeast. Flavor of apples, brown sugar, yeast and malt.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice Belgian.

75 cl, bottled. Pours cloudy red with a beautiful head of cream. Aroma: Grapes, hops, malt, spices. Caramel, milk chocolate. Taste: Sweet, gentle bitterness. A bit of acidity. Taste is in my opinion a little too dominant in sweetness but still very enjoyable. Caramel. Grapes and hints of cherry. Base is toasted malt, very subtle. Alcohol compound. Spices. Palate: Medium body, near average carbonation. Leaves a gentle roasted malt flavour in the end. Pretty good.

Bottle from Nina¬ís. Pours an amber colour with a decent beige head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, yeast and apple seeds. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Long apple seed linger.

Were it no for the head, this would look like tawny port. As it stands, there is a cream coloured head on top that endures and leaves good lace. Mature aromas of cake, prunes, port, currants, marsala. Tastes of the same: rich and lip smacking. God I wish I had a cigar. Definitely a last beer of the evening: chewy, refined and a show stopper.

This is a very pleasant Belgian Strong, the 5th I¬íve tried in this style. Its not quite on par with Rochefort 8, which has a better nose on it, anyway I digress. I had Rochefort 8 in a Trappist glass, this in a large goblet like wine glass maybe that changed this. The nose is sweet, rich, dark fruits, sherry like but not as heavy. The appearance is dark brown, an initial frothy head goes to a lace. The taste of this is beautiful, roasty, fruity, brown sugar. On the palate its a medium carbonation which puts me off giving it a full 5/5, oily on the tongue but its full bodied, the high alcohol presence is obvious reminding me of Duvel. Its a good beer, for ¬£3.14 a bottle in Micro Bar, Manchester a bargain, very happy to have tried this one.
user_location: Chapel en le Frith, Derbyshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours dark brown with a high head. Aroma high belgian yeast and an earthy aroma. A classic typical belgian strong ale. Not Bad.

From the tap at the brewery tap. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malty, caramel sweet and yet at the same time slightly sherry like. Taste is nice and roasty, fruity cherry elements. Touch floral and very cake-like. An extremely nice dubbel.

33cl bottle. Dark Brown with a medium, tanned head. Nose : Toffee, chocolate with dried fruits and vanilla, banana aromas. Delicious nose. Sip : thick body with small carbonation. Sweet and surrounded by nose aromas. Very balanced esters overpowered by rich flavors of malts and ending with little bitter hops and little sour, milk coffee tongue. Really good beer. Easily one of the best dubbels.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with medium tan and diminishing head. Aroma is sweet, sugar, caramel, dry fruits and roasted malts. Flavour is chocolate, plumbcake, roasty, sweety, brown fruits, cherries, nuts and almonds are present, and with a final moderate alcoholic, bready and very long. Carbonation is medium to lively. Body is high. Texture is oily. This beer has been a great discovering.

Found this one sitting dusty at the back of the shelf. The bottle gushes instantly upon prying off the cap. The pour is a beautiful dark brown with a finger of light tan head leaving a thick band of lacing. Simply beautiful beer with some light bubbles popping on the surface. The nose is rich, sweet, malty brew with hints of raisin, toffee, candy sugars and plum. A noticable Belgian dubbel style yeast and spice with brown sugar. My first taste is a sublimely complex and rich beer with sweet malts and fruity flavors combined into one of the best Belgian Strong Ales I can imagine. A toffeed malt with a sweet Belgian candy sugar, raisins and plums. A hint of spice and a rich Belgian yeast and a hint of burndished alcohol on the finish. Classic has a full body and smooth taste with light carbonation. Overall, Gouden Carolus Classic is a fantastic Belgian style ale.

Bottle from the brewery.  Pours a clear, chestnut body with a frothy, tan head.  Decent lacing and head retention.  Brown sugar aroma with plums and light vanilla.  Seductive flavors of rich prune, dried cherries, cinnamon, and brown sugar.  Hints of nutmeg and vanilla follow.  Light alcohol presence.  Medium bodied with high carbonation.  Malty, well attenuated with some lingering alcohol warmth.  Delicious beer!
Dark beer with beige head. Fullbodied with portlike taste with overripe fruit. Like this one.
Bottle pours dark reddish brown with medium tan head. Aromas of plums, raisins, toffee, earth. Moderately sweet. Smooth, light body. Very good.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 0.33 bottle. Dark plum color, slightly cloudy and very well suited, big, creamy brownish head which leaves a nice lacing. Very rich aroma of dark malts, loads of brown sugar with noticeable honey-like sweetness alongside and some fruits. Taste is really sweet, technically malty but the amount of red fruits, sugar, spices, and and berries is so great that it becomes decisively fruity as well. A medium to full body and a very creamy texture, carbonation is average, and the finish medium-long and delicate; it follows the taste closely. Overall the beer is very good but could have a bit stronger aroma.

Bottle in a pint glass. Pours dark amber with slight sediment. Rich off white head and copious lacing. Nose is yeast, spices and perhaps barley. Aroma caramel malts, barley and candy. Taste is predominantly sweet. Aftertaste Is roasted. Body is full and texture is oily. A brew to be taken seriously. Medium carbonation.
This beer is dark and has a malty nutty taste and smell.  Pours dark with a small head. Average palate.
Dark brown. couple of inches of light brown head. Lots of alcohol in the nose. Very malty aroma. Belgian style yeast.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2013 75 cl bottle @¬†home, BBE 20.03.2011
A bit perfume-like aroma has somewhat spicy licorice, dark fruits, butter toffee,  belgian yeast and hints of mold on some sips. A bit too much CO2 on foamy palate. Flavour has licorice, spices and some belgian yeast. Some sips feel a bit thin but the aftertaste is always strong and spicy with some warming alcohol. Good, but I don¬ít think that it has improved much during the three years.
75 cl bottle @¬†home, BBE 25.06.2011
Rather rich on raisins, plums and syrupy notes. Good, but still I am not sure if this was worth aging. Score estimate: 3.9.
Aroma stays with you for entire beer, wonderful complex roasty toasty flavors. Color very appealing with nice tan/brown head. Overall great beer that is highly recommended.

330ml bottle from Cracked Kettle
BBE 16/03/14 - Pours dark brown with a medium foamy head. Strong aroma of dark fruits, plum, raisin and caramel. Taste is quite sweet and fruity with notes of plum and spices. Smooth, slightly carbonated and sweet finish. Okay, quite well balanced dark Belgian ale.

Bottle shared at a small RB/BA tasting...  Poured deep, dark reddish-brown with a thin beige head.  Some great prunes and plum characters on the nose.  Dark caramel and toffee sugars, malt, cherries and tangy plums with some mild yeast spice and alcohol towards the finish.
Nice dark-brown color with fair creamy collar. Creamy sweet but still abbey style smell. At first a mild abbey beer, but has a strong after-taste. Nice combination of things that I like.

11.2oz bottle in a Gouden Carolus Trappist glass.  Pours orangeish-brown with a thick, lacy, light tan head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, caramel malts with a little nuttiness, and some floral hops.  Pretty sweet, but the flavors are balanced well.  Smooth texture.  A good Belgian ale.

Bottle from csakajosor.hu. Poured dark brown, with a beige, lacing head.  Ripe, dark fruity nose of figs, raisins, caramel, roasted malts with alcohol present. More dark druits in the aroma, with hints of plums, honey, and melon. Medium dense body, with high carbonation. Sweet taste and finish. Good.

750 ml bottle. Finland. 
Dark reddish brown colour with small to average size creamy tan head. Caramel sweetness, yeast, dark fruits, dark maltiness and some fruity freshness in aroma. Flavour is slightly vinous with dark fruits, dark sweet malt, mild hops and some alcohol. Very smooth. Alcohol could be a bit more subdued though. Good Dubbel nevertheless.
Bottle pours a dark red/brown with a large foamy off white head. Scent is dark bread and fruit. Taste is fruits, wood, and yeast. Nice

0.33l bottle. This classic pours a clear dark dark ruby body with a nice and almost creamy khaki head. The aroma has notes of burned caramel, lots of fruits, plums, apples, strawberries and it also has some hints of brown sugar and grapes. Average carbonation, medium to full-bodied and it has a fantastic light oily mouthfeel. Sweet and fruity flavors with some nice and strong roasted caramel, brown sugar, also quite malty with some dark lightly burned raisins and dry figs. Damn, this was really good! A really nice little alcohol touch in the finish and it¬ís just leaving the mouth wanting more! Damned good!
4/5 in darkness. Smells caramell malty. Full caramell malty taste, with a sweet creamy finish.

Pours a nice a earthy brown in color with a tan head resting on top, good lacing.  Solid belgian yeast nose, spicy and earthy. Light flavor of figs or dates, with some great clove notes. smooth mouthfeel, with a nice mellow backdrop full of esters.

75 cl.bottle. Very deep, amber brown colour with a small, foamy, tanned head in my trappist glass. Complex aroma with dark fruits, alcohol, wood, and sweet berries. Sweet and malty rich taste.A beer on the sweet side but still quite delicious. High carbonation gives this beer a somewhat lighter mouthfeel and cuts through some of the richness. Medium length, sweet finish. A bit to sweet and more complex yeasts will bring this beer to a higher level (read world class). However it is an excellent beer.

750 ml. Deep amber body with red highlights. Large, frothy beige head, slowly diminishing. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel molasses, toasted grain. Basement aromas along with plum and raisin. Hints of orange and candi sugar. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet, lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Tastes of overripe, dark fruit, caramel, candi sugar. The close-to-too-much sweetness is reigned in at the finish by bitterness. Complex, dry. Enjoyable.

Pours a really murky brown with a nice creamy beige head. Aroma is caramel, dark fruit and alcohol. Taste is sweet and also caramel with toffee, dark fruits and spices. Light lingering bitterness in the finish. Very nice.

33cl bottle. Pours a chestnut colour with a red hue. There is a decent head but not quite what you expect from a well executed Belgian strong ale. The nose has very intense aromas of stewed apples, raisins and spice (ginger and nutmeg I think). The taste has massive notes of dates and raisins, this very slowly falls away and there is ginger cake and then liquorice on the end. The palate is huge on entry and it keeps going for a long time but halfway through there is a tangy note which eventually cleans the palate if the sweetness. It only just hides the alcohol but as they say by such small measures are battles lost or in this case won. A very complex and weighty beer!

Dark rich aroma. Opaque brown color with lots of head - most of it dissipated fairly quickly, but there was still about a finger¬ís worth of head on the beer after that. First taste is sweet, dark, almost winy and very complex, the taste stays with you for a while too. This is a beer to drink slowly, and very cool but not quite cold - so that the smell and flavors come through.

On tap at Churchkey yesterday. Served in a mini-snifter.

Pours a fairly-dark brown color with some crimson highlights. The nose brings forward a hefty amount of dark fruits along with some brown-sugar character. Dark fruits galore. Cherry and grape there as well. Flavor is lightly-sweet with plenty of fruit character and a creamy feel to back it all up. Chewy with moderate carbonation. Really well-done version of the style.
M√∂rkt hasseln√∂tsbrun med beige skum. Doft av torkad frukt och farinsocker. Viss alkohols√∂tma, br√§nt socker.
330mL bottle poured hazy light brown with light tan head with good retention and nice lace.  Aromas of caramel and some earthy tones.  Flavors well balanced with a little bit of alcohol.

Ar: Pears and molasses - medium intensity.
Ap: Cloudy brown - big light brown head with good retention and lacing, formed of very fine bubbles.
T: Molasses, dark caramel, and pear flavor dominate - sweet and deep maltiness, as well,  - finish is just a touch earthy.
P: Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation - CO2 keeps things dry
O: A very rich and flavorful abbey ale - deep malt character mingles with a really nice and complex ester profile.
Dark brown beer with a sweet caramel taste with an unfortunate hint of coffee. Didn¬ít enjoy this as mutch as I do with other dark brown Belgian Ale¬ís and that is mostly due to the coffee.
Excellent. Sweet and syrupy, and slightly bitter. Almost too strong.. but just almost.
At tap at Het Anker Brasserie in Mechelen.  Dark brown, with a prominant bubbly head.  Caramel, pure, spiced.  Very nice all round beer.  Nice fruity aroma.

Pours dark murky brown with a medium head that disappears quickly but leaves good lace. Aroma is of raisins, peaches, brown sugar and dough. Taste is predominantly sweet -  treacle, caramel, malt, raisins with a buttery finish. Delicious.
Bottle 33 cl. Aroma: caramel and slightly alcohol. Brown colour, small, light brown, head. Caramel flavour with some spiciness. Medium-body. Taste is sweet-bitter.

Pours dark brown with an off white tan head. Aroma is plum and grape. Taste is grape tartness, malt sweetness and, unfortunately, a lot of booze. Highly disappointing after the big build up with the aroma.

Bottle @ Home. 2010 vintage, BB = 2013. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, biscuits, plums, dates, raisins, spices. Taste is malt, biscuits, spices, dark fruit. Full body, soft carbonation. 7-3-7-3-12. 2006 vintage, BB=0510. Pours light golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt, biscuits, dark dried fruit, port, marzipan. Taste is strong portlike with dark fruit, nuts, marzipan. Full body, low carbonation. The aged one have more vinius notes, is sweeter and abit more flat, but is a very nice sipper. Aging a few bottles of thios atm. 8-3-8-4-15. Both tasted 011010

Bottle from Cork Screw shop in Edgbaston, Birmingham. Smells lovely: sweetened tobacco, bark and choc mousse. Flavours are a blend of the tart, the rich and the sweet. Caramel, wine, dried fruit. Not too heavy, but has defined, lasting flavour. Very balanced and tasty.

Der klassische Carolus ist dunkel, cremig der Schaum. Ein intensiv malziger und leicht holziger Duft umf√§chelt die Nase. 
Im Geschmack unglaublich weich und s√ºffig, wobei Malz und Karamellnoten die Oberhand haben. Ganz leichte Fruchtigkeit ist im Hintergrund zu erahnen. 
Hervorragend was hier geboten wird! Ein belgisches Strong Ale der Oberklasse.Test vom 20.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

23/06/2011 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 27/10/12 (2011-272)  Note: the bottle has probably been aged for around 1.5 year. I guess it can only get better!
Dark brown beer, bit cloudy, very creamy beige head, pretty stable, leaves nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: banana, caramel, dried fruits, bread.

Whole Foods Market, DC sampler 4-pack ($16): Pours a darkish brown with a light brown head. Aroma has sweet fruit, burnt sugar, a little bit of booze, and some anise. Some astringency in the taste. Rather on the sweet side of things, but not totally cloying. Not sticky really as some people noted. Rather on the complex side of things and has a warming aspect, which might be too much in my hot apartment right now. In any case, a good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2011 Served on a Chimay glass, some chocolate and berries scent and flavor, with some alcohol. Pours with small head, brown colour. Nice carbonation. Strong at first, but finishes fruity/sweet.. A great beer

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Re-rate: 33cl bottle @ Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Fantastic color: dark brown with a deep red glow coming through, love that color. Smell malts, medium sweetness, wood. Taste malts, sweetness, lightly alcohol, dark fruits. Lovely balance, medium to full carbo, medium to full body.
Expected a blonde type of beer (the name is Golden Carolus) so when it poured a brown, caramel colour i was surprised. Taste and smell are good. Mouthfeel is pretty much in balance with the beer.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Dark murky brown with off-white head. Aroma has caramel, grapes, tamarind, wholewheat bread, plums. Really quite a lot to it. Body is surprisingly light and fizzy. Not very sticky, even though it is fairly sweet. Aftertaste is long and balanced. A nice old fashioned but not dull Belgian ale. (33cl bottle at Lemmys) (Rating re-indexed)

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2011 Pours deep brown with an amber border. Creamy light brown head. Aroma is dark, dried fruit and wineous. Flavor is dark cane sugar, caramel burned malt, wineous, sweet dried fruit (prunes and raisins). Not overly sweet but just perfectly present. Distinct alcohol presence. Soft malty finish.
750 ml bottle pours a ruby/brown with an off white head.  Aromas of molasses, dark fruit and belgian yeast,  Medium bodied with a sweet finish

Bottle from Deanso¬ís cellar.  Pours dark amber-brown with small tan head.  Aroma has caramel, plum, berries and wheat. Flavor is a complex fruity balance with a lot of sweetness.  Extremely good for a cheap, easily available commercial beer.

Pours ruby brown with a beige head. Aroma is ripe fruits, plums, caramel and belgian yeasty sweetness. Taste is light alcoholic, some port maybe, ripe fruits, plums, caramel malts with a long duration.

Bottle 750ml @ home
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, dried fruits, alcohol and sugar. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

I drank GCC from tap and it was allright. Nice two finger head on top of the dark brown brew. Aroma has bits of cinnamon, some fruits and nuts. Alcohol is present, but not disturbing. The beer is easy to drink and easy to forget as well. Fine beer, but just not that special in my humble opinion.

pours dark ruby with a lasting off white head and some lacing.  aroma is rich with berries, licorice, yeast and cream.  taste is complex with overripe fruit, butter,  white grapes, and a little booze.  warms and prickles as it goes down.  this wine is so much akin to a fine sauvingnon blanc.
Amazing beer with great balance in alcohol and taste. Loved it and for sure will make it one of my often ones.

Slightly hazy deep red amber, it has a med-small tan head slowly shrinking to a foamy ring, no lace.

Aroma is very nice, rich brown bread, sweet plums and stewed fruit, brown sugar, caramelized toast.

Taste is wonderful, zesty spicy-sweet fruits, cherry, berries, plum, wood, caramelized bread crust, overall nice depth and richness. The feel is lively and engaging.
Commercial but a super beer at a good price.  Of course the vintage versions are even better but this one is really nice on a normal evening.

Bottle. Fluffy light tan head on a murky light amber-brown body. Lots of dark fruit, fig, light spice, and some citrus in the aroma. On the sweeter side in the flavor, dark sweet plums, some toffee, citrus, and a bit warming.  Lighter to medium body with bubbly carbonation.  Nice.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 on tap at the Doerak, Delft.
Not much head.  Rozy amber colour.  Lovely complex beer which is very easy to drink.  Good beer!
Bottle. Hazy brown/red with small with head. Flavour is malt, dark fruit, very sweet, yeast, hops and a little bitter.

Bouteille 330 mL - Couleur brune translucide avec une tonne de mousse. Ar√¥mes de miel, prune, caramel. Corps bien rond et sucr√©. Go√ªt de miel, dattes et prunes. un petit peu trop sucr√©e √† mon go√ªt.

From the bottle, pours a clear dark brown with a small off white foamy head.  Malty fruity aroma lending to malty fruity taste.  Cherries, malt syrup, a thin finish, a hint of alcohol. Fairly solid beer, but not one I¬íd reach for if in need of refreshment.

This beer pours a dark brown with little to no head.

The aroma is very light malts, you can totally smell the inverted sugar in the form of caramel, awesome. 

The taste is super malty as well showing off nice caramel/molasses. 

The feel is great and this is super easy to drink.

This beer is awesome, I would encourage all to drink this.
Hazy glowing red with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dried fruit and yeasty. Flavor is very sweet. Sweet finish with some alcohol. Too sweet to be balanced. 250311

2 year old bottle deep brown and red. Off white head, fades in chalice.     
Smells sweet Plums, raisins, fruitcake. 
Carbonation seems to have faded away, because that familiar Belgian crisp carbonation is absent, it¬ís not pushing any malt flavours out. Sweet tasting grape, sugars, vinous. Meh, too sweetish, not enough backbone.     
Ridiculously smooth tasting, almost imperceptible alcohol.  
BAD BOTTLE? BAD STORAGE?

Very nice dark strong ale with somewhat mysterious flavour that I can¬ít quite place.
Very nice dark brown pour with bubbly head. Smells of fruit and raisins. Strong, vaguely fruity taste. Typical Belgian ale, not nearly as good as Rochefort, but that¬ís a high bar. Very good overall.

brune/ambre, mousse beige.
Ar√¥me de sucre brun, malt, caramel avec qcq notesd e fruits et un subtile m√©lange de malt biscuit√©.
En bouche, le sucre brun ressort bien avec malt de caramel et un fini qui garde une pr√©sence de levure. Fruits noirs vont de la prune √† la cerise, au fini, je d√©tecte une fine amertume et une fine couche de caf√©.
Pours brown with a light head. Aroma is mostly sweet malts. Flavor is a bit too sweet for my taste. Mostly malts with the alcohol pushing through a bit. Pretty nice.

75cl bottle. Poured deep copper color with a nice frothy head. Aroma is sweet malty, dried fruits and some yeasty notes. Flavor is at first quite sticky sweet but as it warmens it gets much better. Still bit too sweet for my taste though. Sweet malt and fruity, raisin and plums with some alcohol. Finish is long and sweet.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a very dark, nearly opaque amber with a small tan head. The aroma is toffee, dates, black bread and a hint of citrus and flowers. The flavor is candy sweetness and only a little bitter. The palate is very heavy and thick, with a smooth and bitter finish. Overall, a heavy and delicious beer.

11.01.22 bottle from saq . Dark brown. A: Brown sugar, spice caramel. molasses, licorice. F : Full body it¬ís has a sweet finish with just a touch of bitterness at the end. O: Pretty amazing beer a must drink.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2011 one of the best dark brown beers i have drunk yet.
Sweet as a dark beer normally comes, but a lot of spices and fruity in the nose and flavour.
Very enjoyable, great head of dense small bubbles, taste is sweet and malty with a little chocolate and coffee, nice mouth feel

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2011 Bottle:
Light brown foamy head on top of a ruby brown colored beer.
Smell sticky malts, sweets, some spices and dark fruits. Nice smell.
Taste is a well balanced mix of malts, caramel, dark fruits, brown sugars, bitter, yeast, spices and hint of hops.
Biter sticky malty spicy aftertaste.
Soft tingly mouhfeel, low carbo, medium to full body body and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2012 Pitch dark brown black colour with a huge light brown head and great lacing. Malty sweet, with tones of coffee, chocolate, caramel, and brown sugar aroma. Full, low carbonated and smooth feel. Amazing, complex sweet flavour with a long lasting finish. Brilliant. (9/5/10/5/19)
Dark brown body, small off white head. Amazing strong malty aroma with chocolate, caramel, some coffee, plum, grapes, brown sugar, licorice. Full body, little carbonation. Great malty flavour with chocolate, caramel, dark fruits. Excellent.
Bottle 75 cl. Poured dark brown and red in colour with beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, yeast and brown sugar. Flavour is raisins, spices and sweet malty. Nice, enjoyable beer.

S√∂t√©tbarna sz√≠ne van , kis v√∂r√∂s √°rnyalattal. Vil√°gosbarna habja nem t√∫l nagy √©s el√©g hamar leapad, de √≠gy egy√ºtt nagyon sz√©p l√°tv√°ny. El√©gg√© testes, √©s az alkoholtartalm√°t is √©rzi az ember. Egy nagyon j√≥ darabr√≥l van sz√≥, nem lehet elmenni mellette.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2011 (33ml bottle) the nose has the vivide universe  found in complex   Abbt/Quaduppel alez...A silky  accent comforts the brain. iTS rich beer ,  nicely sweet  and enjoyably boozy - with notes of figs and a dark chocolate woodiness . Bordering on syrupy..loads of vibrant yeastiness.

750ml bottle split on Ann¬ís birthday.  Deep chestnut red-brown.  Big beige head, laces the glass.  Sweet brown sugar and dark pungent fruity tones, classic Belgian aroma, lots of sweet raisin.  Sweet nutty amber flavor, with a creamy malt backbone.  Very minimal hop character.  Very drinkable and smooth.  World Class beer all the way.  Somewhere between a Belgian Scotch Ale and a Trappist Dubbel.  Awesome.
dark reddish color, sweet fruity aroma, medium body, red berry like aftertaste. When temperature goes up, it develops a more sweet juicy taste.

The first time I tried this beer was on tap and gave me a very good impression. So I decided to buy it also on 75cl bottle to drink it at home peacefulness before dinner. Brown dark color, persistent froth, spicy, fruity, caramel and resin. Very appreciable.

75cl bottle at Het Anker. Amber-brown color with fine foam. Caramel and bright fruity aroma. Also some light bubble gum and banana. Semi-sweet flavor with medium bitterness and a drying finish with light alcohol. Nice stuff, but no the most amazing beer in their lineup.
Caramel aroma. Nice brown colour. Incredible full caramel malty taste. Bought at the SAQ in Gatineau.

750ml bottle. Dark mahogany body, big rocky head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with some fresh roastiness. Taste is smooth but complex: roasty taste with some yeast fruitiness, light toffee and brown sugar. There is even some light chocolate in the finish. Very enjoyable.

Lucent mahogany, thin beige head, creamy full body, medium carbonation.

Aroma: chocolate and dark roast malt, minerality, bright belgian yeast, and alcohol.

Taste: lots of fresh roast malt, abbey double, belgian yeast, slight minerality, and a hint of alcohol.

750 ml bottle from Alko (Mariehamn), cons 2010-12-24 Karlskoga
AR: fudgy dark chocolate, (a bit sick - the nose is not what it have been)
AP: dark brown colored body, high wee bubbly stouty dark beige head
F: scottish butter fudge, creme brul√©e, medium bitterness, warming feeling no alcohol sense, so well brewed!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 re rate: pours brown-reddish with nice beige head, good retention. caramel, toffee - semi-sweet and spicy. some fruitiness. lively and soft, medium body, nice herbal-grassy finish.

11.2 oz. bottle.  A dark brown pour.  First whiff is of alcohol with malt soon to follow with complex fruit after that.  Flavors included that alcohol, yeast, malt, brandy-esque fruit effects, and sugar cookies.  A delicious beer that brought pleasant warming on a cold evening.

Very dark brown with large foamy brown head.
Aroma is fruits, belgian yeast, caramel malts, wine.
Flavor is roasty, fruity, sweet, complex, and just plain tasty. Smooth with a slightly fruit-hop-funk finish.
Excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2011 An amazing,extremely drinkable beer.Redish brown colour with a nice head.Smell sweet,dark fruits,caramel,nuts,creme brulee.Taste nuts,caramel,roasted bread ,dry plum,light acided and bitter.nice alcohol warmth.Long lasting sweet finish.Great palate.The enjoy of dreaking.

Appearance: opaque brown with more clarity near the bottom and sides of glass. Tannish head soft and mousy fades to a thin layer while lace inches up the sides. Swirls nicely.

Nose: darkly bready and sweet without cloying. Black fruits in the back; tart then meaty and sweet. Black licorice, raisins. Intriguing addition of herbs in the back: clove seeds, juniper berries. Pumpernickel loaves.

Palate: bready, clean, sweet in middle, dark fruits, spiced, and herbed in finish. Shines bright atop my tongue. Chocolate cake underneath. Plums, prunes, black cherries up front. Whole clove and juniper berries in the middle which is where she is fullest. Tart dark fruit finish. Spice also mingles in the middle with their companionable herbs. Medium to heavy weight. Flavors meld into one without losing any of their verve.

Final Thoughts: the more Gouden Carolus beers I taste the more I respect their brewing prowess. Classical and modern at the same time, I simply fall in love with Belgium and her brews all over again¬Önot that this is a bad thing, not in the least.
Pours deep amber with thick foamy beige head and lacing.  Notes of malt and hops that seem wonderfully balanced.  Taste is more on the sweet side.

Bottle from the former Belgian Bier Cafe in Balmain. Pours a dark copper, with an average sized beige head. Berry aroma with hints of cinnamon. Flavours of berries, cherry, cinnamon, lighty spice, and some bready notes. Slight heat from the alcohol at the finish.

Good looking dark brown, holds its head well. Carmel nose.  Begins with sweet chocolate then dark fruit and toffe, very complex.  A very sweet beer too.  Maybe too sweet for my taste.  Finishes on a sweet note too.  Not quite as full palate as I would have expected.
Pours a dark brown with a light brown foam. Very well balanced malty and Belgian yeast flavors. Sweet but not too sweet, slightly bitter.

Bottle.  Pours clear dark brown with an average, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (dark fruit, cookie, caramel, toast), light hops (spicy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of dates, prune, alcohol, and vanilla.  Flavor is heavy malt (dark fruit, cookie, caramel, toast), light hops (spicy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of dates, prune, alcohol, and vanilla.  Full body, moderate warmth and carbonation, light creaminess with a dry finish.

0.33 l bottle.
Hazy dark brown pour with a small laceing, beige coloured head, which remain filmy.
Smell of chocolate, dried fruits and alcohol.
Nice slick mouthfeeled start escorted by a malty aroma of fruits, caramell and citrus notes.
Flavour is of toffee, chocolate, dried plums and alcohol sweetness.
The moderate bitter and alcoholy finish is spicy, light plain chocolate liked and warming, which remains in a chocolate-fruity flavoured aftertaste.
Overall a well-doned aroma and flavour, nice palate, too, but (for my opinion) the alcohol could be hidden better
Bottle. Hazy brown colour with small lastin white head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate, toffee, dried fruit, spice and alcohol.
Bottle 330ml. Color dark red with small head. Aroma dark fruits, sweet. Taste caramel, spicy, sweet, fruits.
Had at the Elfde Gebod in Antwerp. Lovely stuff. Warm and spicy but rather drinkable. Serving: Tap

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2011 750 ml bottle. Rated @ 21.3.2009.
Pours a dark brown colour with loads of carbonation. Small but lasting head. Fresh and fruity on the nose. Fruity flavour with notes of banana, cherries, chocolate and toffee. Alcohol comes through in the end. Great brew.
750 ml bottle. Rated @ xx.5.2011.
Had to drop points. Tasted a fresh bottle and a bottle after two years of aging. Fresh bottle was quite different I expected, quite stinging flavour of alcohol and fizzy carbonation. After two years of aging it has gone to smooth with loads of fruitiness, but it¬ís still not excellent. 4.2 -> 4.0
Nice hazy brown with a minimal head. Sweet aroma, caramel and floral touches. Bitter flavouring, is that coffee maybe? With a beautiful warming sensation. Cracking beer.
Pours a nice, very dark brown ale with a big frosty head.. Smooth, sweet, caramel and syrup. This is a good beer. You can taste a little bit of alcohol in it.

Dark brown, copper, and almost clear. Has an off-white head, mosty lasting. Aroma is mainly malty, notes of roasted caramel,..hummm. and used gear-oil. Faint alcohol and carbondioxide. Flavor is mainly sweet with a nice bitter finish. Creamy texture.
caramel, bread, toast, red, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, nice beer.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2013 Quel bonheur de retrouver la Carolus d¬íOr!  Le liquide a une robe brune rouge√¢tre et sa mousse se transforme en un mince anneau.  Quelques traces coll√©es aux parois du verre sont observ√©es.  Le nez est rempli de malt chocolat√© et caram√©lis√©.  Des esters fruit√©s √©manent du liquide : quelque chose comme un m√©lange de banane, de cerise et de raisin.  Un parfum fleuri est pr√©sent, peut-√™tre s¬íagit-il de l¬íalcool ou des houblons utilis√©s.  Au go√ªt, le malt est riche et chocolat√© avec une belle pr√©sence √©pic√©e.  L¬íalcool se fait sentir avec d√©licatesse.  En bouche, le liquide est de bonne corpulence et sa texture est liquoreuse.  La finale est  assez forte sur des notes ti√®des d¬íalcool et de grains sucr√©s et fruit√©s.

Bottle from Beer World, Brussels. Pours a dark brown body with a mid-sized, foamy beige top. Aroma is dark candy sugars, figs and almond pudding with hints of raisins and grapes. The almonds disappear in the taste, instead dark malty sweetness and port wine tones comes along, with hints of toffee and raisins. Solid classic Belgian strong ale composition from a classic series of great ales.

Molasses, brown sugar, and fig aroma in good proportions, each very distinct. Clear ruby brown, massive yellow billowy head, decent lacing. Flavor is a bit more muddled with smoked fig discernible. Some prune notes present. Silky mouthfeel, alcohol tasteful and subdued. Metallic at times. Fig leaf finish. Very good.

33cl bottle. Deep brown color with creamy beige head. Aroma of dark brown sugar, dried fruits, malt and caramel.Taste is similar with dried fruits caramel, spices and toffee. Full bodied with a good amount of carb. Overall, rich and complex, delightful.

Wonderful looking deep brown red and a matching light brown head. Loads of caramel, malts and sweet raisins. Bit of chocolate nut & raisin with just the right amount of hops. Smooth & creamy mouthfeel. Warming and very good indeed.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2010 Bouteille de 33 cl. Ar√¥mes tr√®s fruit√©s (fruits rouges, pruneaux) et l√©g√®rement √©pic√©s. Robe rousse fonc√©e, peu de mousse et effervescence plut√¥t faible pour le style. En bouche, les fruits sont tr√®s expressifs et accompagn√©s d¬íun sucre d¬íorge bien rond. La bi√®re est tr√®s sucr√©e, ce qui r√©duit la facilit√© √† laquelle elle se boit. Finale sucr√©e o√π l¬íalcool demeure tr√®s bien dissimul√©.

Strong, strong smell of fruit and alcohol.  I knew this one was going to have a rich, robust taste.  Appearance was great.  Only a good head, but excellent color.

Was awfully sweet.  Great for the first half.. but the sweetness wore on me.

Draft. Brown with reddish glow, medium tanned head.
Aroma of roasted malt and loads of caramel, some spices.
Flavour is quite sweet of caramel and roasted malts with some spices.
Good beer but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Bottle 330ml. Nice brownish-reddish colour, beige head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel. Nice velvety taste of chocolate, round, full-bodied. very good beer. Hard to beat. I had 6,4%, 7,5% and 8,5% over the last 15 years. I¬ím glad it¬ís back in Qu√©bec.
Clear amber coloured beer with large rocky white head and no carbonation visible. A spicy and malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is roasted bitter, quite long finish. Good one.

330ml bottle. Dark brown fruitcake colour with a level coffee coloured foam head. Stewed and spiced fruit aromas, rum and raisin lead into a rich flavour of plum pudding and dried fruits. Smooth in the mouth, like velvet and almost creamy with the high alcohol content warming the throat.

Bottle. Deep brown with a reddish hue and quickly disappearing light brown head. Malty aroma of caramel and ripe dark fruit. Rich and sweet flavour of chocolate, coffee and fruit. A touch of sourness in the palate and a light bitterness is present in the finish.

750ml bottle from 16th St. Liquor in West Vancouver. Shared with DrueS. Pours a huge off white head with excellent lacing, colour is Dark amber/brown. This beer looks stunning in the glass. Aroma is dominated by plumb and a bit of yeast, quite strong actually. First sip is pretty sweet on the tongue, plenty of other flavours.. Plums, raisins, a bit of coffee or chocolate. Finish is quite strong, with the alcohol coming through and providing some warmth. Very pleasing.

Clear dark brown some burgundy shining through very limited skiff but this still managed to leave behind some lacing. First aroma that hit me was banana an alcohol kicker, good clove and some black liquorish I think. Been a while since I¬íve had a beer like this and man do I miss them.  Taste is yummy and smooth but not a thick chewy flavor. Banana , clove, possible vanilla. The alcohol is completely hidden from the taste but it is giving me I nice warm feeling inside. Spicy sweet overall taste with perfect wheaty banana, good brew.

The pour is a translucent, rusty brown color with a full, beige, creamy head which settles to a creamy, frothy layer and leaves tight, frothy lace.  The nose is sweet and a bit simple; dark candi sugar, date, estery yeast, a light herbal note (fennel seed?), and some candied raisins.  The flavor is much of the same with dark candi sugar, date, candied raisins, light caramel, and estery yeast.  The palate is thin but it seems to work in this beer; medium, creamy, round, and soft.  The finish is still sweet, with sugar, date, and yeast.  The beer was extremely drinkable and pleasant but simplicity and sweetness make it only average.

head: thick beige , 2 fingers 
colour: dark brown 
smell: grains, wheats, earthy , sugar, anis, coriander , yeast
taste: alcohol, malts, sourness, sweetness, anis, sugar candy like taste, brown bread , spelt(?) , sour/hopy dry end

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2010 Bottle at home, 33cl 8.5% version . Pours out dark brown, medium to big off-white head, could hold some longer, but looks are good and it sticks nice to the glass. A bit weird smell. Yeast and spices, some nuts. Weird but not bad. Pretty full bodied bread-cookies taste, nicely spiced, and good balanced. Didn¬ít drink this beer for many years, a bit sad, cause didn¬ít remember it was this good.

Bottle. Color is amber with soft orange and a nice fluffy head.  Aroma is mixed orange and red fruit, sophisticated with hints of toffee and butterscotch.  Flavor maintains Belgian dark candy sugar, fragrant herbs, cotton candy and soft diacetyl.  Somehow, the herbal-floral esters just integrate so nicely here. Mature, distinct, outstanding.

Pours dark brown with a big, somewhat foamy light brown head. A few dark speckles show up on top of the head. Nose is brown sugar and caramel and quite nice. Flavor is crisp and very well balanced: a big brown sugary belgian malt is shadowed by moderate bitter hops and an almost porter-like roasty quality. Alcohol is hidden beautifully. The carbonation adds to the sharpness of the flavor. This is an exceptionally good beer and one of the best belgian strongs I¬íve had.

Grabbed bottle from Mint in Tarrytown, NY.  Pour is a walnut brown with large beige froathy head.  Aroma of banana and caramel.  tastes of black cherry, toffee, the woods, and roasty maltiness.   thick but not hard to drink.

Purchased at the LCBO with a best before date of 14/07/12. Pours a deep red-orange colour with a big beige head with medium retention and some wavy lace. Very tiny bubble carbonation that is light to average. Complex aromas of banana, nuts, dark fruits, caramel, yeast and hints of molasses, but not overpowering. Not a thick brew, medium-bodied with just a little stickiness. I do not feel any burn at all (very well-hidden alcohol). The taste is on the sweet side with brown sugars, syrup, caramel, but not too sweet either. Notes of wood, banana and a little metallic flavour in the aftertaste. A pretty interesting beer with lots of aromas and taste that is not too strong in any department, just very well-brewed, and easy drinking for such a high alcohol content.

330ml bottle - $3.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out an opaque, darkened walnut brown body with a modest-sized, short-lived, ivory-hued head.

Smell: A bright, spirited nose, smelling of muscovado sugar, chocolate, freshly-grated spices, rum raisin ice cream, and fruit jams both lightly tart and sweet.

Taste: A sweet, sweet beginning, with chocolate stirred up with sticky, sugary treacle. A slideshow of various tastes carouses the tongue: sweet cherries, dates, macerated raisins, black licorice, and a teensy weensy hint of spearmint gum. After some minutes, it starts to even hint at Mr. Pibb. Notable alcohol warmth on the fruity, semi-dry finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-high carbonation.

Drinkability: I felt I had truly lived this beer, and not just chugged it down. Bold and flavorful, it makes for a lovely early evening sipper.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red/brown beer with a nice white head. Very impressive strong aroma which I coudn¬ít stop sniffing it. Hints of yeast, sweet fruits and Belgian candy. Very sweet taste with a lot of hints that reminded me of (Belgian) candy. Full body. Very nice Belgian ale!

This beer pours very dark in color, and hard to see through. The head is light tan color, mine poured very big. You can smell both the sweetness and the dryness of this beer. It has a musty chocolate and coffee smell that is balanced by a noticeable hop character. The flavor is complex and really delicious - caramel, chocolate, coffee are the easiest to pinpoint. Other flavors are nuts, resin, bubblegum, and dough. This beer was easy to drink and complex. I could see myself drinking 2 or 3 because of the complexity and flavor. It is well balanced between its sweetness and dryness. An interesting note for this one is that the beer was not roasty or smokey.

Relatively fresh bottle

Warm, spicy aroma, plenty of fresh-baked brown bread and molasses. Quite sweet (a bit too sweet) with fountain cola notes, plummy with a spicy finish. Slight heat from the alcohol. Not the masterpiece that Cuvee de Kaiser is (richness and complexity not adequate to offset the sweetness) but still a pretty solid beer.

28-05-2010: Solides aromes de malt caramel avec des notes de beurre, de chocolat et de vin rouge. D¬íun brun relativement fonc√©, avec de petits reflets rouge et un peu trouble. La mousse disparait asser rapidement. En bouche, elle est ronde, mais pleine de gout, avec des notes de malt, de caramel, de chocolat, de pain frais et d¬íalcool en douceur.

Bottle from Sam¬ís.   Pours dark amber/brown, hazy and without much head.  Nose of dark stewed fruits--dates, figs, dark apricots.  Some cola and birch notes.  The cola/birch notes come out more in the taste, as well as some mild vanilla.  Closing my eyes, I¬ím reminded of a root beer float, though much more is going on, of course.  Seems like the base upon which Gouden Carolus Noel is built.  I love that the description says it¬ís "rich in vitamins."  Light palate for the alcohol. Great beer.

750 ml. Rating the beer I chose for with my birthday steak. Great choice for red meat. Perfect balance of sweet and dry. The ultimate brown ale. I expected a heavier creamier mouth feel and i was surprised at it¬ís lightness. This is not a bad thing. It¬ís was perfect.

Gouden Carolus--Carolus D¬íOr Belgian Ale--2008 25.4 oz. Corked Bottle.  8.50% ABV.  15 IBU¬ís?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Belgian Ale--Dubbel.  Thin fizzy mild lace off white head.  Clear dark ruby color.  No sediment.  Mild hop rich black cherry toffee Belgian ester front.  Mild creamy cloying sweet rich malty toffee fruit complex sour hint tasty body.  Warm mellow spice cloying fruit malt end.  Thick.  Sampled 11/2/2008.  $9.99	 Each.
Really big body and nice off-white head. Unusual (for this style) banana aroma but otherwise nice caramelly malts. Nice beer
33 cl bottle, pours dark amber with a minor head, aroma of dark fruits and resins, taste is medium sweet , slightly bitter with a nice finish.
Very dark amber pour in glass. Almost black. Nose is dark fruits, malts, resins. Taste is roasted malts, woods and slight smoke. Rated 2/24/03

33cl bottle poured into a Rochefort Trappist glass.  Deep amber with ample creamy tan head.  Aroma is dark fruit, banana, bubblegum, vanilla, milk.  Flavor is sweet, toasted malt, wood, slight alcohol.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation.  Finish is subtle, bittersweet, moderately lasting.  A rich, complex brew.  Quite enjoyable.

Bottle.

A - Dark mahogany amber color with a large, thicky, creamy, frothy, very light beige head. Very good retention and a nice thick creamy lacing left.

S - Nice mix of fruit and spiced (orange, some dark fruit, coriander, and clove) and some dark malt, molasses/brown sugar, caramel, and some rum soaked fruit.

T - Initially fairly sweet with a good amount of caramel and toffee malt, some banana and bubblegum (similar to a dunkelwizen), and some fruitiness (both citrusy and dark fruit along with some golden fruit). Then some of the spices (clove in particular but also coriander and other typical Belgian spices) come out and there is a bit more of a kick. Faint hints of chocolate and licorice in the background, not much but just enough to be detected every once in a while. Finishes with a good amount of fruity flavors and the malt lingers a bit after the sip.

M - Light to medium body, pretty light for the style, with slightly above average carbonation. Somewhat sticky flavors but the beer is a little smooth, not really creamy though.

D - Good drinkability. Good amount of fruit and sweetness but not cloying or over the top. Easy to drink with a nice mix and balance of flavors. A bit of a sipper, but the alcohol is very well hidden.

Notes: A very nice beer to sip on. A good amount of full fruity flavors including dark fruit, golden fruit, and citrus all mixing (dark most prominent). It is a bit digestif liqueur/port like in that it is pretty fruity and full flavors. Very enjoyable easy to drink beer.

330ml.bottle from L.C.B.O. Ottawa. The color is a dark brown with a thin beige head. The aroma is a heavy one of malt and sweet caramel. The taste also of malt ,caramel and fruits like prunes.Some hops . This is a great allaround Belgium berr to enjoy.

Nice foamy mouthfeel without much aroma. Tastes instantaneously sweet (caramel, vanilla?) and slightly malty. Finishes thinly, unbalanced, with a slightly unpleasant sweetness. Not an amazing finish, no lasting taste in mouth.
Nice brownish pour with a thin light tan head. Sweet malt, brown sugar and Belgian yeast in the aroma. Taste is more of the same, well balanced and tasty.
Pours a nice dark reddish amber color. Aromas of fruit, and some other hints, maybe some spices, maybe caramel. Flavor is a bittersweet, malty, and a hint of hops with a nice bittersweet finish.

Mar 14, 2010  
After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity not wall adhesive light brown foam collar which was fine and evenly of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. 

The beer has a thick dark brown color and a sugar sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a caramel touch. This beer smells light fruity.

bottle. Poured hazy opaque brown with an orange hue.  Initial large beige head that recedes to a thin layer. Aroma of alcohol and burnt figs. Full mouthfeel with a syrupy texture. Sweet roasted malt flavour with some smokiness, raisins, and alcohol. A lingering bitterness.
Draft. Black beer with creamy head. Aroma of roasted malt. Little bit spicy, but some coffee tones. Good drinkable beer for nice evening.

Pours deep burgundy with a sizeable, tan head. Mild aroma of malt and molasses. Full flavour of malt, malt and a bit more malt. Sweet on the tongue with happy carbonation. A lingering finish with, you guessed it, more malt. Highly recommended as a full-flavoured, quaffable belgian.

Black beer with a dirty white head and a beautiful transparent red glow. Dried prunes, chocolate, toffee, liquorice smell. Warm with hints of wood. Bitter-sour with some sweetness. Spicy, coffee-powder bitterness with fruity bombom highlights. Rather stout-like.

750 ml bottle. Mahogany body, off white head. Aroma has caramel, bread, floral hops, raisin and a hint of roasted malt. Flavour has more malty aroma, some dark fruits. Balanced bitterness. Very nice one.
330ml bottle from a private order.  Dark pour with a thick white head.  Very nice beer indeed!

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2010 Beautiful dark pour with fat head. Aroma is faint, but is nicely floral/perfume. Smooth, mellow Belgian flavor. Warm, sticky and coating mouthfeel. Finish is easy and pleasant. Loses some of its appeal as it warms.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark brown pour with a beige head, lasts a fair while. Rich aromas of sultanas, christmas pudding, chocolate, banana, cinammon, vanilla. Lovely! Flavours of crisp red apples, caramel, sweet spices, raisins, chocolate, licorice, brown sugar. Sweet, vinous mouthfeel. Long alcohol warming finish. Yum!
Belle couleur brune avec une belle mousse √©paisse beige.Bon go√ªt d¬íalcool,caramel et √©pice.

330mL bottle.  Pours clear dark amber with a thin covering of bubbles.  Aroma of banana, apple, spices, alcohol and other volatiles.  Sweet flavour of honey, plums and bananas with some fruity acidity and sourness.  Medium bodied, average carbonation with a short acidic finish.

Bottle. The aroma is malty, light alcoholic, reminds me a little bit of a strong red wine. The head is medium large, creamy and beige with a long duration. The body is dark red. The taste is malty, light sweet, some wine, very nice. The body is medium strong, creamy and light dry with a lively carbonation.
12 oz bottle.  Pours deep ruby in colour, big beige head.  Sweet aroma with lots of yeast and sweet malt.  Flavour is big and sweet, with some yeast and perhaps prunes.  Pretty good!

33cl bottle. Hazy red color with a small white head. Aroma has sweet apple and malt. Taste is sweet with apple, malt and in the end a soft bitterness with a nice apple taste at your cheeks. The mouthfeel is soft and the drinkabilty is very good. A very nice brew.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 100110.
Amber with white head. Aroma and flavor of malt with caramel
Pours a deep brownish red beer with a beige head. Little hops and much sweetness, like bananas and raisins, a bit too much for me. Not very complex or special, but I still enjoyed it.

Deep ruby colour, big beige head.
Aroma of yeast, malts, sugar, dark fruit and corn.
Flavour is sweet, yeast, honey, dark fruit, alcohol, perfume and corn.
Mouthfeel is bubbly with small bubbles, slightly sticky.
All in all good, not fantastic

Big score, big taste/flavor/aroma/mouthfeel.
This is the first non I(however many I¬ís)IPA very high rated beer that I¬íve liked.  It wasn¬ít too much like a IStout or crazy and complicated like a barleywine.  Perhaps that was misspeaking though.  IT definitely was complicated.  But in a I¬ím getting notes of a lot of flavors here and its making me think and try and place it all.  It had more of a natural progression that the flavor bomb that can dominate a wee-lad like myself.

12 oz bottle, Mexico. Pours a dark brown color, no light passing through,  moderate head. Aroma is sweet and malty and kind of like a red wine. Not much floral or hop character noted. Taste was rather sweet but complex. Palate was smooth with a nice full body and aftertaste. Leaves you feeling very full and satisfied, almost as if you had a meal. Excellent beer, want to try it again.

Wow, this beer really does seem to "charm me with its warm coppery color and rich bouquet"! The beer pours a deep red with a fluffy head that fades a bit but not for lack of leaving some serious lace on the glass. The aroma has some port wine with tons of raisin and cherry with some booze (in a good way). The flavor is dominated by cherry cordial and cordial cherries. There is plenty of earthy oakiness and some old brandy in there as well. This is excellent beer.

Bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a small lasting tan head. Aromas of toffee, brown sugar, fruittiness, cola and light yeast. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a lightly warming finish. Flavors of toffee, brown sugar, fruittiness and spice with a smooth lightly warming lingering lightly sweet finish.
750 ml bottle a dark red brown colored beer aroma yeast sweetness fruity and spices and hints of rum taste dry fruit sweetness spices and some alcohol hints a nice beer

Reasonable off-white head, dark ruby brown with notes of orange. Aroma is aged red fruits (currants, raspberries), red wine, and slight alcohol. Definite red wine flavor - reminds me more of a lighter Malbec or Merlot as it gets warm -- sweet malts, and quite sweet and fruity. My girlfriend insists that there is some teriyaki, but I only get a tincture of it. Not much carbonation but enough, rather viscous and finishes dry in a way that belies the overall sweetness. Seems to be missing something from the middle -- perhaps a bit superficially flavored. I want something more robust to form the center. Still enjoyable.

Bottle. Spare off-white head over a clear ruby-black body. Aroma of rum, dried fruit, caramel and brown sugar. Tastes of dried fruit and rum/brandy, spicey-cloves with a gentle slightly bitter finish. Medium to full bodied, warm, spicey. Nice.

So I glance at this rating in the 98th percentile and I¬ím already intimidated. After spending so much time with √©l Cr√£ppo beer and pale lagers and strong syrupy crap, what would I think? Pours easily into a tulip glass, slightly foggy amber colour with a fast moving head that then settles down into a small pad on top. aroma of nuts, wood, syrup, malts. Taste is a heavy and deep mix of malts and barley, syrup, malts, caramel, with a dry finish and some hints of fruity lager at the end. Very complex, very drinkable, but indeed quite heavy and something to savour.

Pours a deep dark copper color with off-white head. Smell is very sweet, molasses, dark fruit. Taste isn¬ít quite as sweet as the aroma makes you believe. There¬ís caramel, prunes, a bit metallic. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Medium-bodied; alcohol is very well hidden.

Very dark brown color, faint, white head; aroma of fruits - red berries and banana, some spices and herbs, also sweet malt; not so fully bodied as one could have hoped, still quite smoot and very drinkable; flavor is very sweet (at first) of caramel, dark fruits and banana, even hints of liquorice, but then ending up in the peppery and slightly bitter, even dry finish.
330mL bottle, pours a reddish dark brown with a thin white head. Caramel malt dominates both the nose and palate. A fine Belgian.

Bottled sample via lubiere. Ruby in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of sweedish berry candies, pinot noir wine, and butter creame chocolates. Flaovrs are of stewed red berries, caramel, mild chocolate, and toasted nuts. Medium bodied. No big surprises here, yet all of the flavors are fairly well balanced. Perhaps a bit too fruity for my personal taste, but still fairly nice overall.
Het Anker always brews absolutely nice beers. Gouden Carolus classic is one of them. Well balanced at all, comlpexive aromas and flavors. One of my favourites.
Hearty, slightly burnt taste with warming alcohol flavor and a sort of dark bread note. Deep, dark red with good lace.

Thanks a lot to Chris at Ebenezer¬ís for this one. 1978 bottle. Murky brown pour, no carbonation. Both the nose and flavor were packed with caramel, molasses, and vinous booziness. Seems the oxidation made this brew somewhat one-dimensional, but still what a treat.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2010 Vintage 1978. Murky brown pour with no head to speak of. The aroma is caramel, wood, molasses, and some musty oxidization. The flavor is much the same with dampened flavors of caramel and one dimensional sweetness. The palate is rich, full, and viscous. An amazing opportunity to try this¬Ö Thanks Chris. 


Now for a more recent rating: Garnet brown pour with 1.5 fingers of lively foam. The aroma is an amazing concoction of dark fruits (raisin, plum, fig, date), and dark sugars (brown sugar, caramel, molasses). A super titillating yeasty fruit dough note comes through as well. The flavor holds bready dark fruit and caramel with gobs and gobs of well placed sweetness. It mimics the aroma in most ways. The palate is rich, full, viscous, silky, and creamy with a semi sticky sugary finish.

bottle at Comme Chez Soi belgian restaurant. served in the Gouden Carolus goblet. pours a somewhat cloudy copper colour, with not much of a head at all. aroma is lots of yeast and a slight hoppiness. loads of caramel in the taste, some dark fruit and wood, slight alcohol in the finish. the palate is very well balanced. this is one of my favorite belgians, a must try for any belgian ale lover.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Bottle. Pours dark brown. Beige head fades to less than a coat. Nose has prunes, yeast, vanilla, chocolate. First taste is very sweet, but straight away there¬ís some balancing astringency and spritz. Quite porty. Alcohol is pretty well integrated, ¬ítho it¬ís heavy and boozy. Complex flavours lurk. The finish is remarkably low in sweetness given that this is a very sweet beer. A little herbal/ medicinal. [rerate, score unchanged] [3.7] Colder, 9C. Lush dark fruit, sweetness is lifted away beautifully. Fresher perhaps, nothing porty about this one. Quality.

Some beers entice you at first and then leave you dissatisfied the more you drink of them. Gouden Carolus Classic does the opposite. The first sip was decent, the second was very nice, the third was great and the fourth was exquisite; as your tongue gets used to the slight bitterness, it turns into something increasingly smooth and tantalizing. Head is white and very fluffy on an apricot-gold head. Beautifully blended mixture of bitter and smooth; I taste pine, resin, caramel, peaches, apricot, vanilla, chocolate, wood, banana, figs... hard to identify it all but easy to enjoy. I will definitely be actively looking for this beer again. I loved it.

330ml Bottle: Pours a hazy copper, very thick marshmallow slightly off-white head atop. Aroma offers quite a nice hit of pine off the top, sour stone fruits, chocolate, caramel, butterscotch.. wow, it just keeps coming. Great stuff, although very little alcohol in the nose. First sip is just pure melted, caramelized sugar with peaches, cooked figs, raisins, a sharp bite of what seems like peppery cloves, and hints of hops alongside the warming alcohol. So complex, very sweet, just a great beer.
Very dark amber with a thick off-white head. Sharp peaches aroma. Smooth peach flavor with a bitter aftertaste. Decent beer but there are better Belgium beers out there.

Bottle - Dark red/brown with  beaut beige head.   Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Rich, sweet and fruity, (apple and plums), caramel, slightly spicy,a bit of alcohol. There is a bit of hoppiness and bitterness in the background  but it is predominantly a sweet beer.

Pours a fine hazy brown with little carbonation. Aroma is like wine, with date and banana notes. Taste is smooth and spicey, with a little acid bite under a lot of sweet, ripe fruit. Palate is a bit cloying. High gravity is well hidden.

Taster at the SLC tasting 2009 
Appearance: Pours brown with a nice tan head 
Aroma: Raisins and roasted malts with some chocolate 
Taste: Belgian candy and roasted malts. Very smooth

Pours clear amber with a creamy off-white head. Sweet aroma of caramel, honey, sugar and cherries. Very sweet flavor that almost attacks the senses. It has an almost sticky texture and medium carbonation. It finishes again very sweet. Too much sweetness involved in this one for me.

Pours ambery, ruby red color with well-lacing brownish froth. Dried cherry esters with mild clove spiciness and some weird leather or bubble gum-like yeast profile. Absolutely dark fruity malt-owned flavor profile. Sweet brandy-coke blend like initation with dryish molasses, sweet roots, caramelized figs, alcoholic prunes and so on....Easy, quaffable body with slight alcohol warmth, oily texture, mild carbonation. It¬ís bold and complex, but also very easy and refreshing. Nice stuff.

Deep red/brown color, cappuccino-like head, average persistence. 
Not so strong and long aroma. Caramel, fruits: prunes, berries, a bit of coffee/chocolate and alcohol.
Sweet taste with a not so strong bitter in the end.
The body is rather full. 
I liked it, rather good balance.

750ml caged&corked bottle. Pours dark slightly murky brown with orange and red highlights. The head pours medium-sized and light tan in color. Lots of small specks of lace are left on the glass. Lots of complex and fruity aromas - bubble gum, cherry, molasses, subtle cola, and subtle licorice - a touch of chocolate and roasted malt. Chewy malt+ester aroma with pleasant streaks of alcohol. Flavor is malty with odd ester profile - cola, soft fruit, very subtle acidity. There is a touch of oxidation and some bready, toasty malts. At mid-palate, esters turn to cherry with some clove phenols. Finish is dry with notes of alcohol, slight balancing bitterness, notes of dark malts, cocoa, and dark fruit. The mouthfeel is slippery and full bodied with a subtle alcohol sting and a soft (surprisingly low) level of carbonation. Overall, a very decent Belgian strong ale - very "Belgian" tasting and decadent. It is missing something - perhaps the low carbonation - that prevents it from being 4+ total score though.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2016 small frothy offwhite head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. muddy, thick, dark amberish-brown body. aroma: alcoho, red frruits, date, moderate malt, chocolate, ruby port. initial flavor: moderate sweet. final flavor: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, lively carbonation, oily texture, light astringent finish. red fruits in the palate - sweetness and astringency. Alcohol is more present as temperature rises. Tastes like Ruby Port. 300s.

sep16,2014average offwhite frothy head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thck dark brown body. aroma: heavy malt, caramel, milk chocolate, raisin, ruby port, alcohol. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet light acidic bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic moderate alcoholic finish. O amargor lembra um pouco de caf√©, mas bem leve. 200 s

Dec6th,¬í09: small off white rocky head. fair lacing. fully diminishing. translucid thick dark amber body. aroma: moderate malty, milk chocolate, mild coffee, raspberry, ruby port, cask wood, honey and alcohol. if: moderate sweet and bitter. ff: moderate sweet and heavy bitter. long duration. palate: full body, syrupy texture, medium carbonation and light alcoholic and metallic finish.Madeira, vinho do porto no paladar, muito complexa, sabor espetacular, aquecimento alco√≥lico, toques de frutas vermelhas no paladar; lembra cereja; perfeito balan√ßo dul√ßor/amargor; me lembrou a chambly noire da unibroue; framboesa; em alguns momentos tem a ard√™ncia alco√≥lica t√≠pica de um destilado; 

Nota: 450 skol

330 mL Bottle. Amber-brown body with a tan frothy head that settles to a foamy ring and leaves some lace; appearance-wise it really sits between a 2 and a 3. Toasted grains and raisins dominate in the aroma, alcohol comes through in an almost red wine-like expression, and there are accents of brown sugar, molasses, leather, and a very faint innuendo of bubblegum. Rich dark sweet malt and toasted grains dominate in the flavor, although this beer is really too sweet for my liking. Molasses and treacle stand out in the aftertaste and finish. Sweet, and somewhat prickly in the mouth although it has a sweet and syrupy lingering finish. For me it struggled to score a 3 in that it made a good first impression with the aroma but if not for the overwhelming sweetness, this beer could do better on my scoreboard.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2016 330ml, bottle. Here¬ís a complex beer. Almost pitch black, with a small head, looks fine indeed. Hints of raisin, dark fruits, chocolate, spices. Great after-taste. Very nice beer.

330 ml bottle from the LCBo
pours a cloudy murky belgian brown with a fair sized beige head
The aroma is herbs, candi sugar alcohol, 
The taste is yummy a little on the light side for a strong belgian but good none the less

Intens brown beer with light beige foam on top. Aroma is rich with some caramel, candi sugar, raisins and malts. Taste is smooth, with a rich caracter of malts, brown sugars, fruits and an intersting bittering in the finale.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours deep red-brown with small tan head. Nose of port, brown sugar. Taste a bit too sweet overall, but nice notes of raisin, port and brown sugar. Some vinous notes, with bitter finish.

0,33 l bottle.
Nice deep ruby-mahagony colored beer, poured clear with a nice foamy tan head that diminishes slowly to a small, delicious lacing one. Fine, alluring aroma with caramel and fine toasred malt, belgian yeast, candy sugar and pleasant fruits. Rich body, fine texture with roundish mouthfeel. Flavor of candy, caramel and toasted malt, moderated fruity esters like plum and raisins. Some roasted character in the fine aftertaste. Direct hit of the style.

Pours dark copper/brown with the customary thick, creamy head.
Aroma shows note of port, brown sugar, treacle, doughy yeast and sweet bready malt.
Flavours are massively rich. Very sweet with loads of treacle and dark candi sugar, as well as more of the doughy yeast and peppery phenols. Alcohol is quite powerful (which only increases the stature of this beer) to the point of becoming overpowering.
Carbonation is quite high, which partially helps to dry out the finish.
Too sweet, and too boozy for my liking.
Bottle. Reddish pour with white head. Aroma is very, very sweet tropical fruits (pineapples, bananas) some chocolate and alcohol. Very sweet taste as well, quite fruity. Warming mouthfeel.
Bottle. Malt, raisins and plums in aroma. Clear deep redbrown colour with soft beige head. Sweet spicy flavour of malt, raisins and discrete hops.
(bottle) Nice amber brown color with a port-like aroma.  The inital flavor is a slight molasses sweetness and raisins.  This is a nice beer.

strong molasses aroma, it is pitch black with a big offwhite head, molasses taste, very sweet tastes, winey, appropriate feel for a belgian strong ale. wasnt in the mood strangely enough at the time but i can see enjoying it
A pleasantlt generic Belgian Christmas ale. Big sweet tones of fig and raisin, honeyed malts and long sweetness with a solid slick feel. toffee vanilla and dark fruits, impressive stuff.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle.
Appearance: Very deep amber brown color with a small, foamy, tan head.
Aroma: Big, boozy, wine-like nose.  Red wine notes, wood, and berries.
Flavor: Sweet, malty, and rich.  Vinous notes, a bit of red grape, blackberry, sweet dark honey, dark brown sugar, some earth and wood.  A touch on the sweet side but still quite delicious.
Palate: High carbonation gives it a somewhat lighter mouthfee and cuts through some of the richness.  A medium-short, sweet finish.
Overall: Truly a classic and worth trying for sure.  Not quite to the level of a Struise Pannepot or Rochefort 8, but good none the less.  Recommended.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a dark copper/brown with moderate eggshell head.  Nose of raisins and malt.  Sweet, malty flavour with dark fruit and toffeeish notes.  Alcohol is fairly apparent.  Slick mouthfeel with a warming, boozy finish.  Nice.

Pours a mahogany brown with a short lived head. The aroma is sweet, fruity, heavy on the dark fruit, light vanilla, light metallic note. The flavour is sweet, almost too sweet, dark fruit is most prominent, with hints of anise popping in here and there, a touch of cocoa trys to balance things out, but in the end the sweetness wins. Syrupy mouthfeel. All and all a pretty decent brew, one i will probably buy again, I might try aging it and see how that goes.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2009 330ml bottle

pours a lightly clouded  dark brown ale with ruby highlights in the chalice. 2 finger puffy tan cap lasts well and laces.

Complex aromas, dark fruit, treacle, cocoa, herbs spice, sweet cookie dough. nice

Complex character and peppery mouth feel. Front side gives dark fruits and some vinous grape skin qualities then waves of sugary sweetness, roast cocoa, licorice and vanilla, ....long boozy warming finish. Sweet vinous after taste. 

....nice complexity of flavours but thin bodied so it does not hide it¬ís alcohol well and too sugary for my taste in Belgian ales.

this was a special cask conditioned version for weatherspoons 30th anniversary beer festival  
 nose grainy with malty tones and slightly vinious notes 
  flavour was malty sweet almost too sweet with a slight dry finish

330 mL bottle.  (bb 14/07/12).  Dark ruby-amber with a frothy two-finger white head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is sweet, with dark fruit, brown sugar and yeast.  Flavour is also quite sweet, with dried fruit such as raisins and prunes, licorice, a touch of chocolate, and caramel.  Good body.  A little sweet, but a very nice beer nonetheless.

750 ml bottle. Deep dark reddish brown colour, creamy light brown head. Sweet, toffee-like malty aroma with vanilla, dark fruits and yeast. Sweet, syrupy malty flavour with dark fruits and spices. Warming, smooth, very pleasant and nicely complex.

Part of a paired tasting and dinner at Belga Cafe.  Deep ruby reddish brown.  Aroma of raisin and cinnamon.  Flavor of port wine with balanced malt.  Ben Vinken described it as the first real beer he tasted in university at Leuven.

Bottle. 11.2 oz. Pours brown with a slight amber tint, Creamy tan head, which leaves beautiful lacing. Aroma is so complex; vanilla, coffee beans, figs, pepper, and chocolate. Warm, luxurious mouthfeel. Medium to heavy body. Long, smooth finish. Excellent Belgian strong.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours deep brown, with a tan head that dissipates with decent lacing. Sweet dark fruits and caramel on the nose, with similar on the palate with malt notes, and all very well balanced. A good Belgian ale.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 dark brown black coloured body with a off white head a roasted malty fruity spicy aroma a sweet fruity caramel malty spicy taste with a sweet fruity little bitter finish nice one

very nice head with good lacing, body is dark amber/brown/ruby, clear,aroma is caramelly malts, spices and a good deal of alc and yeast, then come biscuits, orange peel and liqueur, At the first sip it is smooth sweet, but afterwards there comes bitter/sour taste fighting against caramelly/syrupy notes, there is also strong numbness like after eating orange peel or just pepper, conclusion great,mature brew from land of strong beer, a bit too sweet but kicks in the head

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Bottle 330ml from Parkwille Cellars. Mind-blowing. Aroma has biscuits, chocolate, port, and dark fruit. Flavour starts sweet, to explode in a combination of bitter-sweet notes that last long. Full-bodied, nice mouthfeel, and some alcohol in the finish. Dark brown in colour with a long-lasting but thin head.

Confronts your nose with aromas of wood, chocolate and malt.  Taste is a plethora of greatness.  Caramel, toffee, malt, all play with your mouth.  Strong alcohol taste that bites and leaves a strong aftertaste.  Very nice beer that you can sit, relax and enjoy.

Pours dark amber brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma is dark fruits, including prune and raisin, with candi sugar and caramel coming through as well.  Flavor is semisweet with molasses, caramel, toffee and dark fruits coming through with hints of chocolate.  Pretty good.
Bottle: malty, some prunes, brown suger notes, cinnamon, mild coffee and chocolate, some nutty notes, light bitterness, the flavor is not strong enough, a little watery, pretty good.

Very dark brown colour, Beige head, low retention. Nice bready, malty aroma, notes of cinimon, sweet and malty. Creamy dark fruit flavours. Slightly arcoholic, really nice I could make this my Standard Belgian.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 Dark reddish colour with a small tan head. Malty and sweet aroma with hints of fruit. Very strong in alcohol which overpowers the taste of yeast and a malty fruit sweetness. Nice Winter Beer.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2010 (bottle) pours a dark ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. interesting aroma of dominant pear, with powdered sugar, pale malts and some oak. flavour is the same, mostly pear again, with some hints of walnut, but almost undrinkably sweet. medium body and carbonation.

Small bottle, pours a cloudy looking dark brown with brown red at the edges of the glass, produced an off-white to tan bubbled head that relaxed to a ring and sparse cover, there were small floaties in this brew, this ale looks viscous in the glass, aroma of dark bread, dark fruit of raisins and dates, a dark candy and brown sugar sweetness, flavors of sweet dark bread, dark fruits - raisins and dates and has a dark candy sweetness, there is pepper on the tongue at the finish, and a faint alcohol warmth on the palate, mouth feel is more then medium with a nice creaminess, this drink has lots of dark aroma and flavor, a very nice sipping ale.
Bottle. Deep ruby/brown pour with big beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, caramel and booze. Quite sweet, fruity, spicy. Another complex Belgian from Het Anker. This brewery is one of the best on earth.

Bottle, about 12deg. Dark ruby brown, big frothy head. Great mix of aromas; nuts, dark fruits, a little dusty oak cupboard too. wierd. Pleasantly dry, like a decent sherry, with a nice lingering bitterness.
Dark ruby with a big off-white head. Rich aroma of caramel, dried fruits and spice. Sweet and fruity flavour with a vineous warming alcohol.

0.33L bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Deep reddish-brown with a fair reddish-tan head.
  
Aroma:  Very sweet and rich, lots of dark dried fruits, slightly minty molasses and treacle, a little woody and vinous, slightly nutty, a little alcohol, so warm and inviting.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, fairly soft effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Just as rich and wonderful as the nose, lots of dark dried fruits, plenty of brown sugar and treacle, some molasses and slightly minty herbals, a touch of wood and nuttiness; sweet but balanced with a bit of warming alcohol, nuttiness and fruitiness to finish.

A beautiful sipper.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2010 Strong copper smell. Deep brown colour with brownish white, lasting head. Tastes sweet and fruity with chocolate notes. Tastes as strong as it is ∆ò.5%) but this bizarrely adds to the taste. Very well balanced. One of the best strong beers I¬íve ever had really.
Aroma of dark fruit and slightly sweet.  Pours a hazy brownish red.  Fresh flavor, malty with slight cherry and nut taste.  Overall, an excellent Belgian.

750mL. Pours a slightly hazy ruby body with a medium khaki head. Some tiny bits of sediment. Dark fruity, cherry, sugary, yeasty aroma with slight alcohol notes. Sweet fruity, spicy flavor. Thick syrupy mouthfeel. Finish is really sweet like candy with a slight alcohol kick. Really nice beer.

0.33L bottle, small head, brown colour with lots of red hues, aromas of coffee, barnyard, coke and prunes, flavours of dark chocolate, cokeand dark fruits, much to sweet and a little cloying, leading to a long but unpleasant sweet and sour finish, body has some viscousity. It is too hyped.
Got a big bottle at the Hop Leaf in Chicago to share with a buddy.  Delicious! Dominant prune flavor.

Bottle. One of the beers that really got me into beer. Pours a deep, dark delicious brown with a light tan head. It smells like a chocolate pudding in a glass, with a hint of caramel and is just as smooth in the mouth. The flavour is more complex than you might expect from the nose, having touches of cola, fruitloaf, liquorice and muscat. Great beer.

Oh, what a great smell and what a great warming sense of alcohol that just keeps on going when you take the first sip. Litttle on the hoppy and alcoholic side for me, but it¬ís truely a classic, like a liquer.

Pours a dark ruby copper with a one to two finger tan head. The nose is warm, sherry like oxidation, mild rusty quality, some spice, dark fruit. The flavor shows dark fruit, rummy, raisins, brown sugar, oxidatoin, yeasty. The palate shows a nice carbonation and spicy warmth.

From bottle, pours dark brown with a nice beige head that disappears quickly, aroma of coffee, caramel, nuts and dry fruits, quite balanced, flavor is quite dry and alcohol is too noticable, nuts, caramel and pruns dominate the flavor, sweetness is very high and body is only medium. OK

My Carolus Classic was very old (t.h.t. 28-11-10) when I killed it. Too old actually. Should have killed it earlier. Thin head, flat smell, dry and off-sour taste. No significant and present bitterness. Hard to say what is there, easier to sum up what is not there. Flat and ¬ílaf¬í. Drank fast, got it over with.

Bottle at Poechenellekelder in Brussels.  Deep brown color with a nice tan head.  Rich aroma of sweet dark malt, dark fruit, spice, and alcohol.  Flavor is malty and sweet with caramel, cherry, plum, chocolate, and spice.  Medium-full and smooth on the palate with soft carbonation.  Great beer.
