This one poured a mahogany brown color with an off white head. Aroma was rich sweet malts and not much else. Flavor was much the same, very sweet, but nothing sticks out to me at all.

Bottle, thanks to hobbersr for sharing! Pours deep brown, more a toffee color than cola, thin head, ropey lacing. Smells immediately like Nibs red licorice, loads of fleshy red fruit, sweet cherry, a bit medicinal, a touch of hops, bread, Christmas pudding. Soft, rich palate, more Christmas cake, licorice, mildly boozy. Great!

350 ml corked bottle. Cork shot up and hit my kitchen ceiling as soon as I got the metal wire seal off. Feisty. Gigantic monterous rocky head. Dark brown clear color. Very effervecent. Aroma of sweet dark fruits, malt, oak, and tartness. Taste is very well balanced with dark sweet cherries, dark malts, yeasty and a little bready. Maybe a little brown sugar and molassas in there too. Complex stuff. This is a great beer!

Sugary molasses, bread, and dark fruity aroma.  A good dose of earthy yeast to compliment the scent.  Medium brown color, good amount of lacing and  a creamy, lasting off white head.  Easy sipping, velvety with a medium to thin feel.  Flavor compliments the aroma, only not as impressive.  Still plenty of depth with a fair amount of dark, fermented fruits, brown sugar, fresh breads, and musty yeast.
Bottle from 3 Sons. Nice tan head, cloudy brown color, good lacing, lesssweet than some of type, , plenty of fruit, cherries, , and some citrus at end, which nice and lingering.

I shared a bottle of this with BeerBaron617.  I like Belgians a lot, and this one does not dissapoint.  I have actually have had this on tap at Ashley¬ís in AA, and think I prefer it in bottle form.  It¬ís a dark straw yellow with a thick white head.  Its aroma is sweet and fruity, apples and white grapes.  It¬ís incredibly bubbly, it¬ís almost like champagne in mouthfeel and taste.   It¬ís light, and refreshing, perfect for a summer evening.  I¬íll definitely be having this again!

Shared an 11.2 oz bottle with MereLikesBeer. This stuff is pretty tasty. It pours a darker yellow, with big offwhite head. The aroma is of apples and plum. The flavor follows suit, while also having a great champagne like mouthfeel. Good stuff. Cheers!

11.2 oz. bottle.  Pours a syrupy brownish-black color with a decent off-white head.  Combination of fig, coffee, a hint of cherry and maybe even a little dark chocolate.  Medium to heavily bodied.  A little sharp on the finish.  Very enjoyable once it settles in a bit.

330mL bottle from a group order. Pours a deep dark copper with a small tan head. No sediment which is something that bugs me about this brewery. But the nose on this is quite nice: booze, roasty malts, caramel crunch, some biscuits, grapes, an odd hoppy aspect, general sweetness, very complex and enticing, I like it. Flavour: Nice! Sweet grapes follow nice bready malts, some pear, toffee, booze but restrained, dates, figs, very tasty! Comes in complex waves, a very multi-layered beer. I was worried this was going to be a sugar bomb but I am very pleasantly surprised. Very unique actually, not at all what one might expect. Seems sort of like a Dopplebock with Belgian ale yeast used to ferment it, which is not at all a bad thing by my palate!
bottle, indeed dark and with medium creamy head. sweet and dark (chocolate, coffee) but not too strong a taste nor too sweet, which makes this very drinkable.
Pours a dark reddish-brown with medium tan head.  Scent of dried fruits.  Taste is sweet and strong, but not too powerful as this style sometimes is for me.  Not bad.
Dark brown coloured, wih a thick head which quickly dimininishes. Full aroma, sweet, coffee, caramel. Tastes bitter, hoppy, with a hint of caramel. Long soft finish, tasty.

Served in a Gouden Carolus glass, pours a brown head that lasts all the time and leaves some lace. Red brown colour. Smells of dried fruits, burnt wood, soaked earth, toffee, molasses. Sweet flavor, not much pronounced. Taste of dried fruits, spices, with pepper, cloves and nutmeg. It could be a greater beer, I found that it lacks some more sharpness or having stronger ends on both smell and taste.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2010 33 cl. bottle. Pours a beige head of good duration, with very attractive, curtain lacing, over a clear, reddish brown (SRM 20) body....nose heavy with dried fruits (raisin, cherry, plum) mild toffee, honey, mild molasses, also a tinge of burnt wood (campfire)....tastes initially of sweet toffee malts, then balancing fruits, again raisin and dried cherry, bit of plum, molasses, and a touch of wood balance, ends up slightly sweet....mouth feel is thick and heavy, carbonation relatively high. A lovely brew. From a 750 ml. bottle. BJCP 8/3/16/5/8
33cl bottle from de hopduvel Ghent. dark ruby brown beer, strong foam head with a good nose, good balanced flavour between taste and alcohol. very good beer from a very good brewer

This is how beer is supposed to taste. Grain and yeast along with nuts, dark fruits, and an almost creamy texture. The flavour performs judo chops on your palate, moving in unexpected directions, morphing like a chamaeleon before surprising you with its next strike. Only complaints are it could be a bit more fizzy, and it doesn¬ít come in a 40.

Smells a bit old.. some plum and must. Pours Brown with not head at all. There was little to no carbonation to this beer... I am starting to think that this is a very old bottle. Raisins, plums, burnt sugar and some nuttiness...

Very dark strong ale with a small tanned head. Smells of caramel candy. Taste is of nuts, smoke and oak. Very deep flavor with an almost overwhelming palate that keeps changing. Really enjoyable beer.
Nutty, smokey flavor that changes every second that it¬ís in your mouth. Kind of foamy texture.

bottle, pours brown with a tall light tan head.  Carmel malt, raisin and fig nose.  Dark rock candy, creamy roasted malt, and a light spice in the finish.  This is like a mild version of the Van De Keizer, but is a great stand alone strong ale.  Extremely impressed.

Bottle: Clear, chestnut-amber coloured, slim beige lacy head; sweet raisins in the fruity-alcoholic nose; solid sweet flavour, medium bodied, a bit sticky; fruit-cake and warming brandy in the sweet finish.Fine, fine.........
Bottled: Sweet malty aroma, burnt malt notes. Amber to chestnut brown color. Flavor is first sweet malty. Then light fruity with burnt dried fruit followed by bitter hop.

Hazy brown with an inch of dimpled tan head.  Aroma is dark cola notes with bits of apple and spice.  Taste is the same with candi sugar and coffee in the finish, along with a light tang.  $7.50/750ml

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2009 Bottle. Pours dark maroon brown with an off-white head. Very malty nose, starts as liquid toffee. Body filled with dark fruits, figs & plums. Touch of chocolatemint & liquorice in the aftertaste (wait for it). The palate is just perfect, almost buttery and definitely creamy with a subtle carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2009 This is not just a good old belgian beer. Great colour and nice creamy taste along wih a balanced alcohol percentage. A real shotgun made for every fan of beer! Pleasant surprise when i first tasted it! Pretty expensive but worth it. One of the best strong belgian ale beers if not the best.

330ml bottle into tulip glass. Deep burgundy coloured with a medium tan head and good lacing. Healthy aromas of nutty roasted malts with caramel, dark fruits and a trace of liquorice. Similar flavours to the nose with a medium body and creamy texture. Finishes with a spicy bittersweetness that lingers. Lightly carbonated. A fine example of the style.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2009 33cl bottle, dark amber medium brownish foamy head. Aroma is malt, alcohol, fruity (cherries maybe) some raisins and nuts. Quite warm. Taste like aroma. A bit spicy on the tongue. Quite sweet and fruity, hints of almonds. Palate is quite carbonated. Really nice and tasteful. Rating #84. Re-rate 090518 because first sample was bad.

Poured dark brown with lighter ruby hints.  Head was thick and near tan in color.  The aroma was malts, yeast, raisin and cherry.  Later on a bit of chocolate came out.  The flavor was raisin, yeast, malts and some chocolate.  Lots of carbonation.  Almost medium in body.
Living in Mexico, I thought that all beers tasted like that untill I tasted this piece-of-art. Once I tasted this beer I realized that no other beer in Mexico deserves to be called a "beer" again.
Pours deep amber with no head. Nose is full and sweet with dried fruit caramel and toffee. Same in the flavor with a lot of sweet finish.
Bottle - pours dark ruby,nice sweet fruity aroma.  Dried fruit flavours.  Medium body.

Pours a nice deep red with a 2 finger sized tan coloured head that clings to the glass. Aroma is slightly plummy with lots of soft fruit and anise and sweet licorice candy. Tastes fantastically complex! With sweet soft fruits, dark fruits plums, raisins, grapes, spices, licorice candy, molasses, apple, a nice semi bitter finish. Mouth feel is soft and extremely effervescent. Is it just me or do Belgians inherently know what they are doing? Really like this beer!
750ml, pours a reddish, murky brown with a large, tan head that dissipates quickly.  Amazing creamy mouth-feel.  Flavors of caramel, molasses, rum, dark fruit and a honey finish.  Really nice beer.

Brown Color with a dense and persistent Beige foam. Sweety Aroma  with toasted malt and coffee notes. Flavor is wonderfull with Chocolate, toffee and roasted malt notes. Mouthfeel has a bitterness that keep in mouth with a delicious end, a lot of toffee presence. Amazing Beer
33 cl bottle, sweet, fruity, not too complex, no head, brown beer. I would drink it again but it¬ís not my favourite.
33 cl bottle at Ris Ras, √Örhus - shared with Roger. Copper color, nice off-white head. Aroma is very fruity. Flavor is fruity and very sweet, hops and alcohol. Very dry finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2010 this beer is weaker, cheaper beer than the gouden carolus blue  i had previously fallen in love with. I just couldn¬ít help comparing.   I mean this beer is great and all, and for the price, it¬ís all the better...but i think i¬íll stick with the blue.

excellent beer.it is really dark with a creamy white head.aroma of dark fruit,maybe raisins and chocolate or licorice.flavour is stron but balanced with notes of wine and caramel,sensation of malt.the alcohol shows only at the end,followed by a fantastic sensation of sweetness

A lovely gurgling sound emanates from the bottle as it pours a dark, clear liquid. The smell is divinity touched with caramel and malt. A delicate taste rapidly gives was to malts which are then quickly pushed aside by beautiful caramel vixens, spreading their sweetness all over the room.
Thick, creamy head. Spices in the aroma. Liquorice taste. Great beer, but overclassed by its Christmas version.

Thanks to HogTownHarry. Pretty dark brown/black. Large off white head. Aroma: peppery, malt, slight chocolate. Nail varnish remover, alcohol. Flavour: chewy toffee, malt, chocolate, alcohol and shoe polish LOL. However it has a lovely long smooth chocolate malt finish. Lovely.
Apperance; dark brown. Aroma; malt and some nuts and a flavor that is malt and some fruits. Have to try this again.

Roasted malt and perhaps a little vinegar in this pour. Opaque appearance with a creamy head that stuck around for the duration. Flavor has some apricot, grapes, burnt sugar, toast, apple vinegar and was a bit grassy at times. Palate was full bodied and lively but also bubbly at the finish. Good stuff.

330 ml/11.2 oz bottle. The write-up on the side of the bottle said that Gouden Carolus would charm me, and it did. This is one of those commercially produced Belgian strong ales that is better than most of the beer produced by the Trappists. I¬íll be getting a bomber next time.

Bottle. Moderate malt aroma of roasted, caramel and milk chocolate, light herbs for the hops, and moderate barnyard and musty of the yeast, with hints of date, toffee and brown sugar. Head is large, frothy, very light brown with good lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky dark brown. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, creamy and has a fizzy carbonation. It finishes sticky. This was a very good Belgian Strong Ale, just a bit too much carbonation.

(bottle from fat cat, Norwich) Really annoyed about this one. Opened the bottle and foam spewed out of it, despite it having been stored carefully upright with no major movement. Lost nearly half the bottle, and, in the rush to pour it in, poured some of the sediment in. Had a dark appearance with a hint of red, and a brown head that diminished quickly. Smell was huge, sweet malty and dark druits. Alcohol too. Great smell. However taste not quite so huge. Had a sharp mouthfeel (probably because of the sediment) with licorice, chocolate and sweet biscuit overtones. Sharpness distracted from the taste substantially. I could tell it would be good had the pouring not gone terribly. Pity. I will re-rate when I have another.

Bottled, 330ml, aged 6.5yrs. Ruddy brown with slight white head. Full fruity strong ale aged into a fortified wine flavour. Some remaining spice, but mostly amalgamated into a rich, thick body. Some toffee, caramel notes in a sweetish finish. Overall a heavy, rich sipper, worth aging.

Mahogany appearance with a large, firm, tan head and very good lacing.  Multi layered aroma of yeast, dark fruits, chocolate and caramel malts.  Sweet, yeasty flavors with a variety of fruits, some spicyness and a passive amount of hops.  Well concealed alcohol in the full bodied, moderately carbonated mouthfeel.  Medium length finish remained sweet but not cloying.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2010 Reddish-brown color with a very sweet aroma.  Aggressive sweet flavors, ripe plums, some vinous tannins, with a slightly bitter finish.  The texture is not watery, in fact it is quite thick... And warming...  And a little too sweet for me to really love it.

Ruddy brown with a quick light tan head.  Dark ruby fruits, prunes, grapes, yeasty and bread notes.  Taste is plums, light chocolate and caramel, a bit thin but hides the alcohol well with some dark candy sugar notes.

330 mL into tulip. Pours a clear, deep ruby with a huge tan head that settles down to a thin layer that stays for the remainder of the drink. Not much lacing. Aromas of dark fruits, rust, yeast, caramel, with black licorice dominating. Taste is bubbly up front with overripe dark fruits, plums, chocolate malt. Lots of velvety mouth coating. Aftertaste is dry. Alcohol is non-intrusive but you can definitely feel this one. Rich and powerful but medium-bodied and refined.

Pours deep brown, almost black. Dark off white head. Aroma is very strong, full of plum fruitiness which dominates. In behind are prominent spice aromas,  sweet maltiness, yeast aroma like marmite and even some herb.
Taste is quite sweet, but not overly so. Initially the tongue is greeted with a malty bitterness quickly backed up with a strong spice flavour. Then roast malt, clove and herb take over ending with sweet caramel. Fruit promised on the aroma isn¬ít delivered in the flavour, but is still amazing. Finishes slightly dry and sweet. Beautiful.
330 ml bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $3.79 Excellent.
Pours medium copper with big tan had.  Aroma is sweet and malty, which is als reflected when tasting.  A big bodied beer, sweet licorice, very smooth.

75cl bottle. Dark reddish brown, creamy beige head. Very alcoholic, sweet candi sugary aroma with liquorice, aniseed. Quite dull sugary flavor with same herbs, little roastiness and alcohol. Almost medium bodied with smooth carbonation. Nothing special here, average strong ale.

330ml bottle, 9th Nov 08. Beguiling odour of dark fruits and woodiness, which carries over to the flavour, thick with treacle and thorough maltiness. Deep brown with a thin whitish head. You feel the alcohol but you don‚Äôt taste it  - a very good winter sipping beer.
Very nice beer.  Pours dark ruby-brown with a dense, rocky head with plenty of lacing.  There‚Äôs a wonderful sweet-smoky aroma.  Flavor is all yeast and dark fruits, raisin, plum, etc.  I like it.

This beer is suprisingly smooth for the alcohoic aroma and strong alcohol content. It is a Belgian "brown" ale with much the same charachteristics of a blonder or golden. Smooth with a good mouthfeel and non lingering aftertaste. Good Belgian.
Iron on the nose and flavour, creamy gold head, complex full rich fruit flavours

[33cl bottle, mille grazie Ivo] Clear, ruby amber colour with a big and beige foamy head. Sweet toast-malty and slightly nutty aroma with toffee, vanilla and a slightly vinous fruity touch of raisins. Sweet flavour with a light burnt bitterness, full bodied with a very creamy and pleasant mouthfeel. Aromatic, delicately toasty malt profile with notes of caramel, dark berries and raisins. Strong malty and subtle fruity finish with a pleasant, Armagnac-like finish. A very balanced and complex brew [19.XII.08].

Bottle.  Sweet malty and fruity aroma.  Hazy dark reddish brown body, creamy beige head.  Flavor is ripe fruit sweet, with plenty of caramel and malt evident, and a bit of intrusive alcohol.  Sweet finish.  Tasty, but not superlative.  Disappointing on the whole.

Bottle: Poured a dark color beer with a thick foamy brown head with excellent retention. Aroma of figs with sweet alcohol notes and typical Belgian yeast is easily identifiable and greatly enjoyable. Taste is quite rich with figs and plum sweetness with a thick body and warm alcohol note mix with lots of yeast.

pours a dark brown with a red tint, has a medium size beige head, and some lacing.

smell of caramel, dark fruits, some spice, and roasted nuts.

taste is a bit flat, dark fruits, brown sugar, caramel, roasted nuts, a bit on the sweet side, some malt, ends with a little bitterness.
Dark drown with a big head. Very nice wine like aroma. Typical taste for the style.

750ml Bottle:  Sweet, vinous aroma with notes of malts, alcohol, medicine, dark fruits, light caramel, grapes, raisin, and wood.  Poured brown with a slight hint of amber in color and a small, rocky, fizzy, tan head that greatly diminished.  Slightly hazy.  Slightly sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of malts, raisins, dark fruit, toffee, resin, alcohol, vitamins, and plum.  Medium body.  Mineral texture.  Soft carbonation.  Malty, lightly sweet, woody, resinous finish.

Bottle.  Pours a dark copper color with an extremely large, brownish head.  Hints of hops with main aromas of brown sugar, molasses, and some raisins.  Lively carbonation with an oily texture.  Acid aftertaste is a bit strange but overall not a bad beer.

Poured a dark chestnut brown with a small tan head which dissipated quickly. Candied sugar, roasted malts, and slight alcohol notes on the nose. Tasted of raisins and figs, dark fruits, hint of bitter chocolate. Sweet at first and moving to bitter towards the end of the sip. Medium on the palate and fizzy. Delicious beer!

Very dark brown with a bit of a nice orange tint. Less head than expected, and fades a bit quickly. Fruity, slightly funky aroma, molasses, caramel, honey and spice. Sweet, honey and brown sugar flavor, with chocolate, licorice and dried fruits. Very sweet yet has about enough funk to balance. Interesting and original. Complex, but a bit too sweet and cloying. I like it, though.

Bottle 33cl.
Pours a clear dark brown colour with almost no head or carbonation.
Smell is chocolate, raisins and spices.
Taste is very open and tastes like coffee and caramel.
Very nice beer.
(bottle) Dark brown, opaque beer with minimal tan head. Very strong aroma of sweet, dark roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice, and dark fruit. Flavor has chocolate and coffee, and sugar.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, on 2008-10-18) Dark brown. Hazy. Big white head that lasts long. Chocolate and malts in nose. Full bodied palate with quite a lot of carbonation. Chocolate, malts, some bitterness, hint of salty liquorice and some dried plum in taste. Long lasting aftertaste with malty and bitter flavours.

Bottle 33. This dark-amber beer is very sweet with a nice aroma of malt, sugar and alcool.
Becomes more fruity after some minutes.
Bottle pours a dark brown body with 2 finger tan head.  Spiced well with clove cinnamon.  Chocolate malt, a nutty aroma, and fruity esters.  Banana and vanilla.

Pours a heavy brown with copperish edges. The tan-brown head is thick, long lasting and nice lacing.

The sweet floaral nose hides a hint of alcohol and grape undertones.

 Wonderful taste. Very deep. The first whisps of carbonation hit you with rasin and grape tones that blend into a pleasant sweetness. The not too thin. not too thick mouth feel makes the flavors explode. The finish is alcohol but with lingering wine and vanilla flavors.

 I am really sorry I waited so long to try this. Excellent beer.

Bottle from Phil_l, via Beer Merchants. Thanks Phil! Deep brown with tan head that doesn‚Äôt just persist, but continues growing (slightly menancingly) for a good few mintues after the pour, requiring quite a lot of sipping away of foam to prevent glass overflow. Amusing. And the foam, tasty. Black pepper and green walnuts aroma, nice dry spicy chocolate flavor. Palate delicate and bright. Unfortunately my much more detailed tasting notes of this got deleted, so the waxing eloquent this beer deserved is reduced to just what memory held onto. Really enjoyed this one though, and surprised I‚Äôve missed it so far.

this smells like trouble!  sweet alcohol candy floss, mild instant coffee blend, with assorted fruits.
Reminiscent of a very sugary leffe with less banana and extra bread dough. some cake spices.

seemed menacing from the nose but rather a mild brew all told. looks pleaseat enough. symmetrical lacing
and red when held up to the light. Poured a dark tea colour.

It grows on you as you drink.  very smooth on the tongue, almost creamy, very little fizz whatsoever. just came back to the bottom of the glass and it seems that‚Äôs where the banana was hiding.

fine beverage, little sugary and leaves a full fat coke furriness on your tongue and teeth.

A king of beers. Caramel. Rich. Dark. What can I say that hasn¬ít been said? One of the beauties we can get on a regular basis and that¬ís what matters in this spot in the Midwest. We open one every now and then again....

Bottled 33cl. Appearance: It pours a beautiful clear deep ruby beer with a wonderful nicely lasting creamy beige head. Good lacework. Aroma: The nose is of cane sugar, plums, molasses, figs, raisins, dark chocolate, walnuts, vanilla, glue and banana. Rather strong and buttery with some petrol sneaking in. Flavor and palate: Rather sweet taste. Full bodied. A lot of molasses showing up accompanied by banana, raisins and plums. Very smooth. Malty. Low bitterness. Salty yeasty finish with a hint of onion. Overall impression: Decent. Strong nose. Smooth. Far from being great.
Red colored brew. Fruity, sweet aroma. Flavor is yeasty, fruity, sweet. Pretty balanced.

11.2oz bottle from Total Wine (Tampa, FL). Pours a dark brown to black with a massive tan foamy head. Good retention and glass lacing. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of dark ripe fruit, caramel, yeast, bread, spice, and maybe just faint hints of juniper, oak and pine. Flavor is much like the aroma with sweet and malty notes with rich caramel, toffee and dark ripe fruit. Generally full-bodied with a long sweet and malty finish. Nice ale.

Bottle, Ale Cellar, Darlington. Poured a dark reddy brown with a decent lingering creamy off white head.  Aroma was potent; vinous, with plenty of brandy soaked dark fruit with toffee and yeast notes. Super stuff. 
Full bodied and smooth slipping down.  Sweetish initially, then plenty of spice chocolate and fruit. Long, malty, slightly boozy finish. Very good stuff.

25.4 oz bottle.  Just clear dark brown with a fading off-white head.  Lots of lacy specks.  Nose is yeast, plum and raisin with an odd mustiness.  Slick and slightly chewy with a tang and a tingle.  Taste is toffee and dark fruits with jammy notes.  Dry finish with a touch of bitter yeast.  A solid Belgian Strong.

[Eyes] Dark brown color with a mostly discreet, small white head. 
[Nouse] The aroma is strong fruity with hints of banana, malt caramel, yeast, vanilla, and brown cuban sugar. 
[Mouth] Great Full body with nice and gentile carbonation, notes of flavors of sweet, strong fruits, sugar and yeast. 
The Afther taste is long and sweet with a touch of caramel and vanilla. An excellent beer.

Dark reddish brown, bubbly, with a thick creamy tan head. Very Belgian aroma, sweet raisin, grape candy, fruitcake. The great thing about this beer is the aroma tells you exactly what to expect from the taste. Sweet grape, raisin, fruitcake witth enough carbonation to remind you are having a beer. Alcohol blends so well you can be fooled into having a few. Have this one instead of desert.

Porco boia che buona la Gouden Carolus; se vi dico che mi aspettavo tutt‚Äôaltra birra mi credete?? Versa di un colore scuro bellissimo con schiuma beige chiara, molta e compatta; l‚Äôaroma √® complesso e dolce, un poco vinoso, caramelloso ma con sentori di legna bruciata e di sera d‚Äôinverno. Il sapore √® fantastico e intrigante, una complessit√† di cacao, ribes nero e crema di latte si ammoscia leggermente nel mezzo in un calore alcolico pronunciato per poi rispuntare nel finale e nel retrogusto. Una birra stratosferica.

750ml bottle bought from Brewery Creek and poured into a Chimay chalice. Deep garnet in colour with a full, tight, cream head. Malty aroma with cherry, prune, and raisin. Moderately malty and sweet taste; smooth with slightly bitter finish. Moderate carbonation and medium body. Dark, smooth, complex, warming.
Dark brown color, Flavor malty and has sweetness of dried fruits and a bit sourness in the finish

0.33l bottle into trappist glass. Pours a deep oily black with a small tan head that quickly dissapears.  Smell raisens, fruit and some alcohol.  Taste is sweet, chocolatey, raisens, prunes and fruit. Some carbonation.  Very good indeed.
Dark brown pour with fluffy white head and lots of yeasties.  Oak, malts, and grape on the nose.  Chocolate, leather, and pear. very nice beer

Bottle (in NZ), pours a dark brown with a reddish hue, and a large frothy head that didn‚Äôt hold on for long. On the nose we have some medicinal malt, wood, grapes and cherries. There is a tempting subtleness to the aroma. The palate is equally complex - very smooth, with a crispness through the swallow. The malt is chocolately and leathery, with a glazed fruit flavour. This is delicious!
Aroma is sweet and roasted. Flavor is also sweet with a hint of pear and toffee.

RateBeer Rating, Style and Glass: 97, Belgian Strong, Trappist, tulip, tumbler
ABV, Volume & Calories: 8.5 % in 11.2 fl oz. estimated at 200 C
Purchased at: Canal¬ís Lawrenceville, NJ for $3.50 ($13.99 Belgian sampler)

Aroma: syrupy, sweet, funk, mold. 8 out of 10.

Visuals: clear, deep red, long lasting white head, very lacy. 5 out of 5.

Taste: leather, salt, fruit, apple, no hops, strong. 8 out of 10.

Palate: acrid, plastic, long finish. 4 out of 5.

Overall: Seems like a very good brown ale. I¬íd have it again, and it¬ís very good. Well crafted, and the best of the three I tried so far. 17 out of 20.

0,75 l bottle. Medium, liht beige head is a bit soapy. Liquid is deep red and hazy. Fruity aroma has banana, peach, yeast and caramel malts. A hint of roastedness and burned sugar. The finis has clear nutty aromas. Flavor malty and has sweetness of dried fruits and a bit sourness in the finish. Not much bitterness. Carbonated but soft mouthfeel, thick and a bit sticky in the finish.  Overall a great beer.

750 mL bottle from Market Street Wine Shop Downtown. Dark brown color with a huge head. Good retention and lacing. Aroma of yeast, fruitiness, candi sugar, tobacco and alcohol. Flavor of brown sugar, dark fruits, candi sugar. Alcohol is well hidden. Full bodied.
Bottle. Dark brown beer, creamy beige head. Aroma is very sweet, like a candy stick. Taste is the same, extremely sweet with a alcohol bitter finish. Some roasted malts. Way too sweet.

Far too sweet for my taste, with a sour aftertaste to it. Nice dark pour with a rich head and fruity aromas and flavors. Some berry flavor, honey, caramel, etc. Not my favorite beer--the sweetness is almost cloying, as others have mentioned. But I‚Äôm glad I gave it a try.
Brown with red hues. Off-white vanishing head. Sweet malty aroma, lingering from licorice to weak hints of berries and chocolate. Well bodied, a bit cloying. Nice but lack deepness.

Bottle,
While this has quite nice complex aroma, for me the palate is far too sweet, and a little cloying, Just too sweet for me.

Rich brown, tan head with very nice lacing.  Nose is plum, raisin, caramel, tons of other dark fruits, yeast, honey, sweet heaven.  Flavor is yeast, toffee, caramel, tobacco and dark fruits, rich malt.  A bit of hoppiness comes out in the finish, along with more yeast and a very rich fruit pit flavor. Body is stunning - very soft, turning to ultra light bubbliness when it hits my tongue.  Just wow.

Deep dark red with a microbubbly head that lasts and leaves a very appealing lacing.  Roasted malts, mixed with chives and an earthy touch in the nose.  Malty warm caramel and butter toffee taste wars a bit with alcoholic bite.  Clean finish.  The booziness is unbalancing, rather nice none the less.  I prefered it to the Carolus Tripple which supprised me.

Bottle. poured dark reddish brown with a fluffy beige head. Very fruity aroma with notes of yeast, candy, caramel and malts. Flavour is dark fruits, berries, dark brown sugar and caramel. Great mouthfeel.
pours a dark red with a light med head. Aroma of fruit and some yeast. Very sweet taste with a light alco which adds to the flavour.
Reddish brown colour with a medium head. Aroma is yeast and fruits. The flavour is fruity, yeasty and a bit sweet with notes of alcohol. Smooth medium-bodied beer. Very tasty Belgian strong ale.

Deep red color with big, cloudy, lacy, beige head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, malty with some berries and alcohol hints. Flavor is sweet, raisiny, syrupy roasty malty, spicy, some licorice with drie fruits and alcohol hints. Full-bodied, alcholic and foamy carbonated palate.
Dark brown colour, small tan head. Aroma has malts and some fruits. Flavour is of roasted malts, spices and some fruits. Nice one.
330 ml bottle. dark brown colour. creamy head. I love these belgian strong ales, but this is not one of the best
There is  a dark fruit flavor and aroma to this beer. It also seems to take on characteristics of an alcohol-laden Butterfinger candy bar.
33cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, clear, good head, good brew, but not a topper
Sweet dark fruits, candi sugar and some alcohol in aroma. Flavor is sweet dark fruits, plums, raisins, candi sugar and some alcohol. Smooth, warming palate.

Cork and cage - deep mahogany pour with a creamy off white head.  This beer is pretty much just a malt bomb.  Candi sugar, toffee, caramel, prunes, port.  Dried dark fruit flavor - raisins prunes.  A moment of grapefruit, abrupt bitter finish.
Really nice pour, dark brown with a nice bit of lace. Fruity, with sherry-like nice dryness that sets nicely as a contrast to the molasses malt sweetness.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy well carbonated dark nut brown, with a large firm tan fantastic head. Nose is sweet with dark fruit, plum and blackberry, and just a hint of alcohol. Taste is spicy- like an Orval. Sweet with a roast coffeeish taste and a bitter finish that lingers. Dry. Certainly complex
330ml bottle. Pours reddish brown in color with brown head. Aroma sweet, fruity and malty. Taste roasted malt, raisin and dry with dry finish.
emperor¬ís brew, well than the emperor must not had any fucking taste. hey empreror are you drinking beer or licking cheap ass, hello you are an emperor like i am john holmes

Pours mahogany with a small off-white head. Bready malts and dark fruit dominate the nose. Sweet but salty coffee-like flavor. The palate is a little thick for the flavor, and the beer isn‚Äôt as smooth as hoped. Standard.

Bottle from Sam at Stuffed Sandwich.  God only knows how many years old it was, but it was aged to perfection.  Dark, smooth, ripe with figs, dates, raisin, dark sugar, no roastiness.  Tasted like a malt liquor cold-brewed by the Lord Almighty.  Just the thing to cap off a pile of polish sausage and three mortal beers.

Appearance: Chestnut brown. Not much head.
Aroma: Dark fruit. Prunes, raisins. Malty.
Taste: Again, dark fruit. Prunes. Some malt. Slight mocha-taste.
Info: 330ml bottle, 5/12-2006, 119/500

Little bottle. Pours fairly dark, kind of a mahogany and a decent head even in a Trappist glass. The aroma is sweet, malty, with light esters. Subtle hints of clove, coriander, banana, chocolate pudding are all hinted. It¬ís a soft, rounded aroma with little to no sharpness or bitterness. The flavor is much the same with a sweet, malty back bone highlighted by yeasty notes. The only suggestion of dryness is faint in the finish, this is definitely a juicy brew. Along with the spicy esters I get delicate hints of fruits: pears, grapes. This is a very well executed Belgian brew.

750 ml bottle from Wine Specialist. Nice mahogany color with a rapidly diminishing beige/tan head. Rich malty aroma with a little yeast. Near medium body with creamy carbonation. The flavor is sweet malt with some medium dark fruit. Finish is more sweet than dry, but there is a little bitter. I think it is really delicious.

Bottled. Pours dark brown with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malt, strong sweet belgian yeast, and a hint of bubble gum. Flavor is sweet, smooth malt, slightly buttery, and really reminds me of Westmalle Dubbel. Body had the perfect balance for a belgian.

750 ml botte. A cloudy dark brown beer with a medium sized and quite persistent beige head, leaving laces on the glass. The aroma is malty, with fruity (plum) and spicy notes and a touch of alcohol. The flavour is powerful, intense, malty, with notes of plums, chocolate and light alcohol. Quite sweet with hops not in evidence. However not sticky or filling. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, long finish with light bitterness. Very good.

Sampled from bomber: pours a hearty mahogany colour with a full tan head. Aroma is semi-sweet, nutty, with accents of oak, tropical fruit and wheat. Taste is comfortable, well carbonated, and smooth on the palate.
Pours a dark redish brown with a nice thick tan foamy head. Aroma of malt and dark friut. Taste of raisan and caramel. Sweet and nicly cabonated.
Delicioius.  I love the Carolus beers. Pours a typical amber color with a foamy head. Aromas are malty and caramel.  Tongue is full of dried fruit and sweetness.  Nice job.
This is an average Belgium Beer in my opinion. It represents the style well and is fairly well balanced for a beer of 8.5%. A little too sweet for my taste and not as complex as other Belgium Beers.
Dark amber with thin white head.  Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, brown sugar and fruit.  Taste is sweet and fruity with brown sugar mixed in.  Solid Belgian beer.

Bottle: pours dark brown color and has a head that retains.  Nice aroma consisting of prunes and red wine.  Very smooth and thick beer.  Has a wonderful sweet flavor reminiscent of dry molasses and prune juice.  The sweet flavor is balanced by hops that make it slightly bitter, but the sweet flavor wins out.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2012 Rich and hearty and full of classy brown ale flavors.  A little toasty, but it is subtle.  This is a filling beer.  The ending is sweet, and not nearly as dry as some other classic browns like, say, Corsendonk dubbel.

330 ml bottle from a trade with hogtownharry. pours deep maroon with a small tan head that fades quickly. big dark fruit aromas with yeast and  a touch of cheese. flavours are all raison and fig. some yeast crosses the palate but the complex fruit display is far more noticable as the brew warms and diminishes all other flavours. darn good stuff. thanks harry!

Bottle. Poured dark red brown with a slight beige head. Great aroma with malt, fruits (pears / bananas) and some smokiness. Full bodied, even sticky; well carbonated. The flavour is bold; predominantly dark malt / toffee with fruity / estery flavours, sweetness and bitterness. There is a very long finish primarily of pleasant bitterness and esters / banana / fruit. It is a very well balanced and enjoyable beer.

Bottle from Party Sorce. Poured brown color with an average light brown fizzy head that lasted with good lacing. Complex  dark fruit, caramel and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture. Full complex dark sweet  flavor with solid bittersweet finish and a small bite of alcohol. Good standout brew.

Caramel toffee, vinous fruit notes, almost a hint of chocolate?  Deep brown/amber, nice head and lacing.  Rich complex raisiny, smoky toffee sweetness, slightly tart, mild hops.  Full, creamy body, nice smooth , long finish, with the alcohol burning and peaking at the end.  A fantastic beer!
Sample at Aarhus beerfestival. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are malt, caramel and dark fruits.
0.75l and 0.33 l bottles. heavenly good. dark brown with big beige head. hides its alc well. delicious malty and lightly hoppy and sweet. very good mouthfeel. sweet rum-liquor. Sugared dried fruits.

alcohol not very present for a beer at 8,5%
Brown color and sweet taste
caramel, brown, long finish,

Wow fantastic beer, Dark amber copper color, decent creamy head, decent retention.  Nose is alcohol and sweet fruits some caremel in there too. Flavor is rather malty , but also some dried fruit and even a little choc and cinnamon in the mix. some hops too. thick creamy mouthfeel. Great beer had at Smokeless Joes
dark brown with tan head.  flavor os molasses and raisons.  could use a little more time to mature.  this way on tap
Dark orange body with huge off-white head.  Notes of raisins, dark malt, and black licorice.

Bottle courtesy of hogtownharry.  Pours cherry red with a tan head.  Smells of cinnamon, cherries, touches of dough, oranges, hints of oak, some spice.  Tastes of figs, brown sugar, molasses, some alcohol, cloves.  Mouthfeel is full.  Some melon on the finish.

33cl. bottle at home: Ok, confused... its says unfiltered and bottle-conditioned, yet the bottle has absolutely no sediment on the bottom and the beer is gorgeously clear! Rich brilliant deep red/garnet color with an almost perfect creamy tan head, if only it could stick around a bit longer. Powerful aromas of dark rich fruits in sweet delcious cake... I suppose we would call that fruitcake. Plums, raisin, dried berries mixed with winter spices and light-molasses or treacle. Just a bit of dark Havana rum soaked deeply into the fruitcake. Quite sweet taste with black grapes and mixed dark fruit infused tea leading way to an almost lactose sugar quality. Just as it crosses the "too-sweet" threshold it pulls back into deep malt, dark caramel and burnt sugar. Finally reaching into light coffee and a slight herbal yeast. Considering it¬ís upfront sweetness, it dries out enough in the end to not be sticky sweet. Halfway down the glass and that upfront sweetness does start to fade (or you get used to it) and the beer benefits from that. Alcohol fades in and out through burnt sugars.
Pours a dense, dark amber color. Smooth, full mouthfeel, nice rich malty flavor. slightly sweet flavor balance. Slight estery note and alcohol character.

Boutelle ka piwa- Bottle at Chaucer¬ís. Poured a deep chestnut topped with a frothy, long lived mocha froth. Roasty, coffee, toasty nose with an interesting integration of dark fruit and banana and a touch of spice. Sweet, dark fruit up front, with toffee, roasty flavours and bananas with moderate spicing. Creamy and drinkable as hell. I went to Chaucer¬ís and ordered what they had....boy am I glad I did.

small bottle. aroma was a bit subdued, perhaps bc it was too cold. Looks real great. dark and clear. Flavor is fantastic. quite sweet, but lots of interesting stuff going on underneath.  alc. burns you in the aftertaste - sweeet. good mouthfeel, almost perfect for the style imo. perhaps i should¬íve rated it higher than this. but somehow overall it¬ís "only" a 16.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown/reddish ale from this great brewery with well balanced swwet from chocolate, caramel and other sweetness.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2008 RE-RATE: Bottle (330ml). Poured dark ruby brown with a large, dense, frothy, tanned head which lasted well. Aroma was of ripe banana¬ís with chocolate custard, yeasty malts, toffee, dates, sultana¬ís, vanilla and a hint of alcohol. Flavor was of toasted toffee malts with creamy/milky chocolate, caramelized dates, mild banana/clove-like notes, hints of licorice and a warming peppery finish. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation, a dry/creamy mouthfeel, syrupy texture and a good finish.
Bottle in antwerp ... Deep bron ... yeasty light roast malt ... belgian yeast... dark vine fruit caramael and plums.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2008 Another beautifully complex masterpiece. Buckets and boxes of candied fruit and a few minor vinous notes to follow the pride. Pours a beautiful thick brown like apple cider. No yeast what so ever in this one, almost like an extremely toned down sour ale. I loved it, and at a mere five bucks a 1pt 9oz bottle, I¬íll be picking this on up regularly, along with anything else I see from Het Ankler. I am so impressed with their beers I wondered how I haven¬ít had more--so many more--before.

04/04 0.33 l bottle at Hopdevil, Zagreb. Poured dark reddish brown body with medium brownish head. Quite nice aroma of yeast (banana, orange, dark fruits), fermented grape (wine), caramel and roasted sugar malt. Flavor is fine, dominated mostly by sweet caramel and sourish, pretty simple and leaves watery impression, although definitely not thin bodied. Alcohol is very well hidden. Finish is nice, follows the flavor, with its sweet accent. Although nice beer of course, expected much ore from this one indeed, as it¬ís favorite style from my favorite non-trappist brewery.

330 ml. Cloudy, toasted pecan color with a three-finger head that lasts and laces well. Aroma is earthy banana, caramel, brown sugar, and toasted nuts. Flavor is deliciously similar, with a bit of earthy-spiciness, scorched brown sugar, and rum trying to balance. Near medium body is a tad frothy with carbonation, but mostly smooth and dryish. Excellent, malt-rich bomb just like I like ¬íem!

(3/1/08) Draught sample at Zythos Bier Festival 2008 in Sint Niklaas. Amber color with a creamy beige head - looks lovely. Malty aroma with caramel, some roasted notes, and maybe some light hints of yeast as well. A very sweet and caramelly flavor with a bit of biscuits, some fruitiness and some alcohol. Medium to full body, a bit syrupy.

Dark caramel/amber pour with a decent, foamy yellowish head. Aroma of wine, caramel, and toffee, a little sour. Initial taste of apples with a smooth caramel body and a slightly sweet wine/alcohol finish. Very delicious and ultra sweet with no attempt at balance, but why bother
Pours an opaque red-brown with a yellow head. Awesome aroma of granny smith apples! Flavor is caramel and tart apple with an earthy finish. Noticeable alcohol but not overly harsh. Surprisingly good.
Deep mahagony colour, tanned head that dissolves quickly. Nice malty aroma of coffee, caramel and dark fruits.Rich and slighty sweet flavour, with a dry and bitter finish. A great strong ale.

750ml bottle-Pours a deep red mahogany with a nice two finger off white head. It has an aroma of belgian yeast, malts, caramel,  sweetness, and a faint tartness. Taste is of malt and yeast along with caramel and raisins on this full bodied brew. Very smooth overall a nice tasting Belgian.

Deep red mahogani with a high, dense head. The aroma is hard to define but is sweet and malty. Sweet flavours too with a bit of contrast from the sweetnes. There are traces from raisins and plumes along with other fruits and some alcohol.
Bottled.  Poured very dark w/massive head, had a great dark look and a sweet smell of fruits.  Very delicious taste of caramel, yeast etc.

Pours dark amber with fairly thick off-white head.  Nice sweet aroma with plenty of banana, dark fruit, toffee, and spicy notes.  Flavor is lighter than expected; I figured that I¬íd be blown away based on the aroma, but I¬ím tasting a really well balanced beer.  Sweet but not too sweet, with notes of dried fruit, caramel, yeast, and vinous notes.  Nice smooth body.  Very nice beer.

(33 cl bottle at 3 Sm√•r Rum, G√∂teborg) On March 12, 2008. BB 2010. Clear dark reddish brown color, medium size tan head. Sweet, phenolic, fruity and alcohol scent. Also medicinal and spicy. Spicy, yeasty sweet taste with a surpisingly light aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness. Alcohol in the taste is rather well hidden. Some metallic hints in taste and aftertaste.

Bottle. Very sweet yeasty aroma reminds me of wheat beer. Deep reddish brown with huge, almost white head. Very sweet caramel malt and dried fruit flavor with notes of berries. Peppery sweet aftertaste. Awesome foamy palate. Wayyyy too sweet for me to be a real treat. Well done nevertheless.

Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aromas of raisins, figs, candy sugar and licorice. Taste is sweet and malty. Creamy mouthfeel and mild carbonation make this real easy to drink. One of my favorite beers from what is becoming one of my favorite Belgian breweries. The more I drink their beers the more I love them.

At first, i was esceptical, but this beer its quite good, purchased at Mexicali Wal-Mart.Right on, the look its somewhere between red amber and brown,the head its a long-lasting one with beige color,the flavor its very alcoholic strong, the palate its somewhat sweet,quite malty.I recommend it.

Hazy brown pour.  Average sized vanilla colored head.  Aroma of toffee & banana.  Tastes very similar to the smell.  Not as carbonated as many in this style.  An enjoyable brew that is simple and straight forward.

Sampled at Delirium Caf√©: Poured dark brown with a big head that left tremendous lacing on the glass.  Aroma is of dried fruits, and cereal malts.  The flavor is confusing because it drinks much more like a golden ale than a brown ale.  Lots of pilsner malt flavor, and a nice hop balance, medium-dry.  Mouth feel was nice and full of tiny bubbles.  Different than other strong brown Belgian ales, but good.

Pours a dark purplish brown with a foamy beige head.  Wonderful aroma of chocolate, raisin, plum, grape, toffee, fig, and spice.  Extremely smooth drinking because of the excellent balance of sweetness, spice and chocolate maltiness.  One of my favorite beers.

Pours a cloudy dark maroon color with a medium light beige head.  Pretty good retention.  Really enjoyed the nose on this beer, not over the top candy sugar and fruits like some tend to be.  Got a bunch of banana, some light molasses, grapes, mild apple, with some sweet candy sugar as well.  The flavor was also nice.  Definitely on the fruity side as well, with the apple and grapes taking the reins and pulling along the malts and candy sugar.  The alcohol was masked proficiently, with a lengthy fruity sweet finish.  This is well crafted and very delicious.  Quite an enjoyable experience.

By the time I¬ím rating this, I¬ím near the bottom of the bottle.  What I see is that it is pouring a VERY cloudy dark brown color, with a light brownish head.  The aroma is slightly sweet and hoppy, and the head is a light brownish color.  The flavor of the ale itself is very sweet, and malty, but balanced, and the alcohol is definitely present.  A very good ale.

Pours a surprisingly clear mahogany hue with a billowy creama head.  Earthy, damp overall aroma, much like an old forest after rainfall.  Tangy walnuts mingle with moist pipe tobacco.  An aromatic theme of fruitcake adds some playfulness and tingle with its candied fruits and brandy.  An intriguing combination of coffee beans and cayenne pepper adds some drama.  Sweet and flavourful with a big chunk of caramel.  Pepper and lemon zest explode on the tongue, drawing into a leather finish, dry with alcohol.  Undercurrents of coffee and prunes run throughout.  Silky texture, mild alcohol, bubbly carbonation, just over medium bodied.  Diverse; bright and sultry.  33cl bottle, not dated.
Bottle, split with after4ever. Pours a hazy brown with a lacy off-white head. Loads of caramel in the aroma and taste. The taste also musters ups some spice and fruit.

330. Pours an opaque dark brown with a thick, moussy, dark tan head. Ultra-buttery, butterscotchy nose, tons of caramel. Super-candy-bar-like. Booze and dark fruit there as well without a doubt. Nice medium body, a little creamy, very soothing and almost quenching. Liquer-like. Complex fruit, candy, and booze mid-palate, same as the nose. Airy butterscotch finish. All the butter/butterscotch business does not seem like diacetyl, though it might well be--whatever it is, it feels appropriate enough to the drink.

Flaske. M√∏rk √∏l, med en flot duft af frugt. Men smagen er al for s√∏d. Enten var det mine smagsl√∏g der var blevet skudt, eller ogs√• var der h√¶ldt dobbel s√• meget sukker i denne √∏l end hvad der var meningen. √Ürgeligt da det blev for meget.

Had this a zillion times. Love this brewery. This has the ,uh oh, "classic" nose that a good BSA is supposed to have. Lots of exotic spices and very ripe fruit. A good Tripel or BSA always seems to have the same flavors. Very ripe bananas and coriander or someting. Very Good beer

Pours a nice deep brown with a creamy, slowly-falling tan head that leaves a litle lace.  Smells of fruit and light caramel.  Taste is semi-sweet with burnt coffe and some chocolate flavors.  There is a strange aftertaste I cannot quite put my finger on (not unpleasant, just hard to describe).  The alcohol comes through nicely.  A very good beer, and one that I will drink again.

July 2006 - Label was Carolus D¬íOr.  Really sweet strong aroma.  Nice fluffy head with some lace.  Flavor was good, not great.  Very sweet from dark fruit (raisins?).  Caramel emerged as it warmed.  A bit thin in the mouthfeel.

cloudy mahogany pour topped with a fluffy tan head which leaves lots of pillowy lacing. the aroma is similar to an oxidized sherry... sweet with raisins, wood, vanilla, caramel and a sourness. the flavor has vinous qualities as well... raisins, wood and vanilla. it finishes dry and yeasty with an aftertaste of skunky hops? medium to full bodied with a creamy texture and smooth mouth feel. it¬ís a bit on the sweet side but some age will fix that...
A dark beer of 8,5 %. Very malty aroma with a lot of caramel and banana. A beer with a complex taste. The flavor sticks in your mouth. The head is medium creamy.
Ruby red,lacks head and cover,medium carbonation,aroma malt,nutty,caramel,flavour,nutty cooked caramel,chocolate,tang really pleasant.There is a creaminess and the finish is bitter sweet and mellow.
Pours dark brown with light brown head.  Aroma of dark fruit and plenty of yeast.  Flavor matches aroma, but adds some roasted malt.  Light alcohol presence on finish.

Bottle. 
Pours a dark mahogany-red body with a long lasting, large, frothy, eggshell-coloured head. The aroma is very rich and malty with notes of berries, plums, chocolate, and burnt caramel. There are some dusty chocolate and burnt malt flavours with a hefty dose of dark fruitiness. Alcohol muscles its way through at the right time. Complex and very well done.
Dark brown with a small brown head. Aroma is dominated by fruity and yeasty notes, lots of it. Flavor is sweet of dark fruits with some roasted notes and only a sleightly bitter aftertaste

I tried this belgian ale for the first time tonite. I thought it was excellent. To me, it smelled like flowers and it tasted like honey. I am sincerely grateful to my brother for sharing a bottle with me.

Has a mildly sugary aroma, some what like cola, belive it or not.  Has the look of very light iced tea. Barely any carbonation. Odd old farm barrel initial taste but not like a lambic. Reminds me of the old country. Unique but alky is present without a doubt. A little rude and different to say the least. Difficult to swallow at times.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a hazy brown colored with light tan head. Aroma of fermented fruits, spices, and malt. Taste of fruity, caramel and yeast. Has a nice complex flavor with a light sweet finish.
Clear brown with medium off white head. Sweet malty aroma with overripe fruits and yeast. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, toffee, fruits and yeast. Alcohol well hidden. Ends sweet.

Got a cold so my usual rubbish sense of smell is ecen worse. Shame as this is really nice. Delicous. Slight alcohol flavour present but very sweet and lovely. Like Fearne Cotton. Just like the beer though, an obvious dark side. 8 4 8 4 16

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a brownish amber with a medium and fading tan head and a thin aroma of sweetness and fruits. Flavor is nice caramel sweet and after that gets a little bit sour. Finish is hoppy and sweet, but not groundbreaking. Just fine, not spectacular

Pours a brownish-amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of raisons, caramel, slight candied sugar, yeast, banana, slight alcochol, and some citrus hops.  Flavor is strong of raisons, figs, caramel, and banana up front with a dry finish of banana, yeast, and a little alcohol warming.  Truely a delicious beer.

Bottle sampled. Pours brown with a nice off-white head. Aroma of light fruit, raisins, and brown sugar. Flavor is full and rich with sweet malts, caramel, dark fruits, figs, raisins, and some spicy yeast very well balanced. An excellent belgian strong.

750 ml bottle from Bevmo.  Hazy dark reddish brown with a foamy off-white head.  Aroma of fruit, sugar, and mild spices.  Taste commensurate with aroma with the addition of a sweet finish and a sticky palate.

Pours from the bottle a viscous murky and muddy reddish-brown color. Creates a thick and tight, but thin beige head which fades quickly to a few isolated wisps of thin foam. Lots of sweet fruity aromas ascend from the snifter with luscious notes of figs, raisins, black cherries, banana, cloves, molasses and caramel malts. Palate was quite full and round with a touch of oiliness. Carbonation seemed a bit tame for a Belgian Ale however. Flavor is very sweet and just shy of being a bit cloying. The alcohol comes through warmingly to cut through the sweetnesss. Delicious flavors of ripe and dark dried fruits, honey, spices, caramel syrup, toffee and slightly toasted malts coat the tongue. Finish is sweet and warming like a port wine. A gentile but classy Belgian Strong.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2008 On tap at Green Dragon in Portland (thanks Jonathan)--Poured a distinctive brown thick body with a two-finger creamy, fluffy off-white head. Yeasty brown sugar and caramel aroma.  Thick and bouncing mouth feel.  Smooth and warming.  An excellent world class brew!

Bottle at Gollem, Amsterdam.  This was the beer that settled me in.  Reminded me I¬ím a puny mortal facing the gods of destruction.  I fought hard against the delicious esters of the yeast but was ultimately overcome by the sweet malts.  This is seriously delicious, kids.  Don¬ít try this at your friend¬ís house.
Rich, warming taste. Comfortably sweet aroma with raisins, brown sugar and fruits. Alcohol quite well hidden. Mildly roasted and long aftertaste.
rich brown color. fizzy tan head. nice malty and yeasty aroma. flavor rich and complex with chocolate, malt, yeast, grapes and spice. well balanced. finishes caramel sweet.

Bottled: Medium sized offwhite head, retention is good with a fair amount of lasting lace. Fairly clear amber/dark copper hued brew. Nose is lightly fruity, raisins, plum and caramelly with maybe some chocolate notes as well. Body is med/full with a nice carbonation level, lightly oily. Dark fruity flavors, raisin, grape, lightly sweet malts with some yeastiness happening, lightly earthy. Nice fruity finish with a hint of melon. Enjoyed @ statelineliquors last Belgian tasting 11/10/07

750 Ml Bottle-Clear amber color w/a nice white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Rich full flavor w/traces of cane sugar, caramel, Figs, dark fruit, & spices. Very good Belgian w/a satisfying flavor, though not as sweet as some. Alcohol is evedent, this is an after dinner, warmer upper. Very fresh w/a long spicy finish.

Nothing like expected. Nose is juicily estery, with overripe banana, plum, maybe strawberry, and a clove/cinnamon spiciness (salivating). Heading towards my top 100 and I¬íve not even tasted it yet. Aromatically heady and fruity, but not overpowering. Raisins, white pepper, caramel, more banana. Bubblegum and dandelion and Burdock rootiness in the snout and beyond. Swill and inhale. How can the mouth match that?? It can¬ít, but it tries with more cinnamon, heady fruit and Dunkelish plums. A banana, brown sugar and cinnamon snadwich of a beer. Slips down wickedly with a delicate dusting of spice. Clear red with a billowing beige head.
The aroma is of figs, malt. It¬ís copper with a tone of red, very dark. The flavor is malty, with tones of fruit like figs. The palate is thick and creamy - very nice!

Bottle (750ml) at work. Dark dark brown (almost black) - big light brown head. Sweetness, honey, licorice, metallic, iron, caramel, light light hoppy, raisins, dried dark fruits, berries, light coffee notes.
Brown colour with high fluffy head.Sweet fruity aroma with note of rosted malt slight bitter with nice mouth feels has a note of coffee really nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2007 330ml bottle.
Rich brown, initially thick beige head. Beautiful sweet fruity aroma - apple, pear, melon, glue-solvent. Gentle carbonation leaves a smooth creamy feel in the mouth. Upon swallowing a beautiful wave of richly roasted malt covers the tongue. Given the colour I guess I shouldn¬ít have been surprised, but it was so wonderfully rich a taste it really lit my eyes up. Everything in excellent balance - well mellowed maltiness, subtly winey sweetness. Two sips, and I indeed feel like an emperor!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2010 Beautiful dark brown colour and thick blond head. Aroma is pleasat and there is sweet malts, yeast, some bananas and a little alcohol. Flavour is slightly sweet and also nicely fresh, with yeast more bananas can be found. Medium bodied with appropriate carbonation. Beautiful beer, pleasant aroma and flavor, easy to drink, something missing but still very good beer.

On tap, from old notes.  Deep brown in color with thick tan foam, good retention and lacing.  Big malty aroma, little bit of banana and coriander, molasses maybe?  Flavor is very sweet, lots of dark brewing sugars, lots of dark malts, just a hint of coriander.  Very tasty, but VERY rich.
Pours brown with an off white frothy head.  Smells and tastes of dark fruit.  The aroma is spicy with notes of toffee while the flavor remains sweet.  Very smooth and drinkable.
Bottle @ Lowlander. Deep brown with tan foamy head. Aroma of dark sugar / dark fruits / chocolate / yeast. Taste is bready / raisins / earthy / honey. A very good beer.
bottle, copper brown with off white head, minimal lacing. Taste of malt, bananas, brown sugar, dark chocolate and dates. Ful bodied, long lasting and delicious. Impressive brew!
Bottle @ Lowlander. Pours cloudy copper. Nose Malty with notes of alcohol. Taste is of dates, alcohol, raisins, malt. Slight carbonation. OK but not the best Belgian ale out there.
Dark red in colour, huge white head. Warm yeasty aroma, can smell the alcohol. Warm blackcurrent and rasin mouthfeel, yeasty/bready flavours.
A warm, red/brown strong ale. Aroma is malty, sweet, fuit-like.  No ¬íwatered-down¬í taste here, taste is a fruity maltiness, a bit spicy.

Bottled @ Belgian Beer Caf√©, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. A redish brown beer with a beige head. Aroma is coffee, malty and sweet. Full body and strong maltness. Taste is malty, sweet and caramel. Earthy, woody and alcoholic end.

On draft at the brewery tap, March 2007. Deep, opaque brown with a decent tap head. Great aroma of dark fruit, toffee, marzipan and spice. The flavour inclined towards sweetness, with caramel, preserved fruit and almonds. This excellent beer had a warming alcohol finish.
Bottle: Poured a reddish brown with a bubbly carbonated tan head. The aroma is deep dark fruit and sweet. The taste is full rich sweet malt, caramel sugary fruit. Awesome beer!

330ml brown bottle. Best before date of 14.06.09. Pours dark ruddy brown, cloudy. Small swirly layer of tan foam on top. Not much lacing. Aroma is of dark malt, fairly sweet and raisiny with caramel. Flavour echos aroma, dark caramel malts, some chocolate malt, raisiny fruitiness, sweet and malty with a slight suggestion of alcohol. Dry and yeasty in the finish. Full bodied, fine carbonation.
Bottled. Lovely reddish amber. Nice sweet, rich beer, caramel, even blueberries. A little burned sugar in the finish. Nice.

Chestnut brown with nice head and lacing.  A very warm brew, with a presence of burning alcohol.  Figgy, coffee, toffee, chocolate malts pervade both taste and aroma.  Juicy fruits are also present, berries, plums and raisins.  There is a cherry alcohol warmth and a strange, almost coconut like finish.  Nice brew.

Bottle via trade with HogTownHarry. Hazy reddish-brown with a good sized off-white head. Very nice aroma - warm, rich and sweet, with notes of malt, dried fruit and dark sugar. Smooth, full mouthfeel. Big flavour of fruity malt, a bit of chocolate, some spicy yeast, and a slightly boozy finish. Lovely!

Bottle. Very dark brown body with a big beige head and moderate lacing. Rich sweet fruity malt aroma, raisins, figs. Flavour is similarly sweet with deliciously rounded fruitiness (more ambiguous dark fruit) light notes of dark sugars. Alcohol starts out warming but subtle, becomes just a touch more noticeable as it warms up. Smooth medium to full bodied palate. I almost didn¬ít open this tonight and am quite glad I did now. Very nice.

Bottle, 330ml @ Rustico in Alexandria VA.  Pours dark amber with a brown half finger tan head.  Nose is malty sweet and robust.  Taste is sweet malty, syrupy thick and really damn tasty, another great Gouden.
1/18/05. 330ml. Hazy amber brown with short lasting rocky brown head. Smokey, malty aroma. Sweet smokey malty  with some alcohol present. A little too viscous.

Pours a very deep and dark amber with a slight bit of cloud on it. Big head of course. Some lacing too. On the nose it is mildly sweet. The flavor is excellent. I would describe it as mature instead of mild. Kind of hearty on the start with a smooth fruit start, and then later you get a bit of the 8% alcohol, and then on the end you get a roasted flavor. Complex, but smooth, and not over-pronounced as a whole. Definitely worth going back to. I¬íd love to get some more of these and lay them down for a while.

What a great beer. Pours a deep burnt toffee colour, with minimal offwhite foam which dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is of dark fruit and caramel. Quite intense. The flavour is rich and complex and earthy. Plums and dates are present, along with the caramel promised by the aroma, and a warming alcohol note. There¬ís a light bitterness present which offsets the sweetness well, and leaves a great "just one more sip" impression. Delicious.

Bu au Festival Bi√®re et Saveur 07 (bouteille). Rousse noisette, petit collet. Arome de caramel et de m√©lasse malt√© doux, un peu √©pic√©. Go√ªt de scotch malt√©, des notes d¬í√©pices et de cassonades, un peu r√©chauffant.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2009 
Date: July 14, 2006
Mode: Draft
Source: Capitol Ale House, Richmond
Appearance: clear dark red, whispy off white head, touch of lace
Aroma: huge sweet ripe fruit aroma with strong figs and dates
Flavor: sweet chocolate malt flavor well blended with great fruity character, light bitterness in the finish adds just the right amount of bitterness

Date: July 29, 2006
Mode: bottle
Aroma: big sweet ripe dark fruit aroma
Flavor: huge rich fruit flavor, lots of ripe plum, nice sweetness, very much the sweet fruit but not the chocolate of the draft version

Date: January 26, 2007
Mode: draft
Source: brick store
solid lace, much more like the bottle with lots of rich ripe fruit and only a touch of the chocolate

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 17/20
Rating: 4.1/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4
Hazy brown-red body. Begie creamy head. Aroma and flavor is fruity, round, malty,sweet, plums and some yeast Also a slight feel of nuts. A small hoppy bitternes in the end.
Tasted at Deliriumcafe, Dark colour with amazing taste, Beautifull flavour such a big beer.
Bottle at Gollem. Really nice ale. Dark brown colour. Strong, well textured with malt, spices and sweet flavours. Smooth. Warm. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

33cL bottle from Aarschot.  This beer really surpised me.  The complex flavor was rich and sweet.  Honestly reminded me of a Westy 8 at times but slightly sweeter.  It was sweet without seeming overpowerful in sugar acids.

Deep chestnut in colour, absolutely no head whatsoever! However, the palate simply bursts with rich malt and spice and well balanced fruity acids. An excellent beer and no mstake, but I¬íd appreciate a bit of head..........

11.2 oz bottle.  Poured a deep chestnut color with a very thin little khaki head.  Nutty caramel aroma with some dark fruit sweetness, reminded me a little of a dopplebock aroma since there was little yeasty aroma present.  Mild dark fruit and caramel, and very little spice.  Alcohol is well-hidden.  I was a bit underwhelmed by this considering its high rating.  Will revisit soon.
scura buona sciuma profumi molto complessi cioccolato note dolci caramello molto riscaldante

Pours deep brown with a medium, creamy tan head that leaves beautiful lacing and is rather clumping on the surface of the beer.  Nose is strong molasses, earth, and wheat.  Flavor of molasses that segues into a yeasty, spicy (cinnamon and coriander, oregano) middle and a warming alcoholic and smoky finish.  Super duper.
From my fall 2006 notebook.  Dark brown body with a sweet malty nose.  Faint off-white/light brown head.  Sweet malty body with balancing hops.

Dark brown pour.  Looks like syrup.  Smells sweet.  Damn, I keep smelling candied circus peanuts in belgian ales.  The flavore is sweet beyond words.  Full bodied, but not cloying.  Well balanced.  Great BS ale

Columbia, SC - Green¬ís Discount  Beverages - 750 ml bottle - cellared in the store. Nice dark chestnut pour with a soft, silky khaki head. Warm, enticing liquor-like aroma. Hints of bourbon and brandy - whiff of molasses. Flavor is sweet and full-bodied. Pick up hints of toffee, brandy, molasses, caramel - it¬ís all good. Rich, luxuriant mouthfeel. Alchohol hidden well. Excellent Belgian - probably passed this one by several times because I thought it and the Grand Cru were the same - glad I investigated!
Really sticky sweet aroma.  Dates and caramel.  Flavor is quite sweet, but not cloying or fake.  Hints of very light nuts, like cashews, in the flavor.  Very nice.

Drought at Delirium Caf√© G√∂teborg.
Hazy,dark red colour,nice creamy head.
Aroma has lots of malts,coffee,dark chocolate,toffee,citric,caramel,and a nice alc-sweetnes in the end.
Flavor is almost the same,nice medium to big body,medium finish.This is a great Beer indeed!!
Pours a deep, cloudy brown with a thick, fluffy off-white head. Rich, malty nose. Strong malt flavor, lightly toasted. Nice alcohol warmth. Very, very nice.

Aroma/Malty-toasted, 
Appearance Head/Initial-creamy, Head/Color-off white, 
Head/Longevity-fully lasting, 
Body/Hue-brown,
Initial Flavor-acidic light, 
Palate/Body-medium to full
Verry good beer
Deep amber color.  Great malty aroma.  Strong spiciness with hints of molasses and brown sugar.  Great mouthfeel and a soft finish.  A nice surprise.

Deep mahogany-colored body, a large & dense head, plus copious lacing. Malty aroma, quite sweet, with lots of fruit, burnt sugar and vanilla, a complex yeast profile and a strong spiciness (cinnamon, nutmeg?). Taste is full and rounded with cherry and vanilla upfront, and more spice and a subtle hop presence in the finish. Full bodied, low carbonation.

11.2 oz bottle.    Beer is red-brown with a small but lasting beige head and lacing.  Aroma of dark fruit, (figs, raisins, prunes) and maybe some apple.  Flavor is really excellent with the dark fruits, banana, Belgian yeast, and sweet candy sugar.  Notes of wine or sherry.  Very complex with hop spicyness and faint bitterness.  Very rich in flavor but remains light drinking with good carbonation in a medium body.  More enjoyable with every sip.  I may even like this more than the triple which is not usually the case with me.  This is an awesome dark Belgian strong.  Silky and delicious.

Bottle 33 cl. Creamy off-white excellent mostly lasting head. Red amber colour. Moderate malty heavy hoppy aroma. Nice complex bitter flavor. Average finish. creamy palate. Not as great as expected but alright beer.

Bottle provided by kegoguinness. Clear red body with small, off-white head. The aroma is vinous, brown sugar, herbal, spice and plums. The flavor is slightly sweet, raisins, prunes, toffee, candi sugar and light spice. Medium body with soft carbonation and a warm finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Lovely looking belgian ale here. The smell is very strong, almost unbearable for me. Lots of fruits. Almost smells like something went wrong? Could be my bottle. The taste is easy and fine. Sits easy on the tongue and goes down well. The labeling of the bottle almost leads me to believe that it would taste far different than this, but it¬ís a pleasant surprise. The alcohol hit me as I neared the bottom of the glass. A good beer.

33 cL bottle. Pours deep brown with an amber border. Creamy light brown head. Aroma is dark, dried fruit and wineous. Flavour is dark cane sugar, caramel burned malt, wineous, sweet dried fruit (prunes and raisins). Not overly sweet but just perfectly present. Distinct alcohol presence. Soft malty finish.

Pretty bottle, 750 mL.  Sweet malty aroma with distinctive Belgian yeast, candis, dark fruit.  Raisins and light alcohol.  Clear red body with a creamy, lacing, tanned head.  Rich, sweetly fruity taste - berry, figs, brown sugar, a touch of sourish acidity.  Strong cherry and light vanilla.  Complementary alcohol.  Lightish-medium body is smooth and silken.  Dries out very quickly.  Lightly warming.  Subtle, elegant, and if not extremely complex, extremely enjoyable.  One of the cases where a thick body is unnecessary - this svelte little darling is much easier to drink!  Lovely.

Deep burgundy colour with a tight creamy head. Floral aroma and taste. Very rich and creamy texture but remains smooth and clean. The floral notes dominate the flavour but there is some malt and liqourice present too.

Pours a hazed brown orange with a gradient to a white foamy head.  The nose is big and sweet.  Carame, prunes, raisin and a really subtle fruity berry.  Creamy velvetty smooth stickiness with a subdued carbonation.  Big as sweet cloying malt.  Really yummy.  Prunes, raisins, a little bit buttery.  Definitely brown sugar.  Somehow, a surprisingly dry finish with a little apple tartness and a buttery finish.  A really lovely beer that I had overlooked for just too long.  Thanks Yaniv!

330ml bottle best before 15 02 2010. Liqueur-like nose to it, oaky, rich dark chocolate, strong roast coffee, cinamon and clove spices, some alcohol. Pours a reasonably clean dark bronze body with a dense offwhite head and lace. Body is far richer than the aroma would suggest, thick, emmensly rich, again, liqueur-like. Some dark chocolate roasted malt flavours come through, with a good amount of cinamon spice, caramel sweetness and dark fruits. Definately a dessert beer, very nice indeed.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2007 A full bodied great beer. A lot of taste and although sweet. Still a perfect beer for tasting. A beer you can save for years. Tasted this year a new one a beer from 1992, a beer from 87 and last but not least a beer from 1976. And still those beers are still wonderfull. A must have taste for everyone.
Dark amber.  Fruity aroma... sweet, fruity, malty flavor.  Medium body.  Very good Belgian ale.

750mL, no date.  Pours a clear deep ruby with a three finger creamy beige head in my Piraat tulip.  Excellent retention.  Aroma of candied plums and juicy raisins, yeast, brown sugar, slightly musty, and some light cinnamon or nutmeg.  Flavor is more musty and not as sweet up front as I was esxpecting.  Spicy alcohol and some tangy fruitiness show up as well as some fall leaves.  Lightly sweet roasty finish.  Overall, the alcohol is masked well.  Moderate to high carbonation with a full body.  Very good beer--nice and complex.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Dark brown with a huge, lasting head. The aroma has sweetness, malt plum and figs. The flavour is sweet, but not cloying. It has notes of brown sugar, raisin, plum and citrus just before the finish and after a brief pause it returns in the dry finish. A beer to enjoy.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2007 0,33 Bottle at De Muze in Antwerp. Dark brown. Cream aroma with mix of sweet and bitter tastes. But more sweet. Sligthli alcoholic. But much adorable.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with a slight red hue when held to the light.  Thin light brown head.  Aroma is sweet, bubblegum and dark fruits.  Taste is fruit, apple, figs, pear, molasses and alcohol.  Heavy feeling beer.   Not bad, but not as good as some of their other offerings.

I¬ím sorry to swim against the tide on this, but I did not find it appealing at all, hich is a shame since I was looking forward to drinking it. 

The appearance was okay, but the aroma reminded me of a mixture of cane syrup and alcohol. The flavor had possibly a hint of dark fruit, but it was hard to tell over the predominantly sweet alcohol taste. Finish was likewise a thick, sweet syrupy sensation.

Belgian Strong Ales are not my absolute favorites, but there are many that I have really enjoyed. Unfortunatley, this was not one of them, and I finally poured the last quarter down the drain...which really sucks given the price.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pours a very light cola color, off white head that is thin but leaves decent lacing.  Lazy carbonation activity.  The aroma is very sweet, almost a chocolate with a yeasty dough hint.  Also a hint of caramel and cinnamon.  The taste is very interesting caramel and malty blend.  Hints of spice in the background.  The malty balance helps smooth the high alcohol.  The mouthfeel is smooth and silky; overall a wonderful tasting and incredibly balanced darker belgian strong ale.

Fantastic beer, sweet & fruity nose, very inviting, so is the appearance & color, deep brown with a soft & lacing tan head, flavors of port, caramel, sugar & bread, had that signature carbonated bite that¬ís so enjoyable from Belgian beers, semi-sweet finish with more notes of caramel & yeast, very well balanced & enjoyable, awesome Belgian

Wow! I thought this was classified as a dubbel but it sure tastes like one! Beautiful dark brown pour with a generous 3 finger tan head. Aroma of yeast and dark fruit with caramel. Taste is strong and near perfect. A sandy mix of dark fruits, yeast, caramel and chocolate. Nice and thick mouthfeel that is perfectly carbonated. I need more of this!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: This beer pours a nice dark amber/brown color that shows hints of crimson in when held up to the light.  There was a two finger bubbly light tan head.  The smell is awesome, with caramel, coffee, dried fruit, chocolate and candy.  This beer coats your whole mouth and warms your soul going down.  The taste is extremely complex with carmel, malt, nutiness and molasses.  A very nice Belgian Strong Ale.

330ml. bottle. Dark brown with red highlights and a thick tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel, dark dried fruits and black licorice. The licorice really comes out in the flavor. Unfortunately, I am not a fan of anise flavored drinks. Bitter dark chocolate, molasses, dried fruits and some sweet spices round out the flavors.

0.33l bottle from a shop here in Split  Lovely dark brown colour with a thick, persistent spongy beige head. A pleasant sweetish nose that comes somewhere in between banana and bubblegum with heavier malty notes, spices, orange and a bit of cocoa. Not all that unlike my memory of Jacobite (albeit a bit milder). The taste is, well, classy. Lovely fruitiness, candified orange, notes of chocolate and weak hints of nougat, some weak roastiness and acidity.  Warming in the finish. Another great Het Anker beer.
Pours an excellent dark brown with good lacing. Aroma is full with loads of dark fruits. The flavour is sweet caramel with a touch of smoked barley.

In the 330 mL bottle from Beertopia. Pours a dark reddish amber with a thick yellow-beige head. Produces an outstanding intricate web of lacing. The flavor is mildly roasted. Tastes of big molasses as well. It is syrupy sweet, not candy sweet. The aroma produces a subtle reminder of Testor¬ís model car glue. Mostly though, the aroma is fruity pomegranate. Has a very thick palate. The beer coating resides in the mouth for a long time. I think that I get a subtle bit of soy. This is somewhat like fermented pineapple without the acidity. I really like it a lot.
Poured into tulip glass. Dark brown color. Roasted aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee. Alcohol is also detectable. Taste was sweet with hints of nuts and malt.

Rich, warming taste; banana, with hints of coffee, and noticable alcohol. Pleasantly effervescent. First few sips seemed to have a slightly unpleasant aftertaste (especially if you breath through your mouth - was OK with mouth closed!), but this vanished after a few more mouthfuls, and became very nice.

750 split three ways.  Dark amber in color with a medium to large off white head.  Aroma is very fruity, lightly vinous, alot of caramel and light notes of chocolate and alcohol.  taste is dark fruit, rich caramel, spices, yeasty and bready.  lightly spicy and a touch of alcohol in the finish.  Really nice.
Very pleasant indeed. Fruity with a hint of nuts and pudding. Creamy in the mouth and a lovely lingering finish.

Poured from a 330ml bottle into a tulip glass, dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma was sweet and fruity. the flavor was dominated by sweet malt and spice with a note of raison bread and just a touch of alcohol bite. A wonderful brew. I will try this again.
Brown, with a tan head. Aroma is malt, raisins, alochol, and lesser amounts of chocolate and caramel. Flavor is very sweet, with malt, raisins, caramel, toffee, and some spice. Nice, but very sweet.

Another Belgian I am glad I tried. Color is cloudy dark amber with a thick, rich head. The smell is weak but nice and beery. Flavor is zingy, with fruity undertones and a good hoppy kick. This is the kind of ale you don¬ít gulp down, but sip and savor when in good company.

Aroma e paladar queimados, com notas de caf√©, torrefa√ß√£o, chocolate, baunilha, sei l√°... Sinto licor em algum lugar. Putz, at√© o aroma √© cremoso, se √© que isso √© poss√≠vel.
